Nazareth Invisible - celebrating a year's worth of old journal entries crammed down the throats of the mildly curious. :)

Monday, December 23rd

I never used to be a social creature - what happened?! Now I've been two days away from my compatriots and I'm going through withdrawal! Had a rejuvenating conversation with David this evening over MSN - first person I've really talked to since we left. He likes Amy Warner, by the way...the Rumour Mill never stops turning.
I really should have an Issues discussion with you pretty soon here, Kitty. Of course, the mere act of my saying that likely negates any possibility of its occurring. That's how things seem to happen in this book: for "really need to" read "never going to", throughout.

At anyrate. Went to LOTR yesterday, but I was too tired to write; combination of going to bed late and getting up early. It's impossible to sleep in in this house - Lowell and I are housed in the loft, which opens down into the main area in the house, from which sound travels excellently, so whenever the adult members of the household rise, gather, and begin to converse (read: SEVEN O'CLOCK IN THE MORNING!!!), we are inevitably woken up shortly afterwards.
Lol, at any rate. Went to LOTR yesterday. Personally, I liked it. It's been long enough since I read the books that I could get over the inconsistencies, and while it was definately on the battle-oriented side - well, so are the books. Particularly The Two Towers. I mean, that's what it IS. I had trouble with some of the hack and slash stuff - I don't feel any need to see close ups of brutal, personal violence - but I could nevertheless appreciate the artistry and tactics of the battle scenes, and it was so obviously good versus evil that I could handle the killing aspect. My favourite things about hte movie, I think, that is, the parts that I felt were best portrayed, were the transformation of Theoden and the multiple personality disorder of Gollum/Smeagol. I thought that that, in particular, was very cleverly and elegantly portrayed. The Ents were good too, although IMO they could have been a bit more...substantial. Good movie, anyhow.

And today. What happened today? Well, today I became a grandmother...and not only that, but a raging one. Nana's in this...well, for lack of a better word, "political activist" group called the Raging Grannies. They're cute little old ladies who dress up in stupid costumes and traipse about singing (loudly and off-key) protest songs in various public areas. Anti-war, anti-big business, anti-Gordon Campbell...that sort of thing. General terrorist activites. :p (...Yes, I'm joking about the terrorism, but its actually frightening how much the Government believes it.) Anyways, they went down to a mall in Vernon to protest war toys, and Mum and I went with them, as sort of "Grandmothers in Training." We almost got arrested! It was fun...in a nerve-racking sort of way. And now I've definately done my civic duty for the year...which is good, cause the year's almost over. It's practically 2003! Isn't that odd? I think my ability to comprehend time ended with the year 2000. I've pretty much just failed to register the ensuing years. It's definately not the 1990s any more, I'll give you that much - but 2003 just refuses to make any impression whatsoever. 

At any rate. :P It's late (early), I'm tired, and I know I'll be woken up before I'm ready. 
Gnight Kitty. :) Happy Holidays and DON'T BUY WAR TOYS!
Terrorist smudges.

Tuesday, December 24th - Christmas Eve
So, it's Christmas Eve, and I suppose I really *ought* to write. It's traditional after all. I should imagine that journal writing is practically epidemic among female North American teenagers this evening and tomorrow. However, its bound to be a short entry; it's past midnight and I've imbibed enough alcohol to make me sleepy, if nothing else. 

Hunh. Do you realize (yes; probably) that tomorrow this book will come full circle. I wrote in it for the first time a year ago tomorrow. (Well, today, actually, but SHHH!) It's sort of sad I've only gone to pg216 in a year - maybe that seems like a lot to you, but to me it signifies that I probably didn't write as much as I should of. Had I been diligent (well, had I had time), I should have been able to average a page a day, at least. And we're at barely 2/3rds of that...not even. It all comes of not having enough hours in the day. That's the real problem with this world, you know? Lol.
Keep wishing Katy was here, for a number of reasons: 1) It's just plain odd not to have her present at family functions, 2) I'm somewhat jealous of her doing the stuff she's doing, even thought its boring, 3) most of the stuff we've done would have been more fun if Katy'd been there to analyze stuff with me, 4) I know she'd enjoy herself and I'd enjoy myself more were she here. David calls us "a couple", which bothers me because of the sexual implications of that title - however, if you take away the romantic part of it, platonically its pretty much true - we do everything together. 
Anyways. Stepcousins from Hell weren't nearly as bad this year - they'd matured considerably, which is good, cause it's ABOUT TIME! (See, that's another thing - I want Katy to have met Shawn and Steph, so she'll understand.) But seriously - Stephen was almost human! I mean, we only spent about five hourse with him, and the monster aspect of his nature usually takes a while to manifest, but I was nevertheless impressed - at the very least, he's a heck of a lot better at *pretending* to be civilized then he used to be.
And Shawn's practically grown up - it's sort of scared me, actually. Not him, but...the implications. Looking around that living room full of family, and realizing (my, this is profound!) that we're all 10 years older than we were 10 years ago...and none of us are getting any younger. The photograph has changed - we're growing up...I can remember so distinctly Christmas with them when I was eight - and it was an instant ago. How did we get here so quickly? Ten years feels like ages - I don't want to be there tomorrow!

...Well, Santa (in his various incarnations) is busy filling stockings downstairs, and I need sleep before the insanity of tomorrow. And so, on that upbeat, seasonal note, I'm going to bid you a good night and a Merry Christmas.
Em tasol!

Wednesday, December 25th. Christmas Day.
So, you probably don't care too much about the list of presents, do you? Here are the things I was particularly joyful about: sock, sock, and more socks!; ALL the Uncle Bonsai CDs currently available; a stupid hat (like Cayley's) with bright stripy colours; and recipe cards! Yeah! For some reason, even though the physical and psychological act of Growing Up and Moving Out scares me, the actual living on my own/ cooking/ etc, is sort of exciting. :) Anyways - that's a year away yet, and I simply must pretend that that's a considerable period of time, or I'll go completely insane and become paralyzed.

Tennyrate. This is the first Christmas I've ever had that I didn't wake up early almost accidentally. Lowell had to wake me up! It's so weird.
Christmas is such an anticlimax, you know? I mean, there's SO much hype, and build-up of anticipation, and there's not that much to it, really. This Christmas season hasn't felt like Christmas to me at all. I've been too busy to register it properly...I dunno. It's not that I'm ever disappointed by Christmas - I never want much, and I'm always perfectly pleased by what I receive - particularly this year. And I figure that's not really what it's about anyway. But I've never understood what all the big deal's about; like, what the point? I dunno.

Anyways, what was the philosophical point this evening? There was one - thought of it on the way back from Bruce and Anita's this evening, but now it's gone. Oh well. It was a good one too. 
...I'm an odd duckling, aren't I? I really don't think very many people can possibly think the same way I do...or the world would be a very strange place.
Going to play Bridge... G'night, and Merry Christmas!

Thursday, December 26th/02, Boxing Day
Fifty-one years of things that might be useful
Boxes full of memories and fears
Tinted smiles fading but still youthful
Stowed in attics for another fifty years

Everything around you turn to dust, yes
Everything around you turns to sand
And maybe it is only God we trust
And maybe it's the TV man

And everyone around you seems nonplussed
Nobody can seem to understand
That everything of import's been discussed
And all of the surprises planned

Oh the only light is the TV light, It's the only light we see
And it's shining bright in the dead of night, Supervising you and me

Just some thoughts. Wrote (in the mental sense) the first stanza in the shower this morning. That's the best place for manufacturing lyrics, cause you're not worried about experimenting with tunes. That other stuff I wrote off the top of my head just now - I'm not sure if it'll all wind up together or not, but the first part's solid, and I'd definately like to expand it.

(Oh! Memo to self: Remember to REMOVE UNCLE BONSAI from stereo before leaving tomorrow. This is IMPERATIVE! ...And why don't I simply do it now, they ask. Cause I'm a dumbass, that's why. Watch, I WILL forget it, and then I'll be reading this journal aloud to Katy and I'll get to this part and look sheepish, and she'll growl and put her ears back at me - I swear it!)
Leaving tomorrow, as you can probably tell (hence the remembering of the Uncle Bonsai...) I FINALLY finished Biology at about 6 this evening. That's essentially 3 weeks work in 2 days. I'll frankly be amazed if Katy's got it finished...but hey, que sera sera I guess, right? Can't win every battle...and I seem to lose most of them, lol.

I'm mad at Tyler. I hope for his sake (and the sake of my sanity) that he's in Calgary or something. Otherwise, he's an asshole. He hasn't responded to my emails (like, at all, not even a "Hey, I'm alive") for about 2 weeks...I'm going through withdrawal, and it's SOO frustrating! I don't need to CUDDLE with him, fuck, I just want to talk to him. I haven't seen him on MSN in about a month. I miss long, pointless conversations so much. I hadn't really thought much about Tyler in a few days (basically been ignoring the fact that he's ignoring me), but I had weird (fitful) dreams last night that started me thinking again.
First though, I'd better explain Recent Occurences in this area...
Well, I guess we've been keeping on keeping on, as it were, for a couple months now. I said I liked him, and Tar Baby didn't say nuffin'. Well, that's not entirely true. He said he didn't know, which meant yes, but, which meant...well anyway, you know that part of the story. So basically, we were friends who liked each other and slept in the same bed once a week and had a marginally romantic (his words) relationship. So, fine. Eventually, however, untenable from my end. I desperately needed some definition, of something... So I sent him an email. (If you sort through all the crap, our email history - all 220K of it - is fascinating, lol...talk about bearing your soul!). I said, basically, fuck it, tell me something. Tell me anything. I said, you hold all the aces and I don't even know if you're interested in anything other than a platonic relationship with me.
And he responded with, I must admit, admirable haste. And explained. It was a 3K email, which is astounding for Tyler (a minimalist) and what it basically said was, Yes, he liked me, but he didn't want a relationship with me, certainly currently; to his mind, relationships of the romantic inclination are all-absorbing ("mind, body, heart, and soul") and he was way too obsessed with himself to be able to devote all that to another person. [[gawd...can you see the seeds of contention growing already, in retrospect? I can...that boy and I so never fit emotionally...]] 
So, fine. It didn't shock me. It didn't particularly wound me. That sounds shallow, but heck, I've been prepared for that from the beginning. That it got as far as it got is a constant source of amazement to me. That I could like somebody who liked me is/was/will be mind-boggling. Doesn't happen to me. And I've suspected too much self-absorption on the part of Tyler for a long time...I've been trying to get him to tell me that for 4 months!

...But I haven't heard from him since. ...I've sent him several emails, and gotten nothing. And so I hope he's somewhere else, cause if not, I know what he's doing. He's distancing himself from me. He's said himself that he's an expert at leaving people. And I'm afraid he's trying to cut me out of his heart.
But I refuse to leave. I refuse to submit passively to removal. Screw romance, on a purely platonic level, I like Tyler. I want to be his friend. He's an interesting person with interesting ideas, and he sees things from a different angle than I do, which makes discussions fascinating, if sometimes frustrating (the nature of Infinity, for example.) There are few people I enjoy talking to as much as I enjoy talking to Tyler. So screw that. Screw safety. I refuse to stop being his friend.

At any rate, though, on some level, my mind must still have been stressing about this, cause last night, as I said, I had a series of dreams, two of which were particularly vivid and which, in very different ways, starred Tyler. 
The second was nothingg. It was cute, fluffy, borderline romantic. It involved dancing, only there were two of me and one of him. And then he had to go to a dinner...I don't remember enough about it to analyze - I just remember searching and searching and shoving through people and eventually, finally, finding him. 
The first worried me. It's something fairly silly, and something I hadn't realized was bothering me until that dream dragged it out of storage into my conscious mind. In that dream, we went to Rupert...a vague "we", certainly involving KT and several others, although I can't see who...and we found Tyler...with his girlfriend. And he was everything I ever saw in him or wanted in him - for her. All for her. I don't knwo who she was. It didn't matter. She wasn't me. What mattered - what hurt - was that he had lied. To save my feelings, to save his image, I don't know. He wrote me that email, he strung me along for months, and it was all lies. And he saw me, and he was the most distant person I've ever met, like he'd never seen me before in his life - even though he'd slept culrred around me two weeks earlier.
It wasn't the girl that bothered me so much. It was that I wasn't worth telling. That he'd lied. That he'd changed, and hadn't bothered to tell me.

I never - I have never - asked Tyler for coddling. I've never wanted to be kept in the dark about anything, even for my own good. All I ever wanted was honesty. I gave it, and I exptected it. If I'm not worth that much, than what am I worth?
Nothing.
That dream bothered me a lot. I'm mortally afraid of being lied to, and of being laughed at. Those are the only two things I really can't stand. Give me honest and sincerity, and I'll do my best to work from there. Without that, I haven't a leg to stand on.
Anyhow. That's a rather depressive not4 to end an entry [[and a year!]] on, but I'm falling asleep as I write, here. I'm not really upset, and I don't really think that of Tyler. It's just stuff I've beenpondering, and it needed an out.
Home tomorrow! G'night, Kitty. :)

A lady from near Rising Sun
She flattened her boyfriend in fun
Saying, "Don't worry, kid,
That's for nothing you did,
It's for something I dreamt you had done."

-ogden nash.

Sunday, December 1st

An interesting (and brief) example of how Katy=me to an amazingly large extent. Last weekend Tuna was up (it was the Grey Cup, so Ian and John were here being manly with Dad), and we girls hung out. Katy and Martina spent several hours talking while I was doing choreography for Production (Aaah!). Katy discovered (and promptly forgot before she could tell me) a whole nest of reasons for why she resents Tyler and me...as in, the unit (as such there is) rather than the individuals...and Martina came up with an hypothesis as to, essentially, why Tyler "likes" me (sorry about the superfluous quotations...I used them to mean "for lack of a better word"...anyways...) dubbed the Elimination Theory. Basically, she thinks that when he first met us, he decided he was going to like one of us (cause its easier to like people you don't actually know, I guess)...and then he gradually worked through crossing us off: according to Tuna, she and Tyra were the first to go, followed by Jessica, and eventually Katy as well, leaving me. (Cayley being obviously un-available right from the get-go.) That, in essence, is her theory. It bothered me...a lot...but I let it slide so as not to hurt her feelings. But it almost made me mad. It...cheapens...the affection so much. Like I was the best of a bad lot, or something. well, I've already crossed off the rest of them and I have to like somebody, so I guess I'm stuck with her.
Gee, thanks. Can't he like me for me? 
...Which is funny, cause that's essentially what Katy said...like, the self-same arguements, phrased almost identically...a couple of night ago when we were driving out to David's. I'd dismissed the subect when Tuna brought it up, cause I didn't want to argue with her, but when we were alone, Katy said, "I want you to know that I definately don't agree with Tuna's theory on why Tyler likes you. There are too many flaws with it...and quite frankly, if I were you it would probably piss me off." And she proceeded to tell me my arguments! Which I hadn't mentioned to anybody.

Yeah, it was funny. Anyways. Really need to write, I know, but at the moment, sleep is more important.
Gnight, Kitty. :)

Saturday, December 7th, 2002
Wow. There's nothing like washing someone else's vomit off your clothes to make you truly appreciate the benefits of not being a DD at drinking parties... 
So. I have tons to tell (more than I ever will be able to), and I know I'm going to be tired and become irritatingly concise about halfway through, so I'm going to write quickly.
It's over. It's all over - isn't that an odd feeling? We work and work for 2 and a half months, and then in 24 hours it's over. Already I miss it. It just seems like such a shame to run three shows and then stop, just when we're getting the hang of it. Although, lol, in this particular instance, I don't think we possibly could have done another show if they'd begged us to...technical difficulties, don't you know...
See, right from the beginning we've been having microphone problems. We started with ten working mics, but there were several that kept cutting out, and by Monday this week (Tech Rehearsal) we were down to 8 semi-reliable working microphones. Have you ever tried to run a full-scale musical with a total of eight personal mics? Boy, is that fun. So that's essentially where we stood come opening show Friday night. There were other problems as well of course, projection and choreography being the main ones, but the foremost concern in everyone's minds was mics.
Friday show went quite well - in fact, I was amazed we had as few problems as we did. The house was good too - as a matter of fact, all the sales were really impressive. The count was 541 tickets sold for Friday night, where they're overjoyed to break 500. The Saturday matinee was huge, and Saturday night was sold out, which hasn't happened in a few years. At any rate. The show ran fairly smoothly. All the changes happened, no mics died...there was a bit of feedback, and Becca's mic cut out in 2-4, but other than that it was fine. The audience response was mediocre...there were lots of bits I found funny that they didn't laugh at, and vice-versa. Mum said that the major problem she found was projection...especially in the underscored sections, it was really difficult to hear a lot of the lines...which is a shame...
Anyways. Saturday matinee was...odd. I think it was probably our strongest run, but the audience was incredibly flat. Matinee audiences tend to respond differently anyway, cause there's so many kids, but this audience was horrible...they wouldn't laugh at anything. They didn't even applaud after solos, without prompting from the booth. However, in terms of the actual performance, it went very smoothly.
And then there was Saturday night. Packed. Sold out, as I said. And incredibly responsive, right off the bat.
I suppose that things technically started going wrong in 1-1, when Melia missed a line of her song. But that wasn't really a big deal. Then, in 1-3, the first large group number, we wound up off beat and in some weird canon...but again, it was okay...we got back on track, and it wasn't a crisis.
In 1-5, Dillon dropped his mic. As in, dropped. Like, it skidded. Across the floor...broken cable, dead mic. That's where everything started to fall apart. By intermission, a bell had been struck completely out of time with its place, we were down 2 mics, several glasses had been broken, props were falling apart backstage, and just about everyone was in a state of nervous collapse. A new (emergency) mic plot was divised - and the show went on. We pulled it off...but let me tell you, I have never in my life before experienced such a stressful two hours. The worst part (as in, scariest) was 1-7, the first Fairtone number. This was in the middle of several major catastrophes...so we went on stage without a clue what the fuck we were doing (our former choreography being completely shot) aznd basically made it up on the spot. Talk about adrenalin rush.
*Yawn* Yeah, this entry's been getting slppier and more rushed. Cast party...3am...I'm so tired. Need to write more and more. REminder to self - discuss Chris Yeast. And finish Why I'm Mad at Katy!
Gnight.

May I have your attentnion please: Due to a refrigeration breakdown there will be no butter sculpture of "The Last Supper".

"Well, if it isn't Hank Munson!"
"Well, if it isn't, his wife sure didn't seem to mind!"

*LINOLEUM!*

lol...Gnight... :)



Friday, December 13, 2002
Tired and dead, but need to write. What I really need is time. 24 hours is SO not enough! I've always got such immediate concerns whenever I write, now, that the long-term concerns, the real concerns, the philosophical, analytical, interesting ones, always get pushed to the side and eventually forgotten about. It's really not fair.
Areas of Most Immediate Concern tonight: Harmony, Calculus, and The Tyler Situation, which I doubt I'll get to, since my head already hurts and I know the second concern is going to take a while. So lets move quickly.

First off: I have a Harmony test at 9:30 tomorrow morning. Aaah! Wish me luck.
(See, now wasn't that nice and short?)

And now Calculus.
*sigh*
Notice the date? Yes, it's Friday the thirteenth...and boy do we know it. Math class today was last block. We came in, and sat down, and Mr Inglis just stood at the front of the room, not speaking. We got quiet, and scared. 
He started: "I went to the Doctor at lunch today..." and our hearts sunk. 
Mr Inglis has epilepsy, and lately - since about September - his medication has become less effective. It no longer keeps his seizures under control. And today his doctor told him he couldn't teach anymore. He's going on sick leave for the rest of the year, and then he's retiring. We're officially - like, as of today last block - losing our Calculus teacher.
It was very emotional. Lots of people cried. I practically cried. We were one of the very first people he told, for which I'm grateful. His doctor, his wife, and Mr MacKay (the VP) knew before us - he didn't even tell Mr Daniels, the Principal. (For which I respect him - Mr Daniels is an ass, and Mr Inglis has no respect for him - it's hilarious.) He said that if his wife hadn't been in the Doctor's office with him, he'd probably still have been there on Monday. It's so sad...he's been teaching at Cal for 34 years this year. He taught the parents of all but five of the people in that Calculus class.
Not to mention (on the selfish side), what happens to us now? There are literally no other teachers in Terrace who have the qualifications and experience to teach Calculus 12. I think what will probably happen is that they'll juggle Mr Cook's classes in C-block and he'll take on us in that period. Just so long as we don't have Mr Tupper; he's awful. HE known his stuff, but he really honestly can't teach. If he was assigned to our class I would seriously think of dropping - even now, even 4 and a half months into the course. I really couldn't handle it.
...We were joking about calling up Mr Inglis for help, and how his answering machine will wind up sounding...lol "If you need help with derivatives, press one..."
Well, I'm sure we'll survive. But God, this sucks!
Katy, Tyler, Chris Yeast...not necessarily in that order...
Gnight Kitty. :) Harmony test! Luck!

Saturday December 20th
Of course, the problem with this semi-narrative sort of journal, as I'm sure I've said before, is that the longer you don't write, the harder it is to start again. I'm writing this, to a certain extent, like a story, and so of course I don't want to leave out any crucial scenes or plot twists, or you won't know what's going on. But then, the longer I leave it, the more behind I get, and the harder it is to start in again because there's just so much history to fill you in on and I know it'll take forever, and all I really want to talk about is current events. So its a tossup: do I start right in with the Current Events and bypass the backlog altogether, or do I fill you in on all the in-between and put off the Current Events so long that by the time I reach them they're no longer relevant and I'm no longer interested? The problem is compouonded, of course, by the fact that I really am extremely long-winded (look at how much space I've taken up with nothing already tonight), and my writing style is quite narrative by nature - I eventually wind up in analysis and emotion, but not before I've spent a significant time in the story aspect.
Besides which, there're so many things since the summer that I have sort of glossed over without actually explaining - leaving poor you (whoever you are) very confused I'm sure. It's enitrely accidental and solely a matter of time constraints, I assure you, but...there you are.
Like "The Cayley-Hans" thing...old news now, and yet relevant to everything that's happening. But when it was current, I was too busy gushing about Tyler (there's another issue for discussion) to let their problems receive a word in edgewise. I have a vague suspicion that I've alluded to it briefly enough times that you've got the gist, but still...it never got properly explained, now it's too late, essentially, and I fell guilty. Of course, "you" are either me (in which case you know everything anyways), Katy or Martina (in which case I'm reading this to you and, yeah, you know everything anyways), or a nosy person leafing through a journal you have no business touching - close it at once! I have no sympathy for snoopers. I suppose the other two options are a) that you're a future relative of mine or b) this journal was published (!!), post-humously or not, and for some reason you're reading it. I'll hope, just for the sake of optimism, that you aren't a close friend or relative reading tearflly through my writings following my tragic, untimely death. (Ouch...sorry. Seriously KIDDING. I mean, it would be horrible if that actually were the case and you were...never mind. Shut up, Caitlin. It's just this damned morbid streak I've had ever since Hannah died last year. I've been thinking about mortality a lot since the Musical ended. Life suddenly seems so fragile...anyways. Moving on.) At any rate, if you ARE a future relative, I do apologize for not explaining more stuff, cause it must be confusing. AS for Scenario B (although this could apply to Scenario A as well) I think that were I ever to publish this stuff (although that in itself strikes me as a pretty stupid idea), I'd have to publish the Livejournal entries as well, along with several strings of emails, in order to properly explain things. It's really far too disjoint as is. 

Tennyrate. I truly am amazingly off-topic... I really did mean to cover at least one of the million Major Events that I'm behind on. Besides which I know that tomorrow night all I'll want to talk about is The Two Towers (we're at Nana and PApa's and going to see it in Vernon tomorrow) so the real stuff will get put off even longer. Well, que sera sera, right? I guess so. 
Smudges that are glad to have a couple of weeks off. :)
G'night! :)

Monday, Nov 4, 2002

It's a good thing I don't have Jazz Band or require a shower tomorrow morning, cause its 11:20 and boy, have I got a journal entry for you! Tyler wins the prize for sending my thoughts into emotional turmoil. He has officially surpassed Travis, and let me tell you, Travis was a hard act to follow.
I think I'd best just transcribe for you the email that was sent me by Tyler this evening. So here goes, word for word from Tyler's mouth (or rather, hands):

[for the sake of the privacy of the other characters in this drama, I've omitted the actual text of the email. Even though below I say I can't paraphrase it, the gist of the email is, "I think we're meant to be together, but I'm worried that now isn't the right time, and if we try to have a relationship now we may destroy what we might have had." Sorry for inconvenience and disrupting the (already erratic) narrative, but it doesn't seem fair to post publicly the private words of others without their consent.]

So there. Do you understand my emotional turmoil now? Do you see why that had to be written out, why I couldn't simply paraphrase? What's to paraphrase? He couldn't state it except through metaphor, and I don't think I can either.
Wow. Huh. That was definately not what I was expecting. If this entry is fairly inarticulate, it's because I'm honestly at pretty much a loss for words. What do you SAY to that? "Right, see you in 5 years"? "It is better to have loved and lost..."? In all my various analyses of his "I don't know", that wasn't one of the responses I had ever thought of. I was expecting much more flippant, much more juvenile, much more shallow. Getting...that...as a response sort of boggles my mind. I don't really know how to proceed from there.
And that definatelycounts as "Yes, but I'm scared." The scaredness is deeper and of a very different nature than what I had thought...I'm not sure what I thought, but it wasn't that.
I'm glad he finally told me all that, though. I'm not sure at all that I'm any less confused after reading it, but at least its a different, more useful sort of confusion.
I want to write and write and write and work it out of my system cause I know I won't sleep well, but I really have nothing to say - I've rarely, if ever, been this dumbfounded.
*Sigh* Everyone else's first relationships were straightforward and meaningless. Why does mine have to be so complex? And why do I like it so much?
A bewildered Caitlin.

Tuesday, November 5, 2002
I (very unfortunately) don't have time to write a real entry, which is a shame since I've clearly got a lot to write about. But here's an amusing anecdote from the day to pass the time... Lance sent me this Forward on Hotmail...yet another stupid Survey/Horoscope thing. So I did it, to pass the time. And it was strangely accurate, giving me such responses as:
A person you really care for is Katy
A person who knows you well is Mum
and so on. I have my own speculations as to why the arrival at these answers was not so much mystical as logical, but whatever. We won't get into that. At any rate, it told me that Tyler was the person I loved. Alright. So then (here's the funny part) the song title I wrote in blank 9 is the song that describes my relationship with that person at the moment: the song was "It's a Grand Night for Singing" from State Fair. (Hey, I had it in my head!) And here are the lyrics to that song: It's a grand night for singing/ The moon is bright above/ The earth is aglow and to add to the show/ I think I am falling in love.../ Maybe it's more than the Earth/ Shiny and silvery blue/ Maybe the reason I'm feeling this way/ Has something to do with you... 
So anyways. That was I found amusing! Talk about a perfect fit. And (oddly enough) the song that describes my outlook on life is "Me and Bobby McGee" by Janis Joplin. Hmm... Freedom's just another word for nothing left to lose/ Nothing ain't worth nothing but it's free... Not exactly how I'd describe myself, but...who knows.
Gnight Kitty.... :)


Friday, November 8th/02
Its stupid to start journal entries at 2am...so I guess I must be stupid. 
Why can't I have normal, sane, understandable relationships like everyone else? That would be so simple. Instead I have Tyler, and not a clue what is going on. Basically we've established that I like him, he likes me, and beyond that we're both kinda terrified. I was Tyler's #3 on the horoscope...and, oddly enough, also his number four. It's sort of against the rules, but he put me twice anyway - and says that the accuracy of it is eery.
...#3 is the one your love, #4 is the one you care the most about. Fuck, he admits it!
Gawd, I dunno. To tired to thing. G'night. :)

Sunday, November 10th
Fuck, so yeah, I meant to go to bed early...and now it's 2...I kept waiting, foolishly, hoping Tyler would come on. I was doing alright until this evening, but gawd, I miss him so much it's pathetic. It's a physical need. I need him with my whole body, and I know that sounds so wrong, but it isn't lust. Sex doesn't really even enter into my thoughts. It's a tangible, real need, a deep-seated longing for physical presence. I need to see him. I need him in the same place as me. I need to touch him, and whether I need that as an affirmation of his existence or mine I don't know, although I'm hoping its not the latter, cause that sounds pathetic. But I'm almost shaking, I need him so much. Every fibre of me longs for the security, the safety, of his presence. Soid reality.
The condition was compounded a hundred-fold this evening, and I suppose I should explain why.
See, Martina's been feeling really down lately, cause we're all here and she's there, etc. So today, on the spur of the moment, Katy, Tyra, Cayley, and I drove to Rupert to surprise her...
...There is nothing more wonderful and deeply satisfyinhg than seeing the look on a person's face when you have genuinely made their day. I love making people happy. Martina was thrilled. It was wonderful. We went to Brad's (the milkshake place) and ate, and went to the waterfront, and drove around, and generally had a grand old time pretending that it was summer again. To end off, we drove past Hans' house. And then we were on Tyler's street.
Now, we didn't mean to visit Tyler. It had been our plan to visit Tuna and Tuna alone, to convince her that we really do love her. And that was fine. I was psyched for not seeing Tyler, and I was perfectly alright with that.
But there we were on Tyler's street, driving past Tyler's house, and Tyra said, "Tuna, do you mind if we stop and say hi to Tyler", and she said of course not. So we did, only he wasn't at home. So we took Martina home, and got ready to leave. 
Only now, we wanted to see Tyler. I'd been fine with not seeing him, right up until we went up and knocked at his door. And now I needed to see him. I couldn't hold it in. We went back to his house, just to see. He still wasn't home, but his Mom was. She's hilarious. She told us he was at pit band practice, and let us in to rescue Katy's locket, which she'd left there, and search for weaters. And I have my sweater back! The original one; the best one. But we still had no Tyler. As a last resort, we did drive to the PRSS bandroom and get his attention by tapping on the glass, but it isn't really the same.
*Sigh* And now I'm stuck with pent-up Tylerness that won't leave, and I won't see him for another 5 days.
Somebody really needs to invent a teleporter.

Friday, November 22, 2002
It is my bounden duty to write: my neglect of this journal in recent days/weeks/months has been truly shameful. My current excuse is the Musical, which has rather usurped my life, and will continue to do so for the next two weeks (I can hardly wait for 12am, December 9th!) The process is fun, but astonishingly stressful. Today was a NID, and therefore our fabled All Day Rehearsal - the first day with Pit, and the first day with mikes. Understandably, this ought by all rights to be one of the most painful days of the entire 3 months; however, on this particular occasion it was actually amazingly productive, which is good - we needed a productive rehearsal. The scariest part at the moment is choreography...all of the dance stuff is supposed to be wrapped up by the end of October, and there's still half the Small Group stuff we haven't even looked at! *shudder*. Well - what happens happens, I suppose. And I know it'll turn out fine somehow - it always does.

What other straight news items do I have for you? Hmm...oh; Thibault left. Last weekend...no; two weekends ago. It's so wonderful...but oddly disconcerting...to have my house back. I got used to having him here, and it occasionally still strikes me as odd to not have him here when I get home from school. Nevertheless, it's wonderful to have free reign over the computer and my bathroom again - other people monopolizing my bathroom was one thing I just couldn't get used to!

Now on to the more philosophical (read: interesting) topics. The major one is something that's been bugging me for like six weeks now; I need to figure out why I'm mad at Katy. I should have dealt with this weeks ago - coming into it at this point is tough - its like the problem's grown stale...I've buried it; it's still there, lingering, fermenting, but is much more difficult to access and treat now. Ignore that metaphor - if I weren't so tired and muddled, it would have worked... At any rate, it's very odd. I'm mad at her - not always, of course; I mean, we spend all of our time together, and we get along very well. But I grow so irritated with her sometimes, and for such petty, non-existant reasons, that it's clear there must be some deeper root to the problem.
I know this'll sound stupid, but I suspect a large part of it is that I'm mad at her for being sick. I want her schedule and needs to match up with mine, and when they don't, it pisses me off. Fuck, she needs so much sleep, and she's missing tons of classes - and somehow people always seem to almost ostracize me for that...for whatever reason. Her attitude to education bothers me a lot, in that her goals and her willpower are in many ways so different from mine. It frustrates me that she misses classes, and doesn't bother to do homework, and sulks when she doesn't get stuff instead of actually trying to correct the problem...and then whines and gets depressed when her marks aren't as good as David's! Fuck. A) David's a genius, B) What does she expect with such a lackadaisical "poor me" attitude?! ...Wow, this is starting to sound a lot like bitching...but I do need to figure this stuff out, and get it out of my system.
*Sigh* I know that a lot of it is that she's sick. ...Oh my gosh, I was about to write "...right..." in a really skeptical way, which merely confirms what I finally realized a couple days ago. I know it's awful, but there's a part of me deep down that honestly doesn't believe that Katy's really sick. I was trying to avoid talking about this; its horrible, but then, I suppose that's the point. I know she's not right; there must be something medical wrong with her...but there's this rebellious, cynical, sarcastic voice inside me saying Bullshit. She just wants an excuse to go to bed at nine and sleep through classes and never do anything. She's just lazy, and illness is a good excuse and makes people sorry for her, so she's convinced herself she's sick.
Goodness, I'm a horrible person. I can't believe I just wrote that. But demons don't disappear if you ignore them. You have to first acknowledge their existence before you can fight them effectively.
So there are my demons. Now lets combat them, shall we?
An honest (and angelic :P) Caitlin. :)

Sunday, October 13/02

I suppose that harbouring exchange students (geez, put that way it sounds like criminals!) is a good thing...community service, horizon-broadening, and all that. And it doesn't much matter whether or not you're kindred spirits...
But I do not like Thibault. The longer he spends with us, the more I really just don't like him much. It's not anything in particular...or rather, it's many things in particular. And I think it's partly just that fact that he's living at our house - I think I react to new people the same way our cats react to new cats in their territory...with hostility. I'm used to the way our house functions with just the four of us - it's been that way since I was 4.5 years old,and it's hard to get sed to change...especially when the change is in the form of a male teenager, which is a type of animal I'm not used having to handle. It's strange. - and I think that, honestly, that probably accounts for most of my dislike of him. I mean, there's lots of personality quirks of his (mainly arrogance) that piss me off, but I don't think they'd bother me nearly so much - or that I'd even notice them - if he weren't living at my house, eating my food, hogging my bathroom, using my computer, laughing at my misfortunes and juvenile fits of peak. 
As it is, though...well, I won't go into it. I don't like to spend ages bitching about people in detail...I mean, I do, but then I always feel guilty afterwards. So, I'll just refrain.

Oh, and Katy was right - David really can be an asshole, without even really realizing it. I'd never actually believed her before that that facet of his personality existed, but after last night I do...too tired to write about it now, but suffice it to say that Katy is always right. (Duh! Now what kind of a dumbass comment is that?!)

I want Tyler here! A pining Caitlin.

Wednesday, Oct 16, 2002
*Deep, slow, calming breaths in and out.* Well. This isn't particularly productive, but it IS theraputic, and a little therapy is definately what I need right now, cause I'm stressing bigtime.
I'm sick...have been since Monday night. (Happy Thanksgiving, by the way!) It's a stupid, symptomless sort of illness - my stomach doesn't hurt, I'm not congested, and I don't have a fever, but I'm exhausted and shaky and tired all over. I guess its some sort of flu. I've missed the last couple days of school (Monday was a holiday, of course), and just finished having quite a good talk with my mother on the subject of stress/ missing school/ production/ life in general. As she pointed out, missing 3 days of school isn't really such a huge deal in the grand scheme of things. "Yes," I replied, "but it's difficult to look at the whole picture when you're only standing three inches from the painting." Personally I thought it rather a clever quote - my brother agrees. :)

I think I'm mostly better. I'm having Issues surrounding missed work and needed catch-ups and too much stress, etc...I spent 20 minutes trying unsuccessfully to go to sleep while my mind spun in ferocious circles...that's when I went to talk to Mum. She actually did calm me down considerably; it was really helpful, and I know she's right, about Big Pictures and all that. "Sometimes it's hard to see the forest for the trees."  Blah blah.

Who I really  need to talk to is Tyler. (Oh god, here she goes again!) No; seriously! He's really good at helping me put my thoughts in order, and at calming me down and making me smile. Not just because my heart "goes all afluttery" (although that too) but on a purely platonic, friendship level as well. He's an extremely calming influence...I don't think the fact that I haven't talked with him since Sunday has been any help whatsoever in terms of my sanity. Talking to him - even over MSN, even pointlessly - helps hold me together. I also really miss Real Tyler...much as I love Virtual Tyler, he's not really the same as the real thing...I can't wait for it to be Friday! Even virtual contact would be incredibly helpful right now, though. I want to talk to him about stuff so badly...some of it this stuff, and some of it pertaining to what for lack of a better word I have to term our relationship - or rather, lack thereof. Stuff needs to be said, and I'm ready to say it....but that silly child is never online at the right times! *sigh* A mental telegram for tyler: Please have a working Internet. Please get my messages. Please please send me an email tonight. Please be online tomorrow evening when I am. Please please please like me.

Smudges that are stepping back in order to get a more holistic view of the picture. Love, Caitlin. :)

Friday,October 17/2002
My illness can be represented graphically by a sinusoidal function, I realized. Saturday, October 26th
An update on the Tyler situation (right - like I ever talk about anything else!): I realized that the degree to which I like Tyler is dependant to a large extent on his attitude towards me. I guess that makes sense: it's a lot easier to like a guy who's affectionate towards you than one who's withdrawn. Tyler does both - but thankfully, mostly the former. This weekend (well, Thursday night - Friday was a NID - to Saturday morning, we were in Prince Rupert to watch a couple of plays being put on by Charles Hays - Martina was running lights, and we went to support her. And Tyler was...well, very affectionate and cuddly. And again, I'm back to really liking him. Whereas last weekend, although nothing was really any different, I got a very different vibe from him, and left that weekend feeling quite confused and unsure of where I stood. I can't pinpoint what was different, but it was somehow...more...this weekend.

I try to take things in stride and not read a novel into everything, but its hard when [he] brings you tea and lies down beside you on the floor and shares the couch (lengthwise) during the movie with you, and manouevres it subtly so that once again the two of you are sleepy together (in the utterly platonic sense, of course). I dunno. Kt and I were driving Martina to rehearsal on Friday, when she asked, "Are you and Tyler anything more than...you and Tyler?" I laughed at her and said, "Well, if so, nobody bothered to inform me!" But...well, I mean, we definately aren't going out. But fuck, what are we? Are we just friends who are physically comfortable? Or what? Does he like me? He says its very complicated and that his "I don't know" can't even be categorized under either of my two headings: "No, but I don't want to hurt your feelings" or "Yes, but I'm scared", either of which I could understand. Fuck, I wish he'd just explain! Grrrr.

Katy says that his attitude changes when I come into the room. I can't say cause I obviously can't observe the change, but her analogy was interesting. Once Cayley and Hans had come to an understanding, if you will, he still liked us of course, and he still hung out with us and cuddled with us, even with Cayley there. But whenever she was in the room, all of his attention would focus on her and revolve around her, no matter what he was doing. Kt says Tyler does the same thing - he and Katy were joking around on the bed in the motorhome and I was still in the house. But Katy said that as soon as I came into the RV, his attention shifted to me, and it was like she wasn't there anymore. I don't see that...as far as I can tell, he pays attention to people pretty much equally, and I'm the one who focuses everything on him. It's sort of awful...and probably the most awful past is that she (understandably) was listing that as one of the things that upset her, and yet my overwhelming feeling was of joy and excitement at the idea that he notices me.

And that's the other aspect of this that requires serious discussion and analysis. The KT aspect.
But that is happening another time. Right now, I sleep.
**A confused but mainly happy Caitlin**** :)

Wednesday, October 2nd

I should be struggling through more pages of incomprehensible math. I should be sleeping. Instead of doing either of those sensible things, I am instead freaking out about a stupid crisis situation over which I, at the moment, have no control.

I told Tyler I like him. Am I fucking insane? Cause that's the only reason I can think of for my total lack of judgement.  I sent him the email. The Email. It's entitled "Jumping on the Confession Bandwagon," and boy, I jumped alright! Actually, I sent him 3 emails in succession, first the confession, then the freaking-out apology, and finally (15 minutes ago) the calm, resigned, reasonable one. I feel a bit better now, having sent that, but I'm still going insane waiting for a response. And I'm house-sitting with Katy at her Grandma's house, which makes it even worse cause I can't go on the Internet every 15 minutes to check if he answered yet. (they don't have high-speed Internet - I sent the emails from my own house earlier this evening.) It's not like he's going to respond tonight anyways - he's a really slow typer, and not a quick response kinda guy, but it still makes me feel better to check.

Aah. Biting my nails - I don't do that; this must be stressing me out... I honestly do not know what he'll say. Katy talked to him on the phone following his email response mentioned in the last entry, but couldn't get anything more out of him than, "I honestly don't know. How can I explain this to you when I don't understand it myself?" ...which could mean so very many different things that attempting to analyze it is pointless. I really hope that he decides he does like me...or at least that he condescends to tell me his thoughts on the matter, cause that would help so awfully much. I just want to know. This situation is untenable.

The one thing I'm really worried about is how it will affect our friendship if he decides he doesn't like me. At the moment (or, up to the email), our friendship was fun and kinda sweet and sometimes flirtatious and often confusing. I don't want to alienate him! That's why the email thing is so dangerous...it's a definate gamble: if he likes me back, the relationship changes for the better; if he doesn't, it changes for the worst. It cannot remain static, cause its a close enough sort of friendship that you couldn't add a factor like that and keep it the same. There's not enough distance in our relationship for that...he would have to withdraw, which would suck. I don't want him to stop leaning his head on my shoulder, and curling around me when I sit on the bed he's lying in. I don't want him to be uncomfortable with physical contact, but I know that if our friendship doesn't more in the direction I want it to, then something will be necessarily lost. We can maintain the intellectual part of a friendship like this, but not the physical part. And that upsets me and worries me; I don't want him to withdraw.

I want to know! If he says yes, then we'll move on from there; if he says no...well, I hope he says yes.
An apprehensive and pathetic
Caitlin. :\ :\ <-(my heart bleeds for you while spinning around in circles.)

Thursday, October 3rd/2002
Again, journal-writing is the non-sensible option (sleep being the sensible one). At this point, I'd say it's fairly safe to say that I am NOT a sensible child.

Which leaves us face-to-face. The major thing I want to know is what does "I don't know" mean? What doesn't he know? It can't be that tough, can it?; you do or you don't. Agh, and I hope he does.

For Cayley's birthday, we're all chipping in to buy her a ticket down to Vancouver to visit Hans at Thanksgiving. It's gonna rock! Short entry, I know, but I really do need sleep.
Love ya! Caitlin. xx.

Friday, October 4, 2002

Tyler didn't come up this evening - his mother forbade it, since she had someone who can drive him up tomorrow, and that's cheaper. Makes sense, I suppose. But I was in Tyler mode, and I really wanted him to be there! I need to talk with him...and then having him not be there was awful, and I hate that! It made me so mad at myself that I got depressed over it. It's like, it is so stupid to be this pathetic over a guy. So pathetic! Grrr. And then everybody felt sorry for me cause I was curled in a fetal position, and their sympathy just made me feel stupider. *Sigh* What is fucking wrong with me?! I've never been this pathetic before...hell, I've never actually told a guy I liked him when I liked him before. Blah. I just want him to like me...
...And there! There's a confusing situation! I mean, honestly, if he tells me he doesn't like me, I'll shut up. I'll drop the subject; end of story. He won't hear about it again. But...fuck, he confused me. I think he confuses him, too. *Sigh*. We REALLY need to talk! I SO want him to be here!
Caitlin.

Saturday, Oct5
Fuck. I should be cleaning but all I want to do is write. I'm so addicted to this journal! So much emotional turmoil; I don't even really have anything new to write - I just need an out!

Tyler, Tyler, Tyler. Can I talk about anything else? At the moment, it really doesn't seem like it, does it? Gawd.
Didn't sleep wel last night - it was one of those nights like when you're sick or feverish and you have all these really vivid dreams and can't ever seem to get much beyond the very surface of unconsciousness. It was definitely  not very restful. The majority of the dreams centred around Tyler, and him liking me. They weren't bad dreams, just weird. There was the one really weird one where he was like, "We have to talk," so I went into this room with him (it was like at a school or something, except that at the same time it was here, at Katy's grandma's house, last night.), but these two other people (a male and a female) were in there. In the dream they were Lee and Veronica, two of Tyler's friends, which was weird cause I've only met Veronica once (at the water fight) and I don't think I've ever met Lee. Plus I don't think the girl in my dream looked anything like Veronica anyway - but that's who they were. I asked why they were there, and Tyler's like, "Well, they're our confidantes. We need witnesses, you know." It was really weird.

He got a hold of us today and came over for a few hours. It was so nice to see him, I'd missed him so pathetically. This morning we were lying around waiting for him to phone, so I said I'd have a shower to speed him up - and it worked. When he came, I was only wearing a towel, which felt foolish cause it felt like it was strategic, except it wasn't. Grr. Stupidity.
We didn't get to talk, cause he was only here for a while and it was the middle of the day, which is an impossible time to talk - it has to happen as night. I really don't know why it is, but there's something about night time which makes it way easier to talk about tough/weird things. Most of the best conversations I've had with people (except Katy) have taken place in the dark, and usually after midnight. Somehow it's just way easier to say things. Gawd, I really don't know if I can manage to wait two weeks to sort this out. I'm going to try to talk to him on MSN, but I really just think we'll wind up skirting the subject again: it has to be in person.

He's so confusing. I'm not really sure even what his reactions to me (and my wonderful confession) is/was. It's like normal...except now he Knows. He kept drumming on my back and little things, and fuck I need to talkt o him cause it sounds so awful and not me but I honestly think he likes me. And he really doesn't want to admit it. What's he scared of? Now I think that "I don't know" is best translated as, "Yes, but I'm scared", and fuck! What is it? We so need to talk.

Saturday, October 12/2002
"I should be going to sleep, but instead I'm writing" - this has become a constant refrain, hasn't it? A multitude of people - mostly Gemmells - are here cause it's Thanksgiving tomorrow. I want him to be where Martina is - that is, next to me in the bed. That does NOT mean, for the more evil-minded among you, that I want to sleep with him, except in the purely literal, platonic sense. I just want his presence.

...He must  like me! How could he not, if he misses me so bloody much? He's going through the same withdrawal process as I am...we really need to Talk talk, but it keeps not happening. Well, eventually. I can't wait for it to be next weekend! I need him here - phones and computers just aren't the same. 
Gnight, Kitty. :) A confused Caitlin.

Monday, September 23rd

*long slow breath expelled loudly through pursed lips* Gosh. I haven't written in forever! I keep meaning to and meaning to, but there just never seems to be time. Damn homework! Damn hard courses! Damn MSN! Rrrgh. I avoided MSN and Hotmail very studiously tonight and went to bed early on purpose so I could write.

Ideally, I should fill you in on everything that's happened in the last...4 weeks since I wrote, but all I actually want to talk about is Tyler, which is really amazingly sad since he's all I talk about in "real life" anyway.
I honestly don't know where this is going, and its so strange. Every other time I've had a crush, I've known exactly where it was headed: Nowhere. And I guess as a result of that I never really tried, and when it got right down to it I never really cared. 
Now I care. And I have no idea what the fuck's going on.
See, the thing about actually caringand actually, for the first time ever, really wanting him to like me, is that it means I'm a lot more obvious about it. I know I'm obvious, and yet it doesn't seem to matter: I do it anyway. You have to understand though, that I'm not obvious in the normal sense of the word. I don't throw myself at him, I don't bad my eyelashes, I don't leap (visibly) at any chance to touch him or fawn over him: in other words (to coin a Tyler phrase) I don't "ask for guitar lessons." Rather, I'm the opposite, and my every action, whether consciously or not, is dictated by how I think he will react. I know he's not a touch-y kind of person, and so I give him space. If he sits close to me, or leans his head on my shoulder, or whatever, then I'm happy with that, but I never ever drape myself over him the way Tyra does, cause I know he hates that. I never push him. However, to anyone who knows me at all, I am definately being obvoius - I just do it in my own unique way. I talk to Tyler. I write him pointless emails. I banter. I follow him from place to place in a completely failed attempt at subtlety. When he's inthe room, I'm focussed on him, which is maybe something you wouldn't notice if you didn't know me. I'm still a part of whatever is going on, but the majority of my attention is fixed on a specific point.
They (Tyler and Tuna) came up this weekend, and both of them wound up sleeping here. (Martina and I tried sharing a bed again; which was an interesting process, and Tyler got the army cot.) And everyone seems to think he likes me. Tyra thinks so, and Tyra can be astute. Martina thinks so. The funny one, though, is my mother. She asked outright a couple of weeks ago if I liked him, and what was I supposed to do, lie? So I said yes; I mean, she had it figured out anyway. She's actually irritatingly observant. So after the two of them left yesterday, she came downstairs while I was tidying. We talked about whatever for a while, and then she asked, "So when are you two going to admit you like each other?" I said, "--------!" Then I shook myself and said, "Well, I think only one of us likes the other," but she just looked at me and said, "He likes you back. I've been around the block a few times; trust me on this one." And then she dropped it. But it made me think...cause (pessimist that I suppose I am) I'm inclined to automatically disbelieve it, but then, Mum's really quite astute. So, what?
Katy really isn't sure one way or the other, which is of course also just how I feel. Sometimes I think he likes me - as a result of things he says, stuff he does, whatever - and sometimes I'm convinced he doesn't. It's so hard to tell; he's confusing. And he does stuff like lean his head on my shoulder or curl around me when I'm sitting on the bed, and I know he doesn't like meaningless touching, so, what? Or he'll say something...and then sometimes, its entirely the other way round, and suddenly I'm confused again. The thing I don't get (a thing I don't get) is why Mum thinks he likes me, cause all of the indicators which made me think he likes me, all of the indicators which made me think he doesn't, AND all our important conversations, took place outside of her presence. So what does she have to go on? This confuses me...

The event I really want to relate to you in an effort to psycho-analyze both myself and Tyler (along with maybe Katy) took place on Saturday night at Lindsay's costume party at Jessica's. However, it is now quarter after 11 and I need sleep, so I'll do my honest best to get to bed early and continue my rant tomorrow. 
Gosh, I'd forgotten what wonderful therapy this was. Talking to Katy about everything is wonderful, but it can't quite replace the deep satisfaction one gets from the process of writing.
Goodnight, Kitty. Satisfied smudges! :)

Saturday (sort of) 28th

It's 6:30 in the morning and I am the most pathetic person in the world. Last night - no, wait, we have to go further back than that to explain. Grudgingly (but with a certain - okay, large - sense of anticipation) I let her send it.
He didn't reply. He takes a long time replying to emails; he's an incredibly slow typist. Last night when we got home, I checked my inbox (nothing real, as expected) and, out of habit (and a sense of insane curiousity) I opened Katy's hotmail as well. Just to see, you know. And there was a response from Tyler. Aack! What to do?! Katy hadn't checked it yet, and if I opened the email first, it would be marked as "read", and after all, it is her email. So I decided I was fine. Hey, I was ill anyway, I didn't need more things to pay attention to - what I needed was sleep. So I went to sleep.
And at quarter to 6, I woke up from a dream. I don't remember anything that happened in the dream until right at the end, when (in the dream) I opened Katy's inbox, where there was a note to me from Katy saying essentially "Read it if you want - he doesn't like you." In the dream, I maintained composure well. I opened the email, and started to read. However, I guess that the task of formulating a rejection letter for me, from my crush, addressed to my friend, was too much for my subconscious to handle. I woke up.
(Wow, I'm good at dragging out stories, aren't I?) So I lay there in bed for like 15 minutes, my mind racing. Was it a premonition? Probably not. My innate pessimism acting up? Most likely. But now I had  to know, plus it was a good bet that Katy had checked her email when she got hom, so she already knew.
After agonizing for 15 minutes, I gave up and tiptoed upstairs to the computer, which is luckily far away from any of the bedrooms. Looked in Katy's inbox. She's had 3 new messages last night when I checked - now she had 2. The only one she'd looked at was Tyler's. With a definite sense of trepidation, I opened it.
("Blah blah blah stuff Caitlin doesn't care about...about the Caitlin thing...the only answer is I don't know...call me and we'll talk about it, ok? Tyler's no good at this email thing...") So he doesn't know. Or doesn't want to discuss it over Hotmail. Am I insane for thinking this is good news? ...caus I'm happy. Insanely gut-wrenchingly curious, but happy. That means, the way I read it, that he doesn't not like me. Which, all by itself, is fine with me. The fact that he has to hesitate means he's thought about it, that he's confused. "He doesn't know." And that's a million times better than straight-out rejection, any day.

Of course, now I can't sleep. (Its 7am now...) I want to call Katy up and say "Did you call him? Did you ask him? What did he say? What do you think? What should I do?" Except I'm sure that she (like a sensible child) is asleep...as I should be.
Phew. Writing about things is wonderful therapy; I feel so much better now. Still imptient for it to be a resonable hour, but much better. Shall I lay here a while longer trying to sleep? Probably a good idea.
Goodnight (morning) Kitty.
Confused, anticipatory smudges.

Wednesday, Aug. 7/02

Well, folks, 1971 is definately Back in Style. Mum and I went shopping at the Limeridge Mall today, and spent the entire time laughing in disbelief at the current fashions. Honestly, some of those shirts you'd need a map to figure out. I mean, ruffles are bad enough; some of this stuff was awe-inspiring! These trends were just getting started when we went shopping in Calgary on the band trip in May, but that stuff was mild compared to what they've got now! {doodles of the shirts} Like, hello! There's more holes there then material! I just don't get it. We laughed and laughed. We did find a few nice things with relatively few ridiculous bits, and a nice dress. Mum also bought me some pretty panties, socks with fat bumblebees, and comfy pyjamas. But you don't care.

I'm enjoying htis book I'm reading, especially the modern half. It's really funny, though, cause it's like a gay romance novel, or something (I mean gay in the sense that it's a romance between two guys, not in the derogatory sense.) I don't know why I enjoy that so much; maybe it's kind of weird that I do. But guys are turned on by lesbian action right, so why not the other way round. Reading about a romance between two guys is certainly a new experience, anyway, whatever else it is. The only other book I've read which involved gay guy romance was "Mists of Avalon" in which Lancelet is portrayed as actually being in love with Arthur, instead of (or maybe as well as) Guinevere. That's a tangled web: Morgaine loves Lancelet, Lancelet loves ARthur, Arthur loves Guinevere, Guinever loves Lancelet. Actually, come to think of it, I found the idea of Lancelet being gay kind of sexy, too. I'm an odd duck, no doubt about it. "She's Come Undone" had lesbian scenes, but that's definately different. Not really disturbing, but definitely not a turn-on.

I'm going to read and then sleep. Kitchenever and Bingamin's tomorrow, I think. Still no Cayley and Hans, sorry...eventually, of course, you'll probably stop caring. I will try to update you, but it's hard to get really worked up about something when you're so far removed from the situation (physically at least) and especially when you're not in a particularly bitchy mood to begin with. Also difficult to get really into crushes...sigh. Although Tyler is undoubtedly adorable, even when he's across the country.
Goodnight, Kitty. :) Sweet dreams!


Thursday, August 8, 2002.
*The world sucks; if it didn't, we'd all fall off!*

I hate it when people laugh at jokes I make. I mean, I don't really ; I find it gratifying, I suppose. But I'm never really sure how to react - it's embarassing. Usually people don't laugh at my jokes at all, or even understand them - the references tend to be fairly obscure, or else plain foolish, or very off-beat. Makes me feel a bit sheepish, but at least I'm used to it! This laughing thing really gets to me. Do you alugh with them, at your own joke? Do you grin? Do you maintain a poker face? I've never known how to handle the situation naturally - guess it's a good thing it doesnt' happen very much. (And I don't mean jokes, per se, understand? Just funny remarks...jokes I can handle!)

Took a walk down Memory Lane today - went to Kitchener and Bingeman's, and past Nana and Papa's old house. That's the weirdest thing - not having that house any more. The fact that it belongs to somebody else is unimaginable - for as long as I've lived (not long, I know, but still) it's been, well, ours. They owned it for 30 years! It was really the only home base I ever had - we never owned a house anywhere for more than 4 years. It's so strange now, seeing that house and not being able to go in.

We're going to the Cottage, tomorrow, and that'll be another experience again. I haven't seen it in five years, and I imagine it's changed. That plas is so packed with memories...I think one of the absolutely worst things about living in British Columbia is not having the cottage.I love it! My friends would love it - generations of teenagers have used that cottage as a party spot...it's perfect! ...and I can't. I really wish I could bring them. I especially wish we could've brought Katy. The waterpark today was fun, but would have been more fun with friends.

My book (it's called The Wild Swans, btw) is turnign out to be about AIDS, as I suspected it would. That's a hard topic to avoid when you've got a novel about gay people in the early 80's, when the disease was just beginning to be recognized. Now Elias's lover, Sean, has it too, or at least I suspect he does. It's actually getting thoroughly depressing. But I persevere.

I'm still jet-lagged (I hate switching time zones) and even though it's only 10:35 I'm dead tired, so I'm going to go to sleep - or at least try to; I have a very noisy window (it opens onto the highway, and there's a construction site across the road). At any rate, I'll do my best!
Very tired smudges. :)


Friday, August 9/02

Writing very briefly here, at the Cottage at ten to two. Funny thing is, it probably really IS about 10 to 2...am, of course. We were up playing Chinese Poker, but now everyone's going abed. I shouldn't be writing - at this rate, I'll be the last one up tomorrow, which sucks cause I want to have as many waking daylight hours here as possible.

Considering I haven't been here in 5 or 6 years, it's amazing how little has changed. The outhouse is different, and the new one is facing the path (!!), which seems a singularly stupid idea to me, and the paths are getting overgrown, but other than that, it's pretty much the same...new (green) coat of paint...Time truly does stand still at the Cottage. I so wish I could bring everyone here...they'd love it so much. But being here alone is wonderful too, in a thoroughly different way. To really adequately rediscover a magical place, one needs Solitude. I spent quite some time sitting on the big rock by the Climbing Maple on Dodsworth's Hill today, just thinking. The fort's small and rundown. The wall collages are even more amusing than before ...I get a lot more of the jokes than I used to.

Max (Max Palomar, that is, Lowell's forever-ago friend from Kitchener with whom he still keeps in touch) is up here with us. He's an alright kid. Slightly off his rocker, but then, aren't we all? Particularly in this family. He's huge! Taller than me, and his voice has deepend. Looks closer to 15 than 12. His voice has been bugging me...I can't decide whether he reminds me more of Brad Carson or of Ben Stein, the actor who was the Science Teacher on Wonder Years, and who hosts the show "Win Ben Stein's Money." He has that same drawl in his voice as Max does.

Love love love the houses here in Southern Ontario. Eighty to a hundred years old and brick. They're so beautiful...much niceer than most of the places near where I live.

...Goodness, why do I always have lots to say when I'm exhausted. Days like today, I just shouldn't even start. Want to talk about perceptions of age (ie Being Twelve) and about my bizarre dream last night and about Tyler (the two are related) and duck jokes and the Fairies in my box. And Cayley and Hans. 
Hopefully at some point this all will be covered. But not right now. Goodnight. :)


Sunday, August 11/02

So we're at CAMMAC, and already I can just see how the week is going to unfold. There are like a million and one Keenan Clan members and hangers-on ('friends and relations') here...all four of us, plus Grandma, Grandpa, Jim and Arly, Tessa, Spencer, and Mitchell, Rob and Jackson, and Megan, Corinne, and Devon. At the Opening Announcements this evening, Pat jokes that this week we had 3 groups: Anglophones, Francophones, and Keenans. I'm rooming with Megan and Corinne, and God! don't you love sister dynamics? Right now they're fighting about whether or not Corinne should be allowed to dangle her hand over the side of the bed. Thoroughly petty and irritating on both sides, but what can I do? Not much. It's not my place to regulate disputes.
And it's going to be like this all week. Megan wants to do everything with me...or rather, she wants me to spend all my time doing stuff with her. I don't mind spending time with her, but eventually this is going to bug me - I like to spend time alone, too, reading and practising and whatever. And if they're going to keep fighting over every little thing...anyway, we'll figure it out.
Too many courses, too little time, as usual. Once again my Chamber Music group coincides with the Intermediate Recorder, so again I can't do that. Finally bowed to my father's will and decided to try out the Solfege course...Broadway Choir and Voice Training were in the same time block, but I guess you can't have everything. I'm also taking Equal Voices and A Cappella. The major choral work is some impossible 20th-century work called Balshazzar's Feat. A's are really too high!
Really tired. As usually, all auxiliary topics get pushed to the sidelines... I'll try for time tomorrow. Quiet hour?
Gnight, Kitty. :)


Tuesday, August 13/02

Cabaret was this evening. I got roped into doing this Jazz thing with Dad and Rob called "When I Sing". [[Hans, if you're reading this: this is the same song you recommended to me by UHF. I think it's a great song but I, too, am unable to find an mp3 version of it. My uncle Rob had it on a tape.]] It's mostly Rob's solo, but we were doing harmony in places, and this guy Joel, who's an awesome jazz guitarist, accompanied, along with Dad, and did fills. I was really nervous about it at first, cause I could never find my notes (no music; we were learning it off a tape), but it worked out well, actually. I had fun!
I'm having a hard time concentrating here - Corinne is sitting on my bed singing, and Megan's looking through my sketchbook and asking me stuff...ummm...having fun, in a busy, tiring way...


Wednesday, Aug. 14/02

Travis Earl. Now THERE's a confusing fellow for you. (Why am I talking about htis? I don't know!) Every time (well, sometimes) when he passes me in the hall or whatever, he whistles under his breath or makes a subtle comment...I mean, it's the sort of thing that you'd automatically assume was a joke - that's what I do think, normally. I mean, he's like that with everyone, not just me...at least I assume so; he's very flirty, with most girls...but then, sometimes I wonder. He's the sort of guy who would do that and pretend to be joking, but really be serious...I don't even know why I'm talking about this! I'll shut up now...

I remember now why I so love having a group of interesting (albeit flawed) people to hang out with...cause now I remember what it's like to, for all intents and purposes, not exist. Haven't really had that experience for about a year and a half, and certainly not in the past few months. But that's what it's like here, this week. Aside from my family and the adults I sing with, I don't exist. None of the adolescents - except Megan, of course - hang out with me. This is mostly my fault, I suspect...I suck at making overtures, and I strongly suspect that my shyness comes across as haughtiness, or something similar. Thing is though, I don't really mind. Ordinarily I would, but I'm SO busy with classes and everything that I don't have time for socializing...hen I'm not singing, playing, or sleeping, I've been practising piano and writing poetry - well, lyrics - and working on a tune to one piece. I've finally got somewhere with Katy's song...that is, the song I'm writing for Katy about David (even though she doesn't like him any more; now she likes Tyler)...it's called ISLANDS. I also wrote another semi-love song called "Solitude". I believe solitude can soothe a troubled soul/Believe that love and love alone can make you whole. It's sort of about Tyler, at least some bits: The one involves a guy and a guitar/ A boat drifts on a lake but we're not moving very far, but it doesn't have to be about Tyler, it's just that he happens to fit my perfect scenario. He's cute, he's an amazing guitarist, AND he sails. Now how perfect is that? :p

Monday, July 15ish, 2002

I don't know why I don't just look up the date; this journal's equipped with a built-in Perpetual Calendar, after all...yep, it's the 15th. I've got simply gads of things to say, but as usual I've left it late, and I have a French exam tomorro wat 11am which I need to be rested for, so I'm going to try to keep this brief.

Tyra had a party...no, wait, scratch that - Jessica had a party at Tyra's house (don't ask) on Saturday, to which I went. There were tons of people there: the regular crew (minus Cayley, who's in Vancouver), plus Hans, Jessica Coe, Eric Cook, Manda, Aaron, Melissa, Barry Wolfenden, Jessica Bushman, Jessica's two friends from Dawson Creek, Chelsey and Emily, Lance, Dylan Wolnowski, Matt Wolnowski, this friend of Hans's from Rupert who's name has momentarily escaped me [[it was James McNish]], plus probably other people whom I've forgotten in the shuffle. I probably would have been more fun if I hadn't stayed up until 5am the night before watching old movies with Katy. AS it was we were both dead tired, and wound up spending practically the entire evening cuddling with Hans. That was fun too, but a different sort of fun, and I kept feeling guilty. Guilt is, of course, ridiculous - see, I was feeling guilty because we were spending all our time with Hans, and Eric was getting jealous. But that's stupid...I have no reason to feel guilty, and he has no right to feel jealous. He and those other guys have had basically free reign with us for two years, and maybe they've just come to expect us to be there whenever they want us. Trankly, though, I'm getting tired of playing second fiddle to a computer game, and pussyfooting around for fear that Eric's in a bitchy mood and about to bite my head off. Hans is open and briendly, and Eric is bitter. It's an irritating and uncomfortable situation.

I'm terribly jealous of Cayley's impending relationship with Hans, and I hate being jealous. I've decided that it's not Hans specifically I'm jealous about, it's the relationship scenario in general. (I may have said this before...I've certainly thought it before). I'm jealous of the fact that everyone except me will have been in a romantic relationship. I'm jealous that I will be the only girl (no exceptions once Cayley's gone_ who has never been kissed. What's wrong with me? Aren't I as attractive as those girls? ...What's worse about me than them? Is my personality repellant? Surely not! I hope not... Maybe I'm just too shy, and not forward enough. Maybe my standards are too high. Gawd, I don't know.
Anyway. Lots more (less angsty, more interesting) to write, but I do want to be conscious for my French test tomorrow, so wish me luck and I'll try to write tomorrow night.
French smudges (the very best kind!), Kitty. :)

Monday, July 22, 2002
Goodness, it's been a week! Damn that stupid Livejournal! You and I, Kitty, need very much to have a heart-to-heart discussion on the subject of potted geraniums. (Heehee - that, in case you've forgotten [[you never knew]], is a referrance to that stupid Kitstory prequel I started - check it out!)
