That's good too, because bitching in here again would be redundant - what I want to complain about, and the stuff I needed to say, is virtually identical to my last entry in this journal...the whole Relationship Jealousy bit. There are two major things which I feel my life lacks at the moment, and they are definitely connected: those are action (yes, in the sexual sense) and romance. What I really want is a relationhip, but you know what? At this point, I'd settle for making out with someone I have no intention of going further with. I'm seventeen and I have never been kissed - this is really starting to bother me! At any rate...

So, are you up-to-date on the Cayley aspect of this situation? The old part is that she finally confronted Kurt about her feelings, and he told her he valued her friendship, but had no interest in her romantically. So, typical Cayley (at least in one sense...) it was out-with-the-old, in-with-the-new. She's now completely in love with Hans, and the irritating part is that he likes her too...but this part you know; I've already ranted about it! My mom thinks that Hans should like me, and we should go out... I think she thinks he'd make a good son-in-law(!!!!). She doesn't think he should like Cayley...I have to admit I agree, but either way it's beside the point, right?

Oh,and an interesting sidenote to the Kurt thing: did you know (no, you didn't, cause I haven't told you cause I just found out) that apparently he liked me for a while back, like, six months ago?! Now there's irony for you. When I liked him, he didn't like me, and when he liked me I didn't like him, and he never liked the girl who was actually seriously interested in him. And now it's too late for that! I must admit, though, much as I found it irritating when Cayley moped after Kurt, I did find that preferrable to the gushing, condescending Cayley we have on our hands now. [[I'm so terrible...we were so terrible...ugh.]] But whatever. I'm her friend and I support her and blah blah blah. I just wish she wouldn't rub it in my face!

Em tasol, Caitlin. :)

Sunday, August 4, 2002
Okies. Wow, I've got tons to talk about...and I probably won't get it all down tonight cause we're in a hotel and people will probably want the lights turns out soon. Anyways. I've been meaning (and needing) to write for...at least a week, I guess, but Tuna's been staying at our house and I have a difficult time writing when she's in the room (or when anyone's inthe room, especially if they insist on talking.) ANYWAYS. (With or without an s....who cares!) I have two major things to talk about, plus a TON TON TON of things (mostly related) which I'm sure I'll forget. The major subheadings are "Cayley and Hans" and "Tyler." You don't yet know Tyler and don't really care at this point, whereas you're into the Cayley/Hans/Harem melodrama and interested to see how that plays out. Unfortunately for you, I'm not in a Bitchy mood and I do want to talk about Tyler, so you'll probably have to wait at least until I'm on the plane to hear about Cayley and Hans. And now, Tyler!

Could you tell? Tyler is my new (yay!) crush. He's a Rupertite, one of Hans' friends. We (me, Tyra, and Katy) went to Rupert a few weekends ago (before the Cayley thing blew up...yes, yes, be patient!) to visit Hans, which was the first time we saw him - briefly. He and Hans were finishing up a pool game - he was cute, but seemed kind of stuck up and withdrawn. Didn't really care about it either way. Then, last weekend, he came up to Terrace with Hans, austensibly for KT's party. (They, as well as Martina, wound up staying pretty much the whole week.) And he's an amazingly interesting person! He's not cuddly - unlike Hans, he could never handle a Harem (nor would he want to)...he thinks it's too weird - he's a Monogamous Relationship kinda guy. He's a phenomenal guitar player (really really good!0 and he knows so much about music, and composers, and Harmony! It's fascinating. And he thinks about things, you know?Uses his brain for more than an ornament. Plus he's totally adorable - onthe Too Tall side, but so good-looking - and he looks at you when he speaks. And his sense of humour's almost exactly like mine! And he loves sailing. And - this realy is a big plus - he's a cynic! Just like me - and a fairly optimistic cynic, to boot. A romantic core, but a realistic mind. I realized this week that I would hate going out with Hans for that exact reason - his blind romantic idealism would drive me crazy. Optimism is all very well, but sometimes you have to face facts! And Tyler's totally like me on this one. [[Ok, I'm so not touching this tyler stuff...]] He's so interesting to talk to...we talked together for like an hour and a half last night while we were down by the river waiting for the fireworks to start. Mostly about music, and all totally fascinating! I could talk to him for hours, and that is truly something special. Gawd, I'm gushing so terribly...I'm so far gone! I know it's probably dull to listen to, but bear with me here. I haven't had a real crush in over a year. I'm starved for it! (Goodness I'm weird!)
I love the way he smells. I love massaging his back. I love that he listens to me, and laughs at things I say, even when nobody else gets them. I love that he can talk intelligently about Classical Music and doesn't automatically dismiss opera as stupid and boring. I love that he can skip stones, and wants to name his boat Egg or Harbour Assassin Extreme (Hans's suggestion.) The really hilarious, pathetic thing is that Katy and Tyra both have crushes on him too! Sigh. I think he's way more suited to me than either of them - the music thing, you know? I'm so foolishly stupidly jealous that they get to spend time with him and work on his affections for TWO WHOLE WEEKS while I'm away! I'm not worried about Tyra, but Katy's got a good shot...oh right! That's the other thing I've got to talk about: KT and Mike, and how everything happens to everyone else. Grr.
Goodness, Tyler's such a sweetheart, too! (Gush gush. My handwriting's getting sloppy cause I'm tired, but I can't seem to stop.) We had a major crisis with Hans last night...well, this morning...at 2am at Tyra's house on MSN. Something was said and he took it wrong and...anyway, I'll get into it when I start talking about that whole situation. Tennyrate, Hans went offline, and we knew he was distraught. (it's Hans...). We were all paralyzed, but Tyler made us call him to sort stuff out. Then we called but none of us could talk (I despise phones with a passion...can think of no worse form of communication) so Tyler the dear acted as our liaison and sorted everything out. It was way more then we had any right to ask of him, and he was so awesome about it.
God, I'm totally lost. Help, I'm drowning in adoration!
Gnight, Kitty... :)

Tuesday, August 6/02
(Airplane=messy. Sorry.) Why do I find gay guys attractive? It's so perverse... I started reading a book which Grandma gave me for Christmas called "The Wild Swans". One of the main characters is Elias, a gay 19-year-old struggling to cope with bigotry, and I realized that I find the idea both compelling and arousing, and that's so foolish. Tennyrate.
Watched the 3rd Austin Powers movie (Goldmember) at a really nice theatre in Edmonton last night. It was stupid, of course, but funny. My favourite part is right at the beginning, when Tom Cruise plays Austin! Unfortunately, Seth Green (my personal favourite Heartthrob, although not many people agree with me) isn't nearly as adorable when balking, which is how he spends most of the movie. The only scene where he was actually very good to look at was right near the beginning, before he starts turning into his father.

I'm still not in a bitchy mood, which is a pity since I really should bring you up to date on the Cayley/Hans scenario, as well as tell you about Katy and Mike. ...Alright, well, let's at least drop that shoe, even though I don't really feel like ranting at the moment. On Friday night, we were all at Tyra's watching the tapes of our last few weekends. Cayley and Hans left early as usual (yeah, later, later), so it was just Tyra, Katy, me, Tuna, Tyler, and Mike McKinnis (the dancer) left there. I gave Tyler a back massage (he ASKED, which surprised me, since he found the first one I gave him so painful), and then I lay on his back. - If you've never tried that you really should; it's amazingly comfortable. As far as I'm concerned, by far the best part of giving back massages is getting to lie on the person's back afterwards (especially if you have a crush on the person ;). Anyways, I was kind of out of it. Kt and Mike were on the floor, and they were both in really weird moods - Katy was being silly and flirty, and she's NEVER like that. She's usually Miss Reservation, even worse than me. And Mike was particularly horny, even for Mike. He'd been hitting on me earlier in the evening, but now, obviously, I was occupied with Tyler, and perfectly willing to remain that way. So, Kt and Mike were together, and doing some kind of weird shit...like, she was BITING HIS EARS. That's a very Tyra thing to do, but it's very NOT Katy. It was strange. So anyway, eventually Tuna and I left (1:30am-ish) to go home and sleep. Tyler and Katy were staying the night at Tyra's, as was Mike.
The next morning, the five of us went downtown to watch the Riverboat Days Parade, and we met up with Mike and some other people.
"Wow," says Mike, "This is really awkward."
"Yes, it is, isn't it," agrees Katy.
Silence. Awkward glances. Move on.
So anyway, the night before, after we left, they'd wound up making out pretty hardcore on Tyra's bed! I couldn't believe it. I mean, anyone else and I'd not be that surprised, but KATY. And even then, I could understand her making out withsomeone she really liked. But she barely even KNOWS Mike. It's so weird. [[This paragraph deserves a "heh" on so many levels...]]
And the stupidest part is that I'm JEALOUS of her for it! How come stuff like that always happens to her, and never to me? She doesn't even like liking guys, and she's usually got like no visible hormones. Yet she's had relationships and made out with people,and she doesn't even want it. I haven't done anything at all - I've never ever kissed a guy...like, period, like not even in Kindergarten behind the Play Kitchen, and I do want to! It's so very ironic. I'm at the point where I just want to go up to someone and ask them to kiss me! I wouldn't really, of course, but do you see what I mean?! Grrr.

High-altitude smudges, Kitty. :)

Saturday, July 6th


I kept meaning and meaning to write, but I haven't had 2 minutes of solitude to rub together since...well, since before the last time I wrote. But I should, and we're sort of doing nothing at the moment, so...

Hans is so wonderful. I read some of his Online Journal entries, and i realized I really ought to be in love with him. Sunday, July 7th, 2002

I get introuble with Katy when I write in my journal, cause she doesn't have on and is feeling journal-deprived, but I'm doing it anyway. ...Actually, now it's tomorrow morning: I spent most of the light hours last night reading to Katy and Martina from my previous journal entries, which was actually quite fun. I'd never read my journals aloud to anyone, or allowed anyone to read my journals...they're actually more entertaining then I'd thought. I have strange expressions...

Anyway. We've been having fun, but we all agree that those boys should come back more often so we can look at them. The three teenagers - Ashley 9who's probably not actually a teenager anymore I suppose), Travis, and their sister, whose name eludes me for the moment, came to our campsite to visit Katy on Saturday evening. Having got a better look at them both, I've decided (and the others agree with me) that Travis is the cuter of the two. Plus he's closer to our age - I think he's eighteen. We're so sad, drooling over boys from Telegraph Creek whom none of us but Katy are ever going to see again. He is (they are) pretty hot though. I think they would be even if they were n't pretty much the only young males within a several hundred mile radius. Katy says it's very very weird, being attracted to someone she's known her whole life, but always seen as a sort of nerdy, dorky playmate rather than anything. I can understand what she means - it would be like suddenly being attracted to Paul! Ack! That would be so bizarre. I suppose he could turn into an attractive person...but I don't see how...Ouch. That was harsh. Oh well, he won't be reading this. Funny thing is, I did sort of like him at one point...but that was a million years ago and I was confused. We'd just moved out here, and I was trying to stop having a crush on Brad, cause he was all the way across the country, and I was pathetic. We saw a lot of the Gemmells those first few months, and I didn't really know anyone else here. Grade 7 was a weird year that way. Paul was still being nice at that point, too - he hadn't yet turned into a teenager in any more than the strictest sense of the word. Strange memories...

I don't know why I'm picking now to reminisce (stupid, unspellable word!). Now I want to go into all that ancient history and talk about Brad, but to exhaust that topic (especially on paper) would take hours. I haven't actually thought about htose years for so long. What I really want to know, I suppose, is what he thought of me. How accurate my warped, biased perception of events was. We moved just when things were getting interesting, so I never got a chance to find out how things would have played out naturally. In Grade 4, I..."hated"...him, and I'm not sure he knew I existed. I guess he must have, though - we made his life a living hell every Recess and Lunch. We were such pills. I feel sorry for him now. In Grade 5, I still hated him, but by this point the feeling was mutual, so we had a relationship of some sort, although it consisted mainly of exchanging insults. He was in my class all three of those years - him and Joel Wilson and Michelle Henderson and Justin Sam, whom no one but me know or remember... In Grade 5, the insults stopped being physical and became verbal, as well as two-sided. It was a weird relationship.
In Grade 6, we sort of became friends, and that was weirder! There was still a lot of banter and "I hate you" thrown back and forth (like, I pretended to be annoyed when I was placed beside him in Music clsas - that sort of thing) but really we were friends under all that antipathy. we used to walk and talk together at Recess - especially that last recess on the bike rack beside the Pumphouse on the Frenchy side of the playground. *Sigh* Memories. So I wonder - did he like me? It always seemed like he did, but maybe I was reading too much into signs that were in actuality meaningless. I wish we'd moved a year later...it's not like Grade 7 in Terrace was incredibly exciting anyway, and I would have found out what happened. Oh well. What-ifs are pointless.

...Just wanted to finish that thought before I took off on a new tangent. It's this afternoon (Monday, that is) now. This morning we went to town and took a boat ride up the Stikine River. And saw Travis! I figured it out - he reminds me of Mathieu, that guy I was so in love with at CAMMAC the summer before Grade 8. I've decided earrings on guys are definitely sexy. (Katy decided the same thing - Travis has an earring). I think she's in danger of having a crush on him...I thought that before, but now she thinks so as well, so it must be true. I'm not...I don't know him...but he's good to look at. I'm thinking also that there musn't be very many teenage girls in Telegraph Creek - he's seemed quite interested in us as well, which is amusing. I kept catching his eye, cause everytime I looked at him, he was looking at me, or at Katy or Martina. Then he would look away, embarassed. It was probably just my overactive imagination that convinced me he was looking at me, and at us. Either way, it doesn't really matter. It always amuses me when guys look at me, because it happens so rarely. It's like, what, can't you find anything more interesting to look at than this?! That sounds kind of harsh, but it's true: there's almost always someone (or something) better to look at then myself. So when they do, I find it amusing.

It's so warm here, and I'm tanned again. I love it! It's such a nice change from the cool and damp we've been having in Terrace recently. This beach is beautiful.
Tomorrow morning (my birthday! I'd forgotten) we're leaving (sigh...no more Travis) to go to Stewart and see the Salmon Glacier. Then home on Wednesday. 
Summer vacations (and life) always happen so fast...


Tuesday, July 9th, 2002

It's my birthday, for the seventeenth time - eighteenth, if you count my actual birth day, I suppose. I'm getting to be an old hand at this. As usual, I'm not at home! We're in Stewart (well, outside of Stewart) at the cutest, most adorable little campsite. Looks like its right out of a National Geographic magazine. Anyway.

I'm going to start writing this journal entry, but I don't think I'll get very far - Tuna and Katy want to have a story time...this means me reading aloud from my journal. We started this a couple of evenings ago, and it's actually fun. I've never shared journals with anyone before, but I like doing it, I've decided, if they're the right people. Martina says that one day I should publish my journals. I don't know, though...that's like, strangers reading my private thoughts. Scary. I want to talk about other kinds of things, but I can't do it here and now, so I'll do it elsewhere and later, k?
Gnight! :)


Wednesday.

...have to write about this dream I had last night, before I forget. I rarely have dreams anymore, and I hardly ever have sexual or romantic dreams, so when I do have them it's very interesting.
I'm not sure how to describe this dream. Its about Jon, and I don't know why, cause I hadn't been thinking about him at all. Usually, even when I do have sexual dreams, they aren't about someone who exists, or someone I know. This one was.
The initial part, we were sitting in school - only it wasn't the school, it was some other building - arguing. It was a verbal arguement, but...he kept...petting me, almost, playfully, but not. Then a weird non-sequitur where Will Shack came up to us - only he was huge, or rather, we were very small, like four-year-olds. We ran up to him and jumped into his arms, like he was our long-lost uncle. He scooped us up and held us each in one arm, and said, "You know, you two should really get together." We laughed derisively.
I don't know if there was an explanation within the dream for the next bit: if there was, I forget it. All of a sudden it was like a...a dam burst, or a bell rung, or a powder was released into the air, and then it was like everyone was compelled to pair up. We were twitterpated to the extreme. I was so stunned and confused - people were rushing everywhere past me, forming into couples...not only that, but they were getting married! No ceremonies or anything, its just that when they joined up, they were automatically married. I was standing there dazed, and Jon had disappeared, and then it was like a movie scene or a ...well, a dream sequence... - the people were still pouring past me, but they parted like a sea around me, and there was Jon standing still as well, facing me from 6 feet away. It's so cliche and tacky, but that's what happened. We stared at each other - silence in the middle of uproar - and then I blinked and he had disappeared. I searched for him amidst the couples, and once I saw him moving away ahead of me. He glanced back and saw me, but then he shrugged and kept moving away. I finally wound up outside, and wandered around feeling desolate. Everywhere I looked there was another happy couple. I looked through the brightly-lit window into the warmth inside - and there was Jon on the other side, the only other person standing alone. He'd been looking for something, but seemed about to give up, when he glanced up at the window and saw me. His face lit up so adorably, and he ran towards the door, fighting the crowd. I ran too, but when I reached the door Amanda Chan and Britt MacLoed were coming out, carrying a huge book. Jon followed them out, but he just stood behind them and watched me. Amanda flipped the book open and told me to read the page. I knelt down and read it. It was written in German, but I could read most of it. The parts that I couldn't read, Britt translated into Latin for me(!!). I can't remember the words, but it was basically a statement of love from Jon. I was so bewildered, and I looked up at him and...yeah, movie scene. The stupid part was when I kissed him - I've never kissed anyone or been kissed in real life, but it's happened numberous times in dreams, and this was absolutely the stupidest, worst kiss I've ever had in a dream. Usually kissing is sexy, but this was pointless. And yet the sentiment was wonderful. It sounds stupid now, of course, but the dream was so romantic. And I didn't make it up - it happened! Other stuff happened after that in the dream, but it was all vague and pointless. That first part, though, was so much like an actual story that it amazed me!


Thursday, July 11, 2002

Oh, I do so hate not being caught up! It makes me feel all off-kilter. Tuseday was my birthday, as you know, Tuesday night I had The Dream, and Wednesday we drove home. Our only adventure for the whole trip happened that last day, onthe road that comes home through the Lava beds and New Aiyansh. One of the tired in the van blew! We went over a piece of lava accidentally and KERSPLAT! There it was. So I learned how to change a tire. That meant, of course, that the Gemmells - Ian and Martina, that is - had to stay the night with us, so their tire could be fixed inthe morning. (Their spare was only a temporary.) We watched Topsy-Turvy last night, a very good movie about Gilbert and Sullivan. Then, just as we had finished, the power went out; I believe about half of Terrace was out. That was at 12:30-ish, so we all just went to bed. I meant to write that night, but didn't, for obvious reasons. Unlike Eleanora, I cannot write by candlelight.

...And quite a lot has been going on here in our absense, it appears. Hans and Cayley are on the verge of going out. I'm not sure how I feel about this...no, actually, I know exactly how I feel about it - I hate the idea - I'm just not entirely sure why. It's partly altruistic, I guess, but mostly selfish. Hans is going away to school at the end of August, and already I know just how this will play out. I know Cayley. Once they start going out, she will be smug and condescending to all of the rest of us, while appearing not to be. Then, when he leaves, she will be devastated and will mope for months...she'll be insufferable, and we'll never hear the end of it. Also, I'm afraid of how it will split up the group...they say everything (ie the harem...did you know we were Hans's concubines?) will be the same, but I know smfo. [[edit: "smfo" = "better". if you don't know why, ask.]] Everything will be awkward. He says that he will be faithful in a relationship, but he wants his friends to know that he will always be there to cuddle or provide a shoulder to cry on. Cayley says she's fine with that, but she won't be. Katy and I know that, if no one else. She's a very possessive person by nautre, and she'll hate other people touching him. The tensions between her and Tyra and Jessica will escalate, even though they say they're resigned, and Katy and I will be left on the outside, watching everything fall apart. Perhaps I'm just a cynic (goodness I hope so), but that's honestly how I see it. However, it's not up to me, it's up to them, so I've decided to be supportive regardless. [[wow, I never give Cayley a *chance*, do I? Self-fulfilling prophesy much? Ugh.]]
There's another nagging, petty part of me that begs to have a voice in this too. I hate that part, and I only give it voice in this journal. Ultimately, this is the problem: I want Hans to like me. The selfishness of this attitude is compounded further by the fact that I really don't have a crush on him...but I want him to have a crush on me. He's exactly the sort of guy I want. I've expounded on all these good, true reasons why it's a bad idea for Cayley and Hans to start a relationship, and yet I know that if he asked me out, I'd say yes in a second, even though the same restrictions apply. Bottom line: he's a great guy. He'd make a great boyfriend. And, I think, awful though this sounds...I mean, Cayley's my friend..., I think I would make a better girlfriend for him than Cayely will. I would handle the circumstances better, and I think our personalities mesh better. Grrr. I'm so jealous of her.

I hate this part of myself. Usually I keep it smothered, and even now, this journal is the only place I'm indulging it. I would neversay that stuff online. [[ok, I kind of still agree with this sentiment, but I'm committed, now, and it's ancient history after all...]]. I hate being jealous, but I am mind-bogglingly jealous of Cayley, for a couple of reasons. First the Hans thing. It's not even that she's going out with Hans in particular - it's having that typre of relationship, period. I want that. I want it so bad. I'm seventeen, for crying out loud! How many girls have never kissed or gone out with a guy at that point? Probably a lot more than I think, and I'm probably overreacting, but God! If she goes out with Hans (which I must assume involves kissing, lol) I will be the only girl...no, scratch that, the only PERSON in our group who has never kissed a member of the opposite sex. Even Drew Barrymore wasn't that pathetic. She'd just never had a "true love" kind of kiss. Heck, I'd settle for any kind at all.
See what I mean? I hate this. I hate feeling sorry for myself. I always feel guilty, like I'm indulging in something illicit. But I know that's silly. I'm the only person I know who doesn't discuss their jealousies etc with other people. Most girls will tell anyone at all when they feel sorry for themselves. I'm at the other extreme. I've listened to too many people beg for attention and sympathy, and get it, and lap it up. I refuse to do that, cause I don't want to inconvenience or irritate people, and then I feel like a martyr, except that I hide it so well that nobody realized I have any problems to hide, and then I feel sorry for myself again cause no one realized I'm a martyr, and extremely jealous of those less heroic people who selfishly heap their problems on others and then get sympathy, even though they're not martyrs. And then I get mad cause people don't feel sorry for my martyrdom, even though if they did realize I was upset and commiserate with me, it would defeat the whole purpose behind my being a martyr in the first place! I am just a mass of contradictions. Grrr.

Anyway. Still sorting things out. A cynical, depressive, confused sort of day, but with sunny patches. At least in here I can feel sorry for myself in a straight-forward manner. 
More sun tomorrow hopefully! Got a million and one things to do, and am enjoying the feeling of finally having no one else here.
Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Friday, June 14/02


So, I guess school's over, except for finals next Monday and Tuesday. Feels so weird. I'm actually, amazingly, goiing to miss school. I won't see any of those people for 2 months. Gawd, that's so sad. How pathetically social I've become.

It's been absolutely gorgieous (again with the stupid word...someday, I'll learn how to spell!) this whole week, sunny and warm. Yesterday and today were positvely hot. (30+ degrees.) It's not too humid, though, so I don't mind the heat. Actually quite pleasant in the shade. It's amazing how bitchy people around here can be about the weather. Imaginc complaining about the heat and sun! Like, hello! You live in one of the coldest, rainiest places in the country in terms of summers - enjoy this weather well it lasts. I guess, though, that living here, people's bodies just aren't acclimatized to the heat. Mine shouldn't be either, since I've lived here for five years, but I remember Southern Ontario and I remember heat waves and humidity - this is nothing!

This last week of school has been busy, but I've really enjoyed it - particularly Socials. Cameron won that election, as I suspected he would. He got 20 votes, I got 14, Eric got 7, and Devon got 3 (Thank Goodness!) There were 3 uncountable ballots (one with a checkmark, two with the tags not torn off), all of which were for me, so technically I got 17. Which isn't bad at all, I think. This week we did a Mock Parliament Simulation, were we practiced passing bills. I was part of the Governing party (the Liberals, of course.) Eric was the Prime Minister. The simulation only lasted 2 days, cause we were out of time. I wish we could have had longer: it was fun! Our two most successful bills (the Opposition didn't even oppose them!) were the Prositution Act and the Extended Life Sentence Act. I wanted to pass one called the Excessive Public Affection Act, but we ran out of time.
Seriously, it's sick. I mean, I know it's spring and all, and couples have a right to be touchy, but man! The cafetria is like Makeout Central. Like, keep your tongue in your own mouth when at school Please! At least they could look for someplace more private. Makes me want to throw up.


Monday, Jun 17/02

Well, that sort of dwindled off. I lay down outside in the sun...BAAAD idea if you intend to get anythign accomplished that day.
I should be studying now - I've got my Biology and Socials finals tomorrow, and then I'm done - but I don't really feel like it.

Went to Katy's cabin by the Lake on Friday with her and Beth. It was really fun - the water was so warm! Her cabin's really cool...I'd never been out there before, but I think practically everyone else in the known world has. It's got solar-powered lights, but no running water and no bathroom - just an outhouse. A couple of years ago Cameron Adam threw up all over the outhouse - thankfully, all traces are now gone. We got scared out of our wits by a stupid rabbit when we went out there at midnight. Wound up peeing in the bushes instead.
I think they may have converted me. We spent the entire time we were out there listening to country music - Katy and Beth both love it - and now I like it too...well, some of it. That sucks. I don't want to like country! I don't like it! (Oh yeah, that makes a whole lot of sense!) But some of it's catchy. I downloaded a bunch of the songs on Kazaa. There's one song I had to get just cause I love the title line: "Just call me Cleopatra, cause I'm the Queen of Denial." I think that's a great pun! It's so cute! Anyway.

Jon is so adorable. Grrr. I really don't want to like him. He's such a prick. He's also been virtually nonexistant the past few weeks - hanging out with Cam and Brad and Brody - and it makes me so mad. How can I gaze longingly at him if he's never there?! :P
Travis Earl looked really sexy today too. He hasn't been lately, but today... He was wearing different clothing than normal, and his hair wasn't gelled. It looked so cute. Totally changes the shape of his face.
I'm babbling. Bother. Better go study before this gets ridiculous.


Tuesday, June 18, 2002

I keep wanting to write "January" instead of "June." Don't know why...it's definitely not January!
So I'm officially out of school now for the summer. I don't know whether I'm excited or what. Feels like we're still in those classes...particularly Socials, although I'm not sure why. Just taking a break. That's the only course which I'm not taking next year as well, although I'm taking Comparative Civilizations, and that's similar. I really wish there was a class devoted to Government and mock Parliament and stuff - the would be so cool! Like, a scenario-based course. I had way more fun in the last two weeks of Socials than I had in the entire rest of that course. I love arguing! (Sorry - "debating"...whatever. Same thing.) Ms Geier thinks I'm wonderful. She told Cameron and I we should go into politics, as we were very "charismatic speakers" and "thoughtful individuals." I didn't say "not in a million years," but I thought about it.

Ironically, my easiest finals were Math and Socials, both of which I was worried about, and my tough ones were Biology, which I expected to be easy, and Physics. On every single Biology test, Mr Jones put the question "What is Biology?" for multiple choice.The answer is "The Study of Life." I laughed so hard at the options he gave for that question on the Final, though. there were only two: "The study of life" or "a class where you sit and play with the taps." I just about killed myself - that's exactly what people do in that class. I don't htink they realize he notices...

Watched "About a Boy" at the theatre this evening with Cayley and Katy. It was a really good movie. About Hugh Grant being an asshole - it's actually a perfect role for him. The plot is interesting - it's about the relationship between a screwed-up kid and this useless, insensitive single asshole - and the monologue and dialogue is hilarious! Plus the soundtrack was good. We loved it!

Cameron Adam is smart and nice and thoughtful (as much as can be expected, anyway) and cute. Why don't I have a crush on him? It would be so easy. Way better than having what amounts to a crush on stupid Jon Rife. Grrr. But Jon's so adorable. I don't get him. Sometimes he looks at me like he's interested, but his whole personality and demeanor says he isn't. So, what?! It's so annoying. He'd be fine to have a crush on if I hadn't finally reached the point where I'm looking for reciprocity in a relationship, but I think that, unfortunately, I have. *sigh*
Hormonal (as usual) smudges, Kitty. :)


Wednesday, June 19/02

Kurt and Mark Biagioni are so completely different physically, mentally, and socially, it's amazing to think they're brothers. Aside from their eyes, noses, and a few expressions and gestures, there is no discernable similarity between them.
Kurt, as you know, has extremely curly hair, glasses, and a quiet, withdrawn, extremely weird personality. Also, he sucks at sealing with females and is probably the least obviously sexual teenaged guy I know.
Mark is the total opposite. He's got straight (mussy) dark hair which bears no resemblance to Kurt's ringlets. He's not obviously birhgt (although I think he is, really) and he's got a very open, silly personality. And (here's the big one) he's such a player! He flirts with and hits on absolutely everything female. And he's so obvious it'spainful. He does it on purpose and it doesn't mean anything, but he does it all the time. Like, to everyone. He can't pass up the chance for a one-liner. We (lots of people) were at the hotsprings this evening (lived here for five years and I'd never been there!), and I think he managed to hit on every single one of us...

It might be creepy or offensive if it were anyone else, but Mark is...Mark. Everyone knows he's joking, but it's still kind of fun and flattering. Plus I think he's adorable. That's so sad...he's like, 2 years younger than us. He says he likes "older women". Whatever. But he is cute - I really like his hair, and his build - like Jon, he's "cut". And not too tall. (Give him time, I know). Anyway, we hardly ever see him, but it's fun looking at him when we do, and being hit on, particularly by a cute, non-creepy guy (even one who's amazingly horny and completely not serious) is an interesting experience. The only other guy who does that to me is Ken, and that's just plain creepy.

Got pictures back today that I'd forgotten I had. Old photos, from like, October. The murder-mystery thing, and Cayley's Christmas party. Back when Jon wasn't an asshole. Ah, memories...
Gnight, Kitty. :)


Friday, June 21, 2002

We just watched a really cool, creepy movie. It's a roman Polanski film called The Ninth Gate, starring Johnny Depp. As you can imagine from the title, it's about Hell and summoning the Devil - very bizarre. But interesting, and some beautiful filming, particularly the last scene. Unfortunately, Johnny Depp isn't nearly as cute as he was in Chocolat; he wore glasses, had a beard, and his hair was short. Oh well.

Yesterday evening we had our Senior Recital. I should have got you to wish us luck, cause man, we needed it. I played Bumble Boogie and Someone to Watch Over Me, which I dedicated to Hannah. I played the Bumble Boogie at the end of the first half, so my fingers were completely cold. That piece sounds really awesome if your fingers work, but when they're cold it's just a mistake. Someone To Watch Over Me was less obviously flawed, but the memory wasn't very strong, and the performance could have been a lot tighter. Manda and I did our duet last thing, though, and it was awesome! We walked on with sparkly dresses and carnations between our teeth - it was so cute. And the beginning of our piece was a surprise - we didn't even tell Bonnie. We sat down, counted...and started playing Heart and Soul! It was so hilarious! We spent actually quite a good deal of time the past week or so figuring how to modulate efficiently from Heart and Soul to Bolero. We finally got it, and it actually sounds really neat. Even Bonnie, although initially shocked, thought it was funny. At the end, we blew kisses and tossed our flowers into the audience. We were the last act, and definitely a good way to end the night.

Danny Chapman, Hannah Huston, Katy, and David came to watch us, and afterwards me, Manda, Hayley Sullivan, and them hung out (minus David, the hermit.) Then we lost Hayley and went to Manda's to watch the Holy Grail. Somehow, that turned into topless back massages. (A wonderful pastime). I think Danny must think I'm weird now - they made Hannah (who pushes hard, but isn't as good as Eric) give me one so that those who had missed the experience could hear me squeal. Then Danny did it, except he didn't push hard enough. Then I did Danny (shut up!) and probably pushed too hard, although he said he enjoyed it. He smelled really nice - like sweat, but very faintly. I know most people don't think of that as a good smell, but I like the smell of mature male sweat, in moderation. I think that's probably cause I associate it with Riley and Stephen and being little, so it's a comfortable smell. Anyway. I'm weird.

Then last night (still) I slept over at Katy's house, which was easier than going home at 2am. We got hardly any sleep - we talked until almost four. We woke up at ten, went to my place, and hung out there till 3:30 pm...basically just talking all the time. It's really nice to have someone you don't run out of things to say to.

This afternoon was the longest night of the year (summer solstice), so Karla and Graham had a mini-party to celebrate. Dad is in Abbotsford, so it was them, us minus Dad, Barry and Marian, Barry's teenage daughter Anna, and Marrianne and her husband. Marianne is amazingly opinionated - about everything! I liked Anna; she seems like an interesting person. She's live in the UAE (United Arab Emirates, for the geography/acronym-challenged) for 2 years, and then Sweden last year. She graduated last year, but she was a grade ahead, so I guess she'd be a year older than me. We exchanged phone numbers - she doesn't know anybody in Terrace, so I promised to invite her next time we go somewhere, and introduce her to all my crazy friends.

Tyra's having a sleepover-tent-type thing tomorrow night. Should be fun.Or stupid. Or both. Whatever.
Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Sunday, June 23rd, '02

Hans Seidemann is a very interesting person. He was at Tyra's house with us last night, and every time I see him I have more respect for him. He's very bright, and thoughtful, and artistic (obviously), and dedicated. Plus really nice, and absolutely hilarious... Really, I ought to have a crush on him. Shame I don't. Yet, anyway. He talked to me and Katy (Katy and I?) for a long time, and we had an interesting conversation, cause he's interested in Linguistics (!!) - like, Latin and Greek and stuff - and Physics, which Katy and I keep bringing up accidentally (we're such nerds.) We have a similar taste in books and movies, and he likes Monty Python! Very cool.

Anyway, last night was really fun, and not just because of Hans, although I suspect he pretty much tied the group together. Travis was hanging out with Tyra's younger sister and the other Grade 9's, Eric's in Vancouver having ear surgery, and Jon wasn't there, so if Hans had been absent we would have had Kurt and a lot of girls. And no offense, but lately I've been finding Kurt kind of boring. Plus Cayley usurps him all the time anyway, so we would have had the Cayley-Kurt cuddle session in the corner, plus a lot of really bored girls. As it was, we had a great time. There were (initially) seven of us in my ancient Timberline tent, and we played "Honey If You Love Me" and "Truth of Dare". As people got tired, they left for the other tent, so we wound up with myself, Katy, Tyra, and Hans in the tent. And had a blast. I'm very proud of myself for being the only one out of 5 people who could crack Hans at Honey If You Love Me. That was with touching and ad-libbing and it still took me a bloody long time. I wound up talking about toes and various bodily orifices...luckily (and surprisingly) he laughed before I actually had to do anthing with toes and orifices. I was proud and relieved. No one else got him. He's also an amazing masseur...I hate to say this, but he may be better than Eric! And that's saying something!

The rain was fun, too. I was really stupid and set up the ground sheet entirely wrong, so we wound up with a lake. We ought to have at least noticed, and moved things...it's not like we were asleep. We stayed up til about 6:30am, the four of us. And I wasn't even tired! It was so bizarre.
So anyway. I invited Hans to my birthday party on Friday, though I don't know if he'll make it. Hope so - it's always nicer to have a higher male contingent, and he's so cool! 
I'm gushing. Caitlin, shut up.
I could write more (I've more to write about) but I got 2/3 hours sleep last night and now, finally, I'm tired.
Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Monday, June 24, 2002

Well, THAT was a thoroughly boring and pointless evening. Really. 
Cayely, Travis, and I went to Uplands, where we were supposed to meet other people, but there was this Griffin and Sabine-y parallel universe thing, and somehow the two groups were there at the same time but missed each other completely. So finally, we got tired of waiting and drove to Ferry Island, where we caught tadpoles. Travis started out nice, but then he became really stupid and really really horny, which was irritating. There's no bigger turn-off than a horny guy (ironically enough.) He asked us to give him a hand-job. We said Eww no. He asked us to give him a blowjob. We said definitely not. He said Mr Nordin and Captain Planet were his heroes. He said he wanted Kurt to give him a blowjob. Or Steven, Kurt's older brother. We smiled and nodded.
Then we got ahold of the others, who were at Tyra's, so we went there. Travis and Mike went off with LIndsay and Lindy (I'm not sure I even want to know...no seriously, it's bad), and the rest of us played "Honey If you Love me...", which, I must grudgingly admit, was fun. Driving Travis home, he told me that the girls want to know if he and Mike wanted relationships. He was asking my advice...it was sort of cute, in an ironic way. He said it was a really confusing situation and he didn't know what to do. I said no shit. He wondered what he would tell his parents. I said I seemed to recall that he asked me out not so very long ago, so he must have given at least some passing thought to the situation. He said uh, yeah, well, umm.... I told him not to rush into anything he wasn't prepared for, but also not to expect physical attention from girls without giving some degree of emotional commitment in return. He said I sounded like his mother. I said maybe he should listen to his mother occasionally - she clearly gave good advice. :p Anyway. At least (this is the selfish upshot) it gets him out of my hair once and for all.
Tick tick tick.
Never criticize someone until you've walked a mile in his shoes. That way, when you criticize him, you're a mile away and wearing his shoes!
Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Thursday, June 27, 2002

Had the most ridiculously long, boring Awards Ceremony EVER this evening. It was three hours long, and no, I am not exagerrating. We had to sit up on the stage (at the REM) too, in hard wooden seats with hot lights blaring on us. You couldn't even fall asleep or read a book or anything. There were an hour and a half of Scholarships and that was especially dull. I hate clapping, and I hate being clapped at. People seem to be paranoid about silence: as soon as a speaker pauses for breath, they have to clap again. They clap when the announcer comes out; the clap when the award winner's name is announced; they clap when the person comes up; they clap when the hands are shaken, they clap as the person returns to his seat. I got fed up early on, and decided toclap only three times for each person, just to save my poor hands. I got awards for English, Socials, Math, and Stagecraft, but not CAPP or any of the Sciences (I was kind of surprised by that, but oh well. Que sera...) I also (and this I'm proud of) got the Most Outsanding Grade 11 Student, along with Kim Smith. That means we tied for highest percent average during the year. I didn't expect to get that award. I was so surprised when Mr Wootton announced my name, I practically jumped! Then he had to talk about me, you know, and how wonderful I am, and like that. It was embarassing, but kind of fun. Katy was in the audience, and I could see her laughing her head off when he walked about my "inquisitive" nature, etc. She knows the truth.

Anyway. Martina's over, and I'm having my birthday party tomorrow. Gonna be like, ten people here if everyone who's invited comes. Plus it's a sleepover...so I probably won't write tomorrow. But definitely Saturday. Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Sunday, June 30, 2002

Saturday/Sunday...whatever. We slept over at Katy's house last night, so I didn't write. I should definitely write at lenght about the last couple of nights' events, and eventually (like tomorrow, maybe?) I probably will. Hans is a very very cool person, and the best part is that he likes us too! I may wind up with a crush on him after all (definitely not telling Cayley...reasons to follow later), and I sure hope so. He's a perfect person to have a crush on. I don't want to rave and ramble again, but wow. And he's so well-rounded. Goodness. I suspect a developing crush mainly because of my reaction to his attentions towards Cayely. Not that they were anything - that's the thing. But she's rapidly developing a huge crush on him (like, bigger than Kurt) and so, being Cayley, she's throwing herself at him. It embarasses me, watching her. And yet, the irritating thing is, it seems to work. I hate that, cause I am not a forward person by nature, and could never do it. The playing field is not level. Anyway, we did quizzes, which were interesting, as usual. Jon didn't do it properly (on purpose) but Kurt and Hans did, and their answers were...enlightening. Hans would go out (he says) with me or Cayley if either of us asked him. (Of course, that's really really hard to tell until you're actually in the situation - as I know.) His first choice for a one-night stand is Cayley - second choice is me - and he wants Cayley on his desert island. Obviously, then, if Cayley throws herself at him, he's going to respond. And it was making me jealous! Like, bitchy-mood jealous. Usually, jealousy is one of those feelings I can hide well enough that it doesn't look like anything bothers me. Yesterday, I almost let it show... Anyway. Liking Hans would not be a bad thing - he's exactly the sort of person I should like, plus he's going to SFU next year so it doesn't matter anyway.
Kurt's answers to that survey were strange too, btw. He said he'd go out with me or Cayley if we asked (not true, but maybe he doesn't realize that), but for the one-night stand and Island questions, his answers were backwards. He put me first for the one-night stand and Cayley second, instead of the other way round, and I'm on his island. Bizarre. Plus he said my most attractive physical characteristics were my breasts (!!) and my "body shape in general." So strange. So not what I was expecting from Kurt.
Anyway, I'm so so tired - way too little sleep the last two nights - but I'll do my utmost to write tomorrow.
Gnight, Kitty. :)

[[sidenote: this was Harem-creation night and I didn't even *mention* it in my journal! Isn't it funny how things take on different degrees of importance in retrospect?]]

Saturday, June 1st, 2002
Thank you so much, Kitty - today was absolutely beautiful - first time in weeks! Had fun this evening. It was a great night for a water fight - 5 degrees warmer and it would have been perfect - and we all got thoroughly soaked. There were about 17 people there - us, Lyndsay Weitman's friends, five rupertites, and various hangers-on ("friends and relations"...) Initially it was Terrace vs Rupert, but that quickly disintegrated into an every-man-(woman and child)-for-his-or-her-self kind of battle. Which was more fun anyway. Then we watched Rocky Horror - we had to deflower 4 Rocky virgins - Lance, Hans, andrew (a guy from Rupert), and Mark, Kurt's younger brother. We were so loud during the movie, however, that I doubt they heard much of the dialogue or understood much of the plot. Might as well have seen it in a theatre (something I definately want to do some day!)

Hans Seidemann is a very interesting person, not to mention a nut. I swear, he's crazy. But so funny - he's hilarious to watch. Plus smart, and graceful...Cayley's in definite danger of having a crush on him, and I must say I can see why...

Mark...is attractive. Unfortunately, he's also in grade 9, which makes attraction to him weird and bordering on pedophilia. But why, then, is it okay for guys to like girls two years younger, but not vice-versa? Cultural stigmas are irritating. Not that I could actually like Mark anyway. I haven't sepnt much time around him, but he strikes me as arrogant and self-centred, and extremely aware of his looks. Nevertheless, eh's adorable, in much the same way Jon is. Instigates that "I want to touch you" reaction. Sigh.

Whew. Water-fighting is tiring work.
goodnight, Kitty. :)

Friday, June 7?, 2002
Finally convinced my dad to let us get KaZaA on the games computer upstairs! It's so exciting. I've downloaded a bunch of songs, mostly ones I've wanted forever, plus some ones from CDs I've lost. Eric's really into Queen (again, the sexual ambiguity!), and I downloaded a bunch of their songs. I love Bohemian Rhapsody, and I also really really like The Bike Song and Fat-Bottom Girls (although that one makes me feel self-conscious - I'm the epitome of fat-bottom girl!)) I got lots of Harry Nilsson songs, and the Barenaked Ladies' "This is me in Grade 9" which is hilarioius cause I know exactly what it's talking about. Half my friends are crazy and the others are depressed... Of course, I've also got some songs which I couldn't resist, even though I'm embarassed to admit I like them. A good example is "The Bad Touch" by the Bloodhound Gang. If you were alive and conscious in the year 2001, you know the song..."You 'n' me, baby, ain't nothing' but mammals, so lets do it like they do on the Discovery Channel..." Yeah, you know. It's a pretty dumb song, and the philosophy is somewhat questionable (understatement of the year!), but I love it! The lyrics are so cute - "so put your hands down my pants, and I bet you'll feel nuts; you make me rise an hour early just like Daylight Savings Time." I think a large part of why I like it, however, is the memories it invokes.
Probably the most sexual experience I've ever had, strange as this may sound, is slow-dancing with Jon. (I'm not sure whether I like him partly because of that or whether I liked that partly because I like him, but the two are definitely related.) I've only ever danced with him twice - once at Lindsay's house, and once at the Video Dance. I think I've talked about this before: since he's so small and not a million miles taller than me, we fit very well together. When we dance, then, we wind up touching all the way up and down, with no space visible between us. This was quite a sexual experience for me, and I just wanted to be there forever. Anyway, I don't remember what song we danced to at the Video Dance, but it was the very last song they played before sutting down. Earlier, they'd played The Bad Touch (as a fast song, of course) and when the dance ended, that was the song I had in my head. But the experience I had in my head was of dancing with Jon, and somehow the two got intertwined in my brain. Now whenever I hear that song, I think about that. As a result, I like the song. (Incidentally, it's also about the closest to horny that I get when I'm not ovulating. If you ever want to get me aroused...!!)

Got our yearbooks this week, too. They aren't very well done, but you've got to give the club credit - it was a rush job, and there weren't a whole lot of people involved. I think I may have to join again next year, just to make sure that the end product meets my standard. The best part about annuals though, of course, isn't what's inside, but rather all the signatures and messages people put on the inside covers. People are so funny, and the things they write capture their personalities perfectly! Kelso, for example, wrote to remind me of the time we "got all liquored up and had mad sex on the piano", which is just exactly like Kelso.

In Socials this week, we've been learning about the election process, and we held a mock election, in conjunction with Mr Harrison's class. I stuck up my hand to volunteer for the NDP candidacy, just to look like I was participating - I didn't actually want to do it. However, everyone else in the NDP decided I had to be the candidate - as Matt put it: "You're smart, you use big, confusing words, and no one's got a personal grudge against you." So I was in. My opponents were Devon Mercer (an idiot) for the Canadian Alliance; Eric (Beaupre) for the Liberals; and Cam Adam for the Progressive Conservatives. We each had to prepare a speech to present to the electorate which outlined out platforms. It was a Federal election, but it only covered the Skeena Riding so Federal and Regional issues were both discussed. Then we had a question period. That was tough. It's one thing to read a prepared speech to a class; it's quite another to have to stand up and answer questions on the spot off the top of your head. And they were really tough questions, too, pertaining to issues such as abortion, euthanasia, bulk water exports, offshore oil drilling, etc. We all had difficulties, but the funny thing was that, although we were supposed to be representing the different parties, for the most part our opinions on the issues were similar, and our arguments were similar. Thus it became desirable to be the first to speak, since otherwise you sounded like a copycat. It was also interesting having three smart candidates and one stupid one - poor Devon never knew anything about the issues, so for the most part he didn't say much.
Once it was over, and the ballots were being cast, I realized I'd had fun. It was very stressful, particularly the question period, but it was exacting and exhilerating at the same time. CAmeron and Eric felt the same way. We'd just finished voting when the bell rang, so the results won't be tallied til Monday. I'm so mad. I want to know who won now! My money is on Cameron, personally. I think he came across the best, he countered the questions well, and his policies coincide with the mindsets of many of the people in the classes.
Oh well. It was fun,and as long as Devon doesn't win (please God!) I'll be happy.
Only one full week of school left. Can you believe it?!
Wish Lowell luck on his piano exam tomorrow. Grade five!!
Gnite, Kitty. :)

Saturday, June 8, 2002
It's strange discovering you have a twin, especially when you've already not had one for almost 17 years. But Katy and I have decided we must be twins in some other dimension or something - nothing else could explain our remarkable similarities. Like, we feel the same about practically everything. Well, no, that's not necessarily true - it's our approach to things, how we view and understand them, that is the same. Ideologically, we vary on a couple of major points: mainly the fact that she's very religious and I'm not religious in any way at all. She's strongly Christian, but...its okay all the same. Usually I avoid the subject of religion, well, religiously, unless I'm sure I'm talking to an atheist or an agnostic. Zealots are just too hard to handle: I don't have a problem with people being religious, but others often have a problem with my lack of religion, and its best to just avoid those conversations altogether - I'm not a confrontational person by nature. With Katy, however, I can talk about religion and its related topics. (Evolution/creationism, etc). She's very open-minded, and accepts others' opnions without taking offense. She has the same problem talking with atheists as I tend to have with theists - she says she feels blamed and scorned, and it makes her mad. We're both interested in the concepts (particularly the Evolution thing) and it's really neat to be able to talk about that kind of thing from someone that's starting from the opposite end of the spectrum. Since we're both open-minded and non-confrontational, we can have intersting, rational discussions about controversial topics without pissing each other off. It's like we're approaching from differen t starting points, but at the same angle. Or something. It makes her an interesting person to talk with, cause we don't just spend the whole time agreeing with each other. We've also discovered that, aside from that one glaring difference, we have a lot of similar opinions about issues. We have similar interests, we like the same books, we've got the same peculiar quirks, and we often reach the same conclusions at virtually the same time. It's sort of scary. Raises the whole nature vs nurture debate. We come from very different backgrounds, and yet we're so similar. About the only place we don't agree is on the guys we like, which is good cause that would suck! If I like anyone, it's Jon Rife. Ironically, I suspect that he likes Katy milkly, but she doesn't like him. At the moment she's got semi-crushes (meaning she's actively fighting them but becoming resigned) on three guys: David Johnstone, Chris Chapman, and Haydn Johnstone. David and Haydn aren't relaed, which makes it even funnier that they have the same last name. The only one of those guys I can see liking is David, but I don't find him at all physically attractive.
I'm worried, however (speaking of crushes) that I may wind up having a crush on Cameron Kelso. Normally, I don't ever have crushes on guy swith girlfriends (they're out of bounds) but Cam's so sweet! He's one of the nicest guys my age I know. I mean, he's nice to everyone. And he's cute. Not as cute (or different-cute) as Cameron Adam, but cute. But he's got a girlfriend, and they make an adorable couple, so I'm doing my utmost to discourage the notion. A summer will doubtless help...

I've more I could write (memo to self: A Clockwork Orange), but it's nearly 2am and I think we're going to the lake tomorrow.
Gnight, Kitty. :)


Monday, June 10, 2002
Yesterday (Sunday) was absolutely gorgieous (I hate that word!), as was today, for that matter. Cayley, Katy, Eric, and I went to the lake yesterday afternoon and had a wonderful time basking and gossiping about all the things teenagers usually gossip about. We swam, too - the water was a bit cold, but once you got in (and your body went numb!) it was alright. The top foot of water was quite bearable. Foolish Cayley and Eric only waded, but Katy and I swam out a good ways. I sunburned my back, but the rest of me's just nicely tanned.

Beautiful weather again today, as I said, so I wore my little blue dress. It's so pretty! Two years ago, I wouldn't have even considered wearing it. I hated dresses, and particularly short ones. This one's about to my knees - actually very modest, considering it's a summer dress (however, that's mainly cause my legs are so short).

There's this annoying, though bright, kid in my Socials class named Barry...something. Wolfenden? I'm not sure. He's that sort of blustery, confrontational know-it-all cynical opinionated showoff who gets on practically everyone's nerves - especially teachers. However, he is smart, and he reads, um, voraciously, for lack of a better word. The only other people in that class (and probably in our grade) who read real books (like, not fluff and not entirely Scifi/Fantasy oriented...like, literature!) are Travis Earl (the beautiful asshole) and myself. Barry loves to argue about books, and on Friday (or Thursday; I forget and it doesn't matter) he "informed" me that I had to read "A Clockwork Orange" cause he wanted someone besides Travis to argue about it with. I asked Dad about it, and he said it was a rather bleak, depressing novel in the style of 1984, which didn't surprise me cause that's just exactly the sort of thing Barry always reads. Stanley Kubrick made a movie of it, which Dad and I watched Saturday night. It was quite disturbing and surreal - I'm interested now to read the book. [[I still haven't read it. Urr.]] Barry says that the movie in no way does justice to it. However, that could just be Barry.
I was asking everyone yesterday if anyone had read it - they hadn't but Cayley said something odd. She said that, according to Kassi Thomspsen, Barry likes me, or he would "if I weren't emotionless." I am not emotionless - this diary is, if anything, a testament to that fact. I wonder if he meant if he weren't emotionless? That's also not true, but it does sound like something Barry would say about himself. 'Sfunny, cause I never would have suspected Barry of liking me, but all the same, it doesn't shock me nearly as much as it did when I found out Travis like me, even though I'd sort of suspected that one for a while. I think it's because, if anyone was going to like me, the person it ought to be is Barry. He's the sort of guy who should like me, cause he doesn't really care about appearances at all, and he certainly doesn't care about popularity, but he's definitely concerned with intelligence. I don't think he could like anyone (or even stand being around anyone) who's mind he couldn't respect. I'm likely the smartest (or at least most cynical) girl in our grade at Cal, and definitely the best-read. So at least there are reasons for him to like me, even if it is still ridiculous. When we did those compatability tests earlier this year, Barry matched with me at 98%, which is terrifying - I definitely don't want to be like Barry! With Travis, it doesn't make any sense. I still can't imagine what could possibly have attracted him to me - we're so completely different, and I'm not even pretty!

Actually, that compatability thing was pretty funny all the way round... Jon rife, Travis Earl, and Cam Kelso were all in my list of 10! I have this vague suspicion that Chris England has a minor crush on me (again, no idea why), and both he and Barry are also on the list! Who knows - maybe those things actually work after all!
Sweet dreams, Kitty. :)

Friday, May 16/17, 2002


Everyone is gone (and soon coming back, I believe) from movies; Spiderman and Star Wars; Episode 2, both of which I am eager to see, which by exhaustion I was prevented by going to see. Instead I stayed here and had quite a pleasant time bathing, reading, and cleaning the room. It is almost certain that, had I gone to a movie, I should have fallen asleep in the middle of it, I am so ridiculously tired. The reason is a peculiar, indeed an explicable one, and is as follows:

Yesterday evening we determined to go to bed early, since a lack of sleep had been a notable characteristic of the last few days. The choir was set to sing this morning at eight am, which meant that those of us involved were to be on the bus by seven. Accordingly, we kicked everyone out of our room by eleven last night, set our alarm for six, and went to sleep. 
The clock showed the right time as we locked the door and turned off the light, I swear it. Yet the 6am alarm seemed to come awfully early, and the sky was not yet lightening. At 6:45 by our clock, fifteen minutes before the bus's scheduled departure, no one was stirring in the hallways around us. At last, we questioned the veracity of the clock, comparing it with the television and my watch. Sure enough, our suspicions were correct: it was, in fact, 4:45am, two hours earlier than the time shown on our clock...a clock which had most assuredly been right the last time we were conscious.

So what happened? We are as yet at a loss. Either some one got into our room while we were all sleeping and changed the clock, while disturbing nothing else (which seems highly unlikely) or else one of us reset the insturment. Such certainly seems as though it must be the case, but none can recall doing such a thing, and [it] is not such an easy task to attempt while asleep/unconscious, unless one has previous familiarity with the object (which none of us has), for to change the settings requires the depression of two buttons at once. In addition, nothing on the desk around the phone was disturbed, which suggests a culprit who was conscious of his actions at the time.
At any rate, I found it a disturbing situation. Two things, in addition, became clear to me as a result of this incident: first, our reliance on gadgetry and technology to organize and run our lives, and secondly, our absolute acceptance of these devices as true, despite what our senses tell us to the contrary. (It should not be pitch dark at 6:30 am in Northern Canada in May!

Leaving this even behind for the moment...
Our choir performed very well. I think, in fact, that it was probably the best performance we've done of those or any other pieces. The adjudicator talked about achieving a hollow tone quality, as practically all adjudicators do, but I found his approach particularly helpful. (I wonder what they work on once you've got that one down?!) I don't know what class we got, but I'm better Bronze or Silver. I think we deserve silver, but I wouldn't be surprised or disappointed with a bronze. AS Eric put it, "Who cares what the fucking mark is? We know we did well!" I got the Honor Award for choir. They give one to a single participant in each group, chosen by the director. It's based on commitment and skill. So that's kind of cool.
Concert Band was this afternoon. I thought it went well too, although I don't really know enough about it to say for sure. They had awesome timpanis! It was so cool! To begin with, there were four of them, which certainly made life easier, but the really cool part was that they had tuning bars on the side that told you what note you were on. Such luxury! It was awesome!

I think tomorrow we get to sleep in (thank God!) and then Jazz Band performs in the afternoon. And we drive home on Sunday - the band trip's almost over! *Sigh*
I'm going to sleep now, I think. I'm so tired.

PS. You should see the shirt Katie made me buy today. It's a black tank top and it says "Good girls are bad girls that don't get caught." She says it's "So me". ...I dunno, I always thought myself better than that! Anyway. Gnight, Kitty. :)
(I apologise for the haughty, peculiar tone this entry likely took, btw - I'm sure it was annoying. I couldn't help it though, you see - I've been reading Pride and Prejudice, and there've been a lot of letters recently (stupid Lydia took up with bad Wickham), and they all sound like that. Anyway, apologies. :)


Monday, May 20?

Was exhausted from packing, so I didn't write Saturday. Probably should have written on the bus Sunday, but I was too busy sleeping.
The Jazz Band did well. We got silver. Funny thing - our adjudicator was the son of the adjudicator we had at the local festival! They have very different styles. And I was amazed - he didn't even mention the rhythm section. Adjudicators sometimes like us a lot and sometimes really don't, but they always say something. Not this fella.

Didn't go to the Participants' Dance Saturday night. I wanted to, but I was tired, and dizzy from going on too many (actually, one) really spinny twisty ride at Callaway Amusement Park that evening. Heard lots of interesting things about the dance though... Yes, let your imagination run wild; that is what I'm talking about. Think about it: 7000 horny, geeky teenagers stuffed into one room in the darkness with loud, sexual music. What would you do? According to Tyra, it was like "Dry Sexy City". Lots of people making out with people they'd known for 15 minutes. Eric and Jon both hooked up with Grade 9 girls from other schools. Grade 9! That's practically cradle-robbery, especially if you don't know the person beforehand. Eric was covered in sparkles from head to foot; Cayley said he looked like he'd "blown a clown". Hmm. Now that's a disturbing image. Anyway. Bus ride back didn't seem as long as I thought it would.
Unpacked, slept, and did homework today (not in that order.) School tomorrow. Blah.
Fun trip, though. :) Gnight, Kitty. :)


Friday, May 24/02

Antibiotics are wonderful things. I've only taken 3 doses, and already I feel miles better than I did this afternoon.
I've got strep throat. Actually, a number of people from the band trip have it: Katy, Eric, Aisling, and Chris Chapman, to name a few. I guess we just spent too much time in close quarters. Cayley asked if we'd had a secret orgy and didn't tell her. I said I didn't think so... ;) So I've missed the last two days of school, which isn't good since we just got back and not really caught up yet. Not much use worrying, though.

I was thinking about masturbation. Seems like a strange thing to be thinking about, I know. that last night on the bus, Katy, Jon, Cameron Adam, Brody, and Brian Wyatt played a Truth or Dare game which was mostly Truth. I came in for about the last 1/2 hour before we got home, by which point it had basically disintegrated into a discussion about masturbation. Jon was refusing to participate, and didn't want me to, either - he said I already knew too much about him. I couldn't think what he meant - I don't know anything about Jon, cause he never tells us a thing - until I realized what they were talking about. When we did that Quiz thing a few months back (remember?), one of hte guys' questions was: "How often do you jerk off?" The things were supposed to be confidential, if you'll recall, but there weren't many guys there that night, and we sort of figured out whose was whose. I guess that must have been what he didn't want me to share with Cam, Brody, and Brian. Not that I would have dreamed of it anyway!
It was a strange conversation. Guys whack off a lot, although most don't do it daily...anymore! Most of them said they used to, though. Then they asked Katy and me if either of us had ever masturbated. We said no, emphatically. "I think it's more of a process for girls than it is for guys," we said. "Let's face it, all you have to do is rub."
"But why wouldn't you want to masturbate?" They asked.
"Well," we said, "for that matter, why would we?"
They looked at each other and shook their heads. "Try it," said Brody, "And then ask us that again."
When I related this conversation to Eric at school on Tuesday, he laughed and laughed. I guess that's so, though. I mean, I can't think of a good reason to spend all the time you must have to spend to masturbate, but then - how would I know? I've never done it! Still, though, that's sick. The whole idea kind of disgusts me. It's almost sad, too, in a way. Plus, I wouldn't even know how to go about it! [[Wow. Just...wow.]]

Why am I talking about this anyway? Goodness, I am a strange child. And an ill one.
Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Saturday, May 25/02

I wish I had something to write about - I'm in a writing mood. But I haven't. I'm still sick - my whole head feels like it's about to explode. Funny ; this kind of round, almost girly writing seems very upbeat and well. It belies its true nature.

Reading a book by Margaret Atwood called Lady Oracle. It's about a woman whose life has been a series of lies, who is once again trying to reinvent herself. It's quite funny, and its making me want to write a romance novel; the protagonist is (secretly) a write of escapist novels, and the "actual" story is intersperced with bits of the manuscript she's writing. It's interesting, anyway. Mum's been telling me for years that I ought to read some Margaret Atwood, and this is the first I've tried.

We watched a movie this evening, about drag queens. Can't remember the name off the top of my head. Robin Williams owns a drag queen show place, and is the partner of his lead, er, actress, an extremely flamboyant transvestite named Alred. Robin Williams himself does not dress in drag - although it wouldn't be the first time...remember Mrs Doubtfire? Anyway, his son wants to marry the daughter (played by Callista Flockhart - Alli MacBeal) of an influential US Republican Senator, and the two try to pass Robin Williams off as a "Cultural Attache to Greece" when her parents come for dinner. You can just imagine how well that turns out. 
Anyway, I'm babbling, and I should stop and get some sleep.
gnight, Kitty. :)


Friday, May 31, 2002

And another uneventful week passes by in the life of Caitlin...my world is a series of nondescript hours and days strung together by crises.
...It's hard to remember to take medication when you're already feeling better - o fcourse, as soon as you start forgetting, you immediately feel worse, and then you remember again. This has nothing to do with anything, and I'm not really sure why I brought it up...

I recently fell into the Solitaire game on our computer, and now I'm addicted. It's not ordinary Solitaire - it's called "Spider Solitaire," and is a very different game. It has varying levels of difficulty; at the moment I winn all the time on Moderate (2 suits) and never on Difficult (4 suits). (Actually, that's not true. The very first time I played it on four suits I won it, just by pure chance. However, it hasn't happened since.) But you don't care anyway, I know. No one is interested in other people's solitaire games.

We watched Cast Away this evening - with Tom Hanks. I think I could handle being marooned on a desert island, so long as there was someone else with me - alone I'd go crazy. I'd need someone else - someone who was interesting to talk to, that I didn't hate. And, I suppose, preferably male and around my own age. (I mean, come on, you've got to have something to do!) I think I wouldn't mind being on a desert island with Jon. Oric Eric. Cameron Adam, Cameron Kelso, maybe maybe Travis Earl, although I think that could get really annoying and we might eventually kill one another. But there are lots of guys with whom that scenario would be okay..

I've got the usual weekend tasks to perform tomorrow - cleaning and French. I didn't clean my room or do any French last weekend cause I was sick, so I'm behind on both fronts. Tomorrow evening we're having a water fight at Tyra's house. I hope it's warm and sunny! Hans Seidemann and (I think) a few other people (someone called Andrew?) are coming from Rupert. Tyra's been cultivating Hans - you know how she does that. He's a good candidate - he's a very interesting person, and definately not run-of-the-mill. Unfortunately, its really a bit late to cultivate him since he graduates this year.
And we graduate next year! Gawd. That's too terrifying to contemplate. Tonight is Prom, and in just 365 days... Ooh, it's too scary. I don't want to have to take responsibility for my life. Only a year...

Sigh. Please put in a good word with the weather gods and make tomorrow warm and sunny. Please!!
Gnight, Kitty. :)

May 2, 2002

Man, what is WITH me this year?!! My attention and attraction seems to be divided between two complete assholes: Jon Rife and Travis Earl. Jon you already know about. He's a prick, and I know it, but he's SO adorable! It's just unfortunate that he has absolutely no reciprocal interest in me. [[hits former self repeatedly. omg.]] Travis Earl is a different matter, and it isn't entirely my fault - I swear, he's been trying to seduce me. He does it to everyone. Thing is, I know that, and I know that it's a display of power rather than interest, and yet I'm still falling for it. But it bugs me - he's SUCH an egotistical bastard. Honestly I've never seen anyone with such a massively inflated ego...he's so full of himself. [[ok, this? this is true. :p]] Plus, as I've already stated obliquely, he thinks he's God's gift to women. The song "Oh Lord, It's Hard to be Humble" was written about him. And yet...there's many things about him I find intriguing. First of all, in my opinion he's right - he is hot. He's got the broody, sensual thing right down, plus he's built. Like, you can see his chest and arm muscles. And he's not so muscular that it's gross. Just enough that you notice. With his shirt off, he's really sexy.
The other thing I find compelling about him is his intellect. He's very bright (and, unfortunately, he knows it.) He sucks at math, but in English-type courses he's really good. But that's not the amazing part. The amazing part is - he tries. He actually does his work to the best of his abilities. He cares about grades. Even in courses he's bad at, like Math, he tries his best. That's such a refreshing change frommost of hte other guys. He also thinks about things, and generally has interesting and informed, if cynical, opinions. Despite this, however, he can be an infuriating person to discuss things with, since he always has to be right and tends to dismiss other people's opinions out of hand if they don't coincide with his.

So anyways, I dunno. He's sexy and smart and interesting, but he's just so so so full of himself I just want to slap him. And he eats apple cores. (An interesting, though useless, piece of trivia.) Compared to Travis, Jon is the soul of modesty and politeness. Why don't I pick nice people to have crushes on?! Grrr...
It's a NID tomorrow. Me, Jay, and the Camerons are having a rhythm sectional at 10 am, so I'd better get some sleep.
Goodnight, Kitty. :) Stupidly twitterpated smudges.

Friday, May 3, 2002
Fuck, I wish they'd just get it over with and start going out. Cayley and Kurt, I mean. She says she doesn't "like" him anymore, but...whatever. The only person she's fooling is herself. And maybe him - he's prety gullible. He also doesn't think he has a crush on her, but that's bullshit too.
Was with them and Eric at Cayley's dad's house watching "The Mummy Returns" this evening. It was a really stupid movie, as we expected. It was kind of nice having a small group, though, plus we had an even guy-girl ratio, so everyone got to cuddle. (*Aww*).

Tomorrow there is a definitely not small gathering happening at Brody's house (in Old Remo) in the evening. It's a drinking thing.
