We - meaning the girls; guy s are always invited to everything - are invited, too, for once. I'm considering going, but I don't want to drink. (I don't think I'm permitted, anyway - Jon and Wickie made a list of everyone who wanted alochol, and they all have to chip in twenty bucks. I didn't sign.) However, I might go and be a DD - it's fun to laugh at drunk people, especially if there are others not drinking with you. (That would be Cayley and Katy.) If I do go, I'm sure I'll have an interesting journal entry for you tomorrow!

Our Rhythm Sectional kicked ass. It was so fun just playing with those guys. Then Dillon Gordon came and sang Zoot Suit Riot. He's a strange child. 

Lowell's twelve. I can't believe. That's almost a teenager. I remember being twelve; I felt so grown-up - much more gronw-up than it seems like Lowel should be! And the seasons, they go round and round, and the painted ponies go up and down...
Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Saturday, May 4
So, more than half of the alcohol was stolen from Jon's house...by some of Chris's friends, because Jon cleverly told Josh Foot where they'd hidden it. Brad couldn't go, Cameron couldn't go, Kurt couldn't go, and Jon probably couldn't get a ride. Eric phoned me sevenish and suggested that we just rent some movies to watch at his old house instead, since it would probably be more fun. So we did - me, Eric, Cayley, Tyra, and Jessica McCooey. We watched Fright Night, which was really stupid but kind of funny, just like I remembered. I can't believe Nana let me watch it when I was ten though; there was lots of nudity and racy sex scenes. And I can't believe it didn't scare me! We also watched It again, so Eric could confront his childhood fear. He's not scared of it anymore. Still, I can see how the notion of Tim Curry as an evil clown who comes out of drains to kill children could be scary if you were six. Now, however, it's pretty stupid.

I like Eric. I really do. When he's being nice, he's really nice. And he's almost always nice to me. He's good to cuddle with during scary movies, too. People seem to expect us to go out, and think that there's really more going on between us, but there isn't. I can't see going out with Eric; I mean...he's Eric! I can see us being, um..."friends with benefits", however. I can certainly see winding up making out with him accidentally. But I don't think I could ever have a crush on him - he's not really my type. And vice-versa, I think, too. Nevertheless, he's a great friend.

Had a wierd experience this evening, as well, in a totally unrelated tangent. Between movies, I drove the girls down to Mohawk to get chocolate (cause they weren't hyper enough before of course.) When we pulled in, there was this other car full of teenage guys we didn't recognize. They were from Smithers, looking for parties. (Cause there are so many parties in Terrace!) They asked us if we knew where any parties were. We didn't, except the one in Old Remo, which we didn't tell them about. Then they asked if we wanted to do something with them. I honestly think Tyra and Jessica would have gone with them, except that we'd left Eric back at the house. So eventually they left. It was weird, though. I could feel them checking us out, and that is totally not something I'm used [to]. All the guy shere sort of take us forgranted. But I could see these guys looking at me. Maybe that should creep me out or make me angry or something, but actually I found it flattering. Maybe that's sad - I don't know, and frankly, I don't much care. It felt good to be seriously paid attention to, for once. 
Anyway. A fun night. Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Tuesday, May 14, 2002
Band trip! Yay! Actually I'm not that excited. It is fun, though. We're in Prince George right now, on the way to Calgary. We did two concerts today at elementary schools in Frasier Lake [and] Smithers, both of which (the concerts, I mean) sucked. Learning to play timpani for concert band is HARD. I've had to step in cause Will, the regular timpanist, didn't come on the trip. I think it would be fine if either a) I already knew how to play timpani, or b) I got to learn the songs from the beginning with everyone else. Not both, just either/or. but no. I'm sight-reading pieces that everyone else already knows on an instrument I've never played before. Timpani itself may be easy, but this is difficult.
I'm also worried about Jazz Band - recently, our Musicfest songs have all really sucked, and I don't know why. David thinks it's just apathy, which is entirely possible. I dunno.

This hotel is cool It's called Esther's Inn, and it's designed to be tropical. Reminds me of Uncle Billy's in Hawaii. It's got this really funky courtyard in the middle withpools and hot-tubs and waterslides. I spent way too much time in 20+ degree water.
People want to sleep, so I'll continue this tomorrow on the bus...
Gnight, Kitty. :)

Wednesday, May 15
This pen is invisible, but  oh well. It's after midnight - I meant to write earlier, on the bus, but then I didn't. Again, oh well. The constant refrain.
So yeah, last night in the pools was kind of cool. (This is what I meant to write about yesterday). The stupid part was the chicken fights in the large pool, which I participated in for about 30 secs. The fun part was sitting in the hot-tub with David laughing at the people who were chicken-fighting. What we were really doing was gossiping, but we called it an intellectual discussion. It sounds much more sophisticated to be discussing the "social behaviour of human animals during the mating season" then "who's gonna wind up with whom", which is what it actually was.
Really, I think it's terribly brave - and foolhardy - of music teachers to take teenagers on tour...especially in the spring I mean, all the guys and a fair number of the girls are horny all year round anyway - in the spring, among the pheremones, we are all lost causes. This becomes increasingly apparent when you place 50 of us in an enclosed space (read: bus) for 10 hours straight. Honestly, it's sad. They're taking their lives into their own hands, travelling with us.

--Wow. Just had a fire alarm. WE all piled downstairs and then back up again. Really stupid. The fire alarm here is really lame - it's not alarming at all. It's quiet, and sounds most akin to someone hitting a triangle at three-second intervals. If I'd been asleep, it probably wouldn't have woken me up - and Spiff meowing outside my window wakes me up! Anyway. The funny part was that practically none of the band people were even in their pyjamas. Clearly, no one was considering the possibility of going to bed.--

Today was extremely uneventful. We had a "Truth" thing tonight, we basically means telling who you like (or, in my case, telling who you can't quite bring yourself to like because they're assholes.) Cayley likes Kurt (duhh), Eric likes Hayley Sullivan (not a surprise), Tyra likes Torrence (I finally know who he is, and he IS cute!) and Lance, and Katie [[sorry, Katy]] likes David (who she doesn't want to like) and Chris Chapman, who she does want to like. I, obviously, don't like Jon Rife and Travis Earl. Cameron (Adam) thinks Jon and I should go out. He keeps bugging us about it. Mostly cause we're short and violent, I think. Oh well. It's not gonna happen - he doesn't like or have any interest in me.

It's true, the spring thing. every guy on this fucking trip is hot, or at least most of them.
Close quarters, cute guys, and raging hormones - don't you just love band trips? Gnight, Kitty. :)

Tuesday, April 16, 2002

Got first in my class! I think I played it about the best I ever have. I'm worried about Jamie, though...she didn't show up for her class this afternoon. Jamie never bails! Her grandfather had a heart attack about a week ago - I hope he isn't dead.
Lowell got first in his class, too...out of twelve kids! We're very proud of him. It was his Beach Buggy Boogie, which is a really neat piece.

On an (entirely) different note...
So, yesterday in the cafeteria at lunch time, I was hitting Jon (a common occurrence), because he stole my cookie. We're an extremely juvenile lot. Cam Adam was there and accused us of flirting. I suppose, in a way, we were, although I know its useless cause Jon has no interest. Oh well. He asked when we were gonna give it up and just go out.
Funny how five years changes the response to a silly question, asked in jest. In Grade 6, the reply would be along the lines of "Ew, sick, I hate him/her!" Now that we're "grown-up" Grade 11s, however, the question got fielded somewhat differently.
Jon glanced at me slyly. "Oh," he replied to Cameron, "I don't think we'll wind up going out. We'll just fuck each other." Wink.
Excuse me? Did I miss something? Where did that come from? This from Jon Rife, who has made it quite clear that, of all my attributes, the one he most definitely is not interested in is my body. [[!!!!!!!!]]
They spent the rest of the lunch period essentially talking about me, and about screwing me...right in front of me. I oscillated between insulted and, perversely and against my better judgement, flattered. It's silly, since I know that really, Jon has no interest in me. Cam, I think, would sleep with anything that would sleep with him. Not seriously, of course - I'm almost positive he's a virgin, and he's actually a really sweet guy, as guys go - but that's the image he portrays. He's interested in any and every girl - including me. He told Jon that I'd already offered to help him reproduce. Which is true - I did do that, in a joking way of course, one time when he was talkign about needing to, umm, "spread the seed of his genius."
Boys are such strange creatures. And why do I feel so flattered?

Darren's playing his Polly Wolly Doodle tomorrow, Lowell's doing "Jest" (Bartok), and I've got my Beethoven. Wish us luck!
Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Friday, April 19, 2002
Wow. My room is absolutely covered in clothing. If there was ever a week for rapid, repeated costume changes, Music Festival is it.
So it's over - almost. I did way better than I was expectin gto...I won the awards for all of my classes! And I played in Scholarships, which were tonight. And I'm playing (a solo) in Gala tomorrow! ...I have to brag about this here because I won't let myself do it anywhere else, cause I don't want people to think I'm bragging.
The only award I'm really proud of is the Beethoven. I had some stiff competition for that one - including Marlee Emery! The others (especially the Sibelius) were kind of by default. Also, being in Scholarships was nothing to be especially proud of - I'm really the only option in the Senior category. I am, I feel, justifiably proud to be playing in Gala. For me, that is an achievement.
The weirdest (and best) thing that happened this year was that I wasn't nervous. Even at Scholarships, with the bright lights and the dark house. It's the strangest feeling to walk onto the stage and simply not be nervous. I was nervous beforehand, but when it  came to the performances I was cool It was great! (Hope it happens tomorrow too!)

I've never, I don't htink, had a more stressful week than this. Maybe as stressful, but nothing surpassing this one. Thank goodness it's almost over!
Goodnight, Kitty. :) Wish me good good good luck tomorrow.

Saturday, April 20, 2002
Well, it was a nice ride, but I'm SO glad it's over! Nothing, bar nothing, is as stressful as Festival. Wait, that's not true. Provincials is more stressful. I didn't get recommended this year, and I'm glad. It would have been just one more thing...
I won $425 thought! That's cool. Three awards plus the Scholarship Consolation Prize (AKA Excellence Award). I think that's the most I've won in a year before. (Brag, brag, brag. Just tune me out. I have to say this stuff somewhere, and my conscience nags me less if I only inconvenience and bore a book.)
My performance tonight (the Romance by Sibelius) was not flawless, but it was pretty good. Everyone seemed to like it. It's such a crashy piece, you hardly notice wrong notes anyway.
There were some really cute performances - mostly Dance stuff. This one little girl...I forget her name at the moment...something oriental...did the most amazing Music Theatre piece. She won the junior Scholarhip this year, and she's this tiny 8-year-old from Prince Rupert. But her voice is huge! I don't know where she fits the lungs she must have in order to project like that. She did "Whistle a Happy Tune" from The King and I...at first I thought it must be miked, but no, those sounds were coming from the stage. Amazing! There was also a really cute dance by E-motion (the PR Dance company that Hans Seidemann is in) called Beetlemania.
Did I tell you I met Hans Seidemann's Source of Excellence last night? It's a small, well-loved stuffed cow called Moo-moo. (Imaginative name). It's his good luck charm. We've got one, too. Actually, we have a couple: Otto the otter and Mewgenspiegel (don't ask) the lion. Magic and superstition really do help, honest. But god, I'm so glad it's finally over!
Many relieved smudges, Kitty. :)

Friday, April 26, 2002
An uneventful week, on a personal scale. Getting back into the swing of things. Some bad things happening regionally, though - more Campbell cuts. Ninth Block courses for next year have all been cut - that means no Jazz Band, Choir, or Production. Also, because of new higher minimum class-size requirements, the entire Band program in Caledonia may disappear, and Mr Parr would lose his job. This is very bad. Everyone's terribly upset and talking about writing letters and all such. Yeah right, like a "strongly-worded letter" will do a fuck's bit of good. Jon wants to go camp on Gordon Campbell's lawn and sing campfire songs loudly and offkey to the accompaniment of a poorly-played guitar. 

Tyra's birthday tonight. Parts of it were fun. Being around Jon can be demoralizing, though. He's such a prick He was talking, as we left, about the party he's going to tomorrow, which will be better because there'll be booze and "cute girls". Well, thanks, Jon. Way to raise a person's self esteem. Even if it's true - and I'm sure it is - that he finds none of us attractive, he has no need to say it so obviously or often. However, to give him credit, he was mostly really nice tonight - for him. He let me lean on him and that sort of thing. Almost like he was interested... but he isn't. *Sigh* Oh well.

Foolishly smitten smudges (ooh, alliteration!) Gnight, Kitty. :)

(April 1st 2002)

[Backwards, continued from previous entry] Actually, it's April 1st. April Fools! I didn't realize that until I looked at the calendar this evening. (It was afternoon when I wrote the last bit; now it's quarter to eleven.) Thought I should distinguish between the entries somehow, so now I'm writing backwards. (Actually, that's just an excuse - I love doing this.)

The queen mum (of Britain, naturally) died this weekend. Everyone's upset, and I know it's mean, but I can't bring myself to feel more than a nominal sadness. She didn't mean much to me personally, even as a figurehead. And she was more than one hundred years old, for Pete's sake! (Btw, why is it Pete's sake? Who's Pete? I've always wondered. I suppose it's just another way of catching yourself when you were about to take the Lord's name in vain, or whatever. Like "for goodness' sake," or "Geez", or whatever. But why Pete, of all things? Oh well, I don't suppose it really matters much.) 
Finished the fifth and final book in the Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy today, "Mostly Harmless." For a silly book, it ended pretty tragically. Everyone dies. (Not that you hadn't been expecting every minute for them to die for the last 1000 pages anyway, but still.) I didn't like it. I think he should have written at least one more before he died - now it's too late. Maybe he just finally got tired of it and decided to get it over with and kill them off. Or maybe he always intended to write a sixth one, and hadn't counted on the whole dying thing to happen first. Who knows? 

I'm afraid I'm in danger of having an honest-to-goodness crush on Jon, despite the fact that he's an arrogant self-centered prick. It's that time of year, and he seems the only likely candidate at the moment. Oh well. All my previous crushes have been hopeless, so I guess this one might as well be too. Crushes are always fun, even when they're pathetic. And at least I know Jon! Then again, maybe it won't happen at all. It's early days yet - I guess we'll see!
Goodnight, Kitty. :)

April 2, 2002
Had a nice dream last night. It was about guys liking me. Two good dreams in two days - I'm on a roll. The one guy, oddly enough reminded me a lot of Will Shack - he's in the band at school. It wasn't Will, but he looked kinda like him and acted and sounded kinda like him. That's okay - I like Will. He reminds me of a teddy bear. A really big teddy bear. He's nice.

I really wish Jon wasn't such an insensitive asshole - it would be a lot easier to cultivate a crush on him then. And it bugs me even more because I see the potential for a really nice guy buried under all that self-centeredness and teenage belligerence and insecurity. Oh well. I'm trying.
I really have nothing of import to say. (As if I ever do.) I'm just rambling...wish me luck on my Bio test tomorrow!
Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Friday, April 5, 2002
[Backwards] I wish there was a way you could know beforehand if an evening was going to be fun or lame. This evening was pretty lame. Guys were playing D&D (I always have trouble with the "&"s), so there were like no guys there. Aaron was, but he's never held any interest for me. Besides which, he's going out with Manda. Go figure. I think it's a good thing for her to have someone she can focus her attentions on. She's so touchy! Things seem to be happening so fast. I think Cayley and Kurt will be going out before too long. She thinks not, and says she no longer has a crush on him, but I don't know. I think it's a definite possibility. And they'd make such a good couple. ...Whatever a "couple" is. Funny how I have no problem seeing other people in relationships, but when it comes to myself I'm completely at a loss as to how that would work... Sigh.
Not sure how much I approve of Aaron, though. He makes me annoyed and uncomfortable - I get "bad vibes" from him, as it were. With all of our other guys, I can put up with them being insensitive immature assholes because under the surface I see really nice, caring guys, and I think once they're done being teenagers they'll be really sweet. They certainly have that potential. Aaron, on the other hand, seems very nice superficially, but below that are...shady undercurrents of racism, sexism, and general right-wing biased gun-toting assholeness. I don't like it. But who am I to intrude. Whatever floats your boat...

Finally met this Eric guy Jessica Coe is always talking about. He seem snice enough, but looks way older than eighteen! And he's got facial hair. Ick. I hate facial hair, especially on teenage guys. It just looks so silly and pretentious on adolescents.
...Fuck, I swear one of these days I'm just gonna jump on Jon. I want him so bad! It's ridiculous. He's so sexy...but I'm like the only person who thinks so. Even when he's arrogant and condescending (which is always) I still have to restrain myself from accosting him physically. Isn't that sad? 
I don't know where that came from. Just ignore it; I'm hormonal. (Yeah, no shit!)

People (meaning mostly Cayley and Jessica) have been involved in this online "LiveJournal". I thought it was sort of a stupid idea - I mean, I've got this journal, on paper; why would I want to write on the Internet? But the thing is, it's open to others to view. So, I'm thinking of doing it, just as a way of communicating thoughts to people which are too difficult to express verbally. I could certainly never write half the stuff I write in here into a public, online journal [[Ok, now...is this ironic? ...Or is this ironic?]], there are some things you want your friends to know, without outright telling them. Kind of a neat idea...
Smudges. :)

Monday, April 15, 2002
I asked my grandpa for fifty dollars one time. "Forty dollars?!" he said, "What do you need thirty dollars for? Here's twenty," and he handed me ten.
A good child would have written ages - weeks, anyway - ago. That tells you what sort of child I am; or at least, what sort of child I'm not. They do say that knowing what you aren't is as important as knowing what you are. What I am is stressed. Music Festival started last week, but piano's second week this year, so my first solo - an Impressionist Prelude by Delius - is tmorrow. I'm nervous because it's the sort of song that can very easily go terribly awry. It's incredibly short, with the result that if you start off on the wrong foot, you've no time to get back to the right one before the piece is over. When it's great it's great, though. So we'll see. I've no chance (or very very very little) of winning that award (I'm against Jamie), and scarcely any of winning for my Beethoven, which is Wednesday (there're tons of kids up for that prize.) However, I do have a chance at winning the award for Romantics Other Than German, which is my Romance, by Sibelius. I do hope I win at least that one award, but if I don't, well...oh well. The adjudicator seems nice. Very positive, but with a solid technical and interpretive background as well. Nana and Papa are here until Sunday (right after the Gala), and then Grandma and Grandpa are coming on Monday for a week. By the time they're gone I'll be more than happy to be done with grandparents for a while!
Wish me luck. :) Gnight, Kitty. :)

[[Holy shit, viewers! Come see the crazy girl wildly misintrpret everything going on in her life...how the hell was I so socially-romantically brain-dead?]]

Thursday, March 28/02

I'd write backwards, except...a) that would probably confuse you, and b) it's 2:30 am and I want to write quickly. Despite reason a), however, I'll likely try that tomorrow - it's really quite liberating. I started experimenting with it earlier this week, and it just makes so much sense! Left-handed people should all write backwards, it would solve so many of our problems. Everyone could just carry around mirrors if they couldn't read the backwards writing. Really, it's a good solution. Anyway.

We watched two movies tonight, Good Will Hunting and Blow. The first was funny, if bittersweet, and ended well; the second was long and depressing and ended poorly. They were both good movies, but we should have watched them in the reverse order...it would have left me with a greater peace of mind.

It's definitely approaching springtime.Even if it doesn't look like spring outside, spending an hour - or less! - inside a high school will tell you the season. Everyone's hormones are currently in over-drive - they really want to get laid. They're - we're - twitterpated, as it were. People would probably look askance if I said that I want to fuck virtually every teenage guy I lay eyes on, but in a sense it's true. As far as my body's concerned, there's no time like the present for getting rid of that useless virginity. Actually, I even made what I consider a sort of a breakthrough today in choir - I was attracted to Chris Hartman! I never have been before - I mean, he's a  nice guy and everything, but I'd never considered him particularly physically attractive. I tend to like delicate or "cut" guys, and Chris is fairly solid. But today, I could have touched him all over. Cameron Kelso, too. And Jon Rife, but that's nothing new.

Fuck, it must be spring!
Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Friday, March 29, 2002
[BACKWARDS] Spreaking of spring, it snowed like all day today. It was ridiculous! It is Easter weekend - how can we hunt for eggs in the snow? Stupid weather. It is, technically, spring now, and I think it's time this year started acting it's age. No more of this juvenile snow-in-April (or, well, practically April) stuff. I know that in some parts of the world that would be normal, but this isn't one of them.

So how are you handling the backwards writing? Maybe for posterity's sake I should write forwards, but this is so much fun! Do me a favour and keep struggling through it for a few more minutes. I know it's messy, but I am fairly new to the concept. Twelve years of ingrained habits are hard to break free of, and I still occasionally put letters in the wrong way round. I also have a tendancy to write some words (especially "to") frontwards.
Unfortunately, it's a lot easier to get used to writing this way than it is to get used to reading someone's writing that's written this way. Also, when I write this way in a book, the pages are backwards. If you're using this system then pages, as well as letters and words, should read right to left. Plus margins are on the wrong side of the page. 

Gawd, I wish I had a crush. It's crush season, despite what the weather says. I wish Jon weren't such a prick - if he was a nice guy as well as sexy and funny and smart, he'd be perfect crush material. One of these days, when he's finished being a teenager and an asshole, he'll be a real charmer. Cayley disagrees, but that's just cause she's too tall. And he's such a good dancer. *Sigh*. Again, shame about the Insensitive Asshole attitude.
I wish any number of things. I wish Travis wasn't Travis. I wish he was less sulky, less volatile, and had at least some interests that bore a vague resemblance to one or two of mine. I also wish he was shorter and...meatier...but that's really neither here nor there. Basically, I just wish we were more compatible - it sucks that the only confirmed person to ever have a crush on me is completely not the sort of person I would choose to go out with. Ironic, I suppose. Or maybe I'm just too picky.

On a completely different note, we made pysanky (Ukranian Easter Eggs) today. We suck at it and the best eggs always break, but it's really fun!! Mum and Lowell and I each did four - Lowell's sort of a minimalist when it comes to art...his eggs consist mainly of a few dots and lots of dye. Mum's and mine are a bit more creative, but both of our favourite eggs broke. So sad! :(
Found Lemmings on the upstairs computer! I love that game...but it's addictive. I just hope I don't have little lemmings marching around in my head all night. The disclaimer onthe box is valid: it reads
"Not responsible for - Loss of hair; Loss of mind; Loss of sleep."
Goodnight, Kitty! Many backwards (aka left-handed) smudges. :)

Monday, March 31, 2002
Being a teenager is difficult shit. No, really. I mean, you're already going through all these physical changes and hormonal wierdnesses, and instead of backing off and giving you some time and space to figure things out, they hand you a list of rules and heap piles of Things to Learn, Things to Do, and Rights & Responsibilities on you, and tell you to go for it.
Well, thanks.
Sigh. It's that time of year. It's that time of month, it's that time of week, it's that time of day. I'm that sort of person, I'm that sort of age. And I'm probably making no sense to anyone, especially me. Everyone thinks I'm so fucking mature, responsible, and smart. I'm not any of those things - I'm just better than others at hiding my confusion.

Gemmells plus John minus Paul and the twins were here for Easter. That was fun, as usual. We wrote our own clues for each other. Yesterday evening Martina and I went out with people and threw snow at each other at the college. Yes, snow. At Easter. It snowed all day Saturday, and it would have been lovely were it December or January. But it's fucking March! Almost April. Ridiculous. At least it was packing snow - we built a snow snail and a sort of mutant bunny with wings and an antler. It was fun.
There was weirdness at one point. I forget what led up to it, but Jon (Rife) asked me "What do you want from me?" I replied flippantly, as always, "Oh, you know what I want, Jon!" (sexual implication, of course.) But his response confused me - he said, "No, I don't. Come on...you've been jerking me around for a year - what do you want?"
Was he serious? I couldn't tell. I didn't know what to say. Really of course, I do "want" him. I think he's beautiful and sexy, if a prick. That's why I'm always flippant - if I wasn't, I might have to say something real. Anyway, the moment passed, and it was alright again. But I can't help wondering what he meant...I know the exchange sounds illy on paper, but it was weird and not like Jon. I guess you had to be there.

I had a dream about him last night. Well, not about him, per se, but he was in it. It was one of those rare sex-y dreams that I prize so highly. We were married, and Katy Kennedy was our kid, only we weren't and she wasn't really, but for some reason we had to pretend. The upside was that I got to sleep with Jon. My dream didn't involve sex - they rarely do, and it's just as well since the actual act never feel slike anything, but it was very sexy. I love those kind of dreams, and they'e far too rare.

I'm feeling bad about Travis. Fuck, that's nothing new - I always feel bad about Travis. Guilt about that whole situation is just sort of a constant thing for me. But more so, lately, and I'm not sure what to do about it.
See, Eric and I have been really touchy and cuddly lately, which is fun; I love it. Eric's nice because he can be touchy without it meaning anything. Neither of us is really interested in the other one and we both know it, so it can just be fun and meaningless. It's not like we're making out or anything - just being silly. Eric's a very easy person to do that with cause he's so comfortable with it, and he reciprocates. I'd do the same with any of our guys - it's just that Eric's the only one who seems remotely interested, and I hate forcing my affections on unwilling participants - it's no fun.
However, I think Travis is upset by it. He's seemed sulky lately, and I wondered briefly if that was why, but dismissed the idea. However, last night Cayley told me that is the reason he's been moody. I have a hard time grasping that. Hell, I have a hard [time] believing that he likes me in the first place, despite the fact he asked me out. And the notion that someone would be upset about me and Eric is ridiculous. Cayley asked if there was anything "going on between us", and I had a hard time not laughing. I mean, come on. It's Eric!
But what makes me mad is that it's making me feel guilty. I have no reason for guilt! It's not even like I'm excluding Travis - I'd be perfectly willing to be much more physical with him than I am. Heck, I've tried it, but he's just so stand-off-ish. I don't know if he thinks he's being noble or what, ubt it's fucking annoying! It's like he doesn't want to touch me himself, but he doesn't want anyone else touching me either. Fuck, I am NOT his property. And yet still I feel inexplicably guilty. Shit. I hate my conscience.

I guess the right thing to do would be to talk to him and sort things out (again), but I'm just so bad at the initiating conversations - particularly ones that mean something. Gawd. I don't know what to do. I hate being a teenager. 
Goodnight, Kitty. Thank you for listening and sorry for swearing so much.

Saturday, March 9, 2002
It's been a long time - like 2 weeks - since I've written, but things haven't changed much. I still haven't told Travis anything, and I feel so guilty about that! I'm such a coward. And I'm still confused. I've been given lots of (conflicting) pieces of advice, but they don't seem to help. Cayley and Jessica say that if I have any doubts whatsoever then I shouldn't say yes, for fear of being hurt, whereas my mum says that if I have even the slightest interest in him, I should at least try it, just to see what it's like. Serious philosophic conflicts here, as you can see. Theoretically ,I'm more inclined towards my mum's approach - you never know if you never try. If I followed Cayley's advice I'd never do anything - I always have doubts about everything. But in practice it's harder. I need to talk to him, I know that, but I'm too cowardly to initiate that, and besides, I still don't know what I'm going to say. But I know I have to say something. Even a straight out No is kinder than this prolonged uncertainly: I don't want to repeat Eric's mistake with Manda.

Speaking of Manda, I think she and Aaron might wind up together. We're all looking forward to this prospect. It's good for Manda, who needs someone to pay attention to her; it's good for Cayley cause it gets Aaron off her hands (he has a crush on her); and it's good for all the rest of us cause we won't have to put up with Manda's clingyness as much. Anyway, here's hoping.

Last weekend, I'm not sure why I didn't write. On Friday we were in Kitimat (small group - Tyra, Jessica, me, Manda, Aaron - more were invited but couldn't/wouldn't come) and slept over at Tyra's grandparents' house in Cable Car. They have the coolest house ever! It reminded me so much of the cottage, cause it's heated by wood - and has a kitchen range just exactly like the one at the cottage. It made me nostalgic. The house was a bizarre mix of old and new - they had a huge TV and sound system beside a player piano (incredibly out of tune) and a genuine Victrola record player! Very cool. And the staircase was wooden and spirally and awesome. The whole place just screamed to be the set of a "Stuck in the Cabin in a Snow Storm" movie...we wished we had a video camera. Tyra's aunt also had a cool hot tub. (Oxymoron, I know...) I love hot tubs!
Then this Friday we were at Cayley's, and the girls slept over. It was fun...I was ovulating and Eric was very sexual. We (the whole group) are getting worse and worse, I swear! I think Mum's right - it is only a matter of time before we escalate to making out and sleeping with each other. We watched The Shining after the boys left, and I wished they were still there. Scary movies are much better when you have someone to cuddle...someone of the opposite sex! It was a really cool, creepy movie. Jack Nicholson is very good at playing a crazy man - he's so scar!
Tonight we watched Transformers: The Movie at Eric's old house. Don't ask me why. That is quite possibly THE stupidest movie I have seen...ever. Cayley and I laughed all the way through. Eric and Kurt kept shushing us... "Shut up! it's good! You guys just don't know what you're talking about!"

Other weirdness. Jay asked me out on Tuesday. I'm (almost) positive he was joking - and I really hope he was, cause otherwise I was really mean. But he must have been joking. Right? Otherwise would be too weird.
Bottle drive tomorrow...what joy...
Coldest weather we've had all winter, and it's March!. Fuck.
Goodnight Kitty. :) (I don't mean that, I'm just goofin' around, that's all!) :)

Friday, March 15?, 2002
Spring has sprung...or well, no, it hasn't. It should have. It's Spring Break!
I know I've said this before, but it seems like every year just goes faster and faster. Spring Break means it's almost Festival...Festival means it's almost the band trip, which means it's almost the end of school. Then I'm in Grade 12, and then I'm graduating, and...Gawd, don't even go there. It's so terrifying. I don't want to have to take responsibility for my own life! I'm still a child...yet it looms nearer and nearer.

At the same time, I'm glad it's March Break. A week off will be nice - although it still feels like it was just Christmas!
Saw Lennie Gallant tonight. Was a bit worried that it would be soulful and whiny and lame, but it wasn't. Actually, it was quite good. Jay's family knows him - actually, the band has been staying at Jay's house - and he got to go up and play with them during the encore! It was neat. We were sitting right in front of Jay, which meant we also had the misfortune of sitting right in front of Cody, Jay's mentally handicapped younger brother. He doesn't understand the meaning of "quiet".

You know (changing topics entirely), it's been a year since I started hanging out with this group of people. It was the beginning of March last year when we started playing D&D...and it was about a month later that that fell apart. But it was funwhile it lasted. And it's fun in a different (kinkier) way now. Actually, I was thinking about this, we do really weird stuff, considering some of our hangups. We suck each others toes, take off our shirts and massage each other, and play all sorts of other silly flirty games. Cayley and Jessica gave Kurt a hard-on. I've wrestled extensively with Eric and lain full-length along his back (actually very comfortable), and he's touched al of our asses and most of our breasts (not mine.) My borders of comfort are way way looser than they were a year ago - as Eric said, they really have corrupted me - it's just been so subtle, no one - including me - noticed. And yet...there are some fairly commonplace things which we've never done and in fact have sort of a taboo against. Kissing is the big one. None of us except Tyra has kissed anyone else in the group. Tyra's kissed (french-kissed, no less) Eric and Jon, but no one else have even normal kissed. It's odd. Why do we have hangups about that when we're willing to take off articles of clothing and stick various appendages in people's mouths? We're an odd bunch...

Anyway. It's Spring Break! Yay! Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Tuesday, March whatever, 2002
I've had ample time to write in the past few days, but haven't been in the right mood. Still, I think this needs updating.
I never told you what happened with the Travis situation, did I? Well, we went out for coffee at Groundworks on Monday (last Monday) to talk. It was awkward cause I didn't know what to say and he didn't know what to say, and I still hadn't made a decision. I said it baffled me that he - or anyone - would find me attractive. He said I "sell myself too short." Whatever that means. It was cute, anyway. Our conversation was mainly umms and ahs, and eventually it amounted to the fact that I didn't feel comfortable making a huge leap into a relationhip. I said I was afraid I'd hurt him, which is true. He's sensitive and more moody than a woman with PMS. When he's nice he's really sweet, but when he's sulky he'd be a bitch to have as a boyfriend (I didn't say that part.) So there's that. I said I was happy to take it one step at a time and see where it went naturally. For cowardly me, that's much more comfortable.

Tonight when I was driving Cayley and Tyra and Travis home from Jessica's house (an uneventful and fairly boring evening), he observed that we could "climb to the moon on a rope." (!!) It was totally unexpected and a cool comment. I don't know where it came from, but I'd like to see more of the whimsical Travis. It was a cool moon - like the one in the Dreamworks logo.
Not really a lot to say. Going skiing tomorrow (downhill). Got stay-in contacts - it's so weird waking up with vision!
Sigh. The week will be gone before I know it - I just know it! (Did that make sense? No.) Gnight, Kitty. :)
 
Feather pluckin
Boll Weevil
Dune Buggy
Naked and Famous

Friday, Feb 22, 2002


So here's the background you need: last Saturday (I didn't write, because it was almost 2 by the time I got to bed), I had people over here. Minus a few, as usual...Travis, 'cause he was still grounded, and Jon, who was at a Ventures (Scouts) camp. Eric Cook was there (cause he asked directly if he was invited, and I suck at saying no), as was Aaron, who seems to have become part of our group. I'm not totally comfortable with him yet, cause I really don't know anything about him. But in time...

Anyway. Fun in a boring way, as usual. Except for Eric. There were, I suppose, two incidents. The first was when Eric took his shirt off (subtly - he's always been inexplicably embarassed of his chest) and put on Jessica's snake leather jacket. I ...hid... his shirt in the closet, so he couldn't put it back on, but he saw me.
And the war began. Play-fighting is really fun, especially when you're pretty evenly matched...which we are. Eric's taller than me, but we weigh about the same, and I'm stronger than him. It was invigorating. At one point, I wound up riding him (in the non-sexual sense - you know how teenage minds work!) like a horse or something. Then I fell, and he sort of fell on top of me, and in the process my arm got dragged sharply against the floor. I was left with a battle wound - a rug burn. It must have been fairly severe, cause I still have it, and the inner part's still just barely closed. (He finally got his shirt back, btw. I gave up.)
So then, later, we were on the bed - well, a lot of people were - and Eric, Tyra, and Jessica were playing How Far Can You Stick Your Tongue Down Someone's Throat. ...No, I'm serious. They were essentially french-kissing...without the kissing. It was weird, and unprecedented within our group. Somehow it didn't surprise me that Eric and Tyra would initiate it, however.
Anyway, eventually Eric realized what he'd been doing, and he became embarassed. He started hiding his face with his hands, and I tried to stop him. This escalated into a second war, except this one, oddly enough, involved tongues. Not tongues together, but tongues - and mouths - on various other body parts - mainly appendages. It culminated in Eric sucking my toes, and eventually, to the amazement of all present, sticking practically my whole foot in his mouth. Eric's very slobbery, and it was a strange and wet - although not necessarily unenjoyable - experience.

So there's that.
Tonight we were at Lindsay's. Travis was there, which was a surprise since technically, he's still grounded. (A dance is considered a "school event", which was why he was allowed to go last night. Today, he tricked his parents with an unbeatable wager and was allowed to come.) That was nice. I like having Travis there. I wound up leaning on him, similar to how Jon and I were at the Murder Mystery thing, except with the roles reversed. (ie I was lying on him.) Later I cuddled (for lack of a better word) in a similar manner with Eric. And somehow or other, my feet wound up in his mouth again. Most odd. When we were playing Truth or Dare, I had, at one point, one foot in Eric's mouth and the other in Travis's. It was weird. And disturbingly kinky, in retrospect. But fun, at the same time. I must say, too, that I was not always on the receiving end of the sucking. I also, at various points, had both Eric and Travis's fingers in my mouth. (But not feet. That's going too far, as far as I'm concerned.)

I wished Jon was there. He's always good for a bit of friendly violence now and then. I think he didn't come cause "Lindsay's a bitch." Even if that were true, though, I don't see why it matters. I mean, it's just a venue, for Heaven's sake. What you do, and who you talk to while you're there, is your own business!
G'night Kitty. :)


Saturday, Feb 23, 2002

Forgot to mention that Wednesday was a special day, historically. The date was Feb 20, and the year was 2002, so at 8:02 pm, for 60 seconds, the time was 20:02, 20/02, 2002. A triple palindrome! Very cool. And the last one was over 1000 years ago, in one thousand one. Bet you no-one noticed!

Interesting evening. Had a small group of people over - five in total, but that's small compared to normal. It was short notice, so lots of people weren't available. Eric was "doing something" (read: drinking) with Cam Adam and some people, Travis is (forever) ground, Aaron had plans, and Manda was busy being drepressed.  I know it's selfish, but honestly I'm just as glad she didn't come - she would have pulled it down, and we would have spent the entire evening trying (ineffectually) to cheer her up - we spend quite a bit of time doing that with Jessica as it is. *

So. Tonight it was me, Tyra, Cayley, Jessica, Kurt, and Jon. Jon wasn't going to come, but the rave he was going to go to was cancelled. 
This configuration meant, it turns out, two girls to a guy. Jessica and Cayley took Kurt, so Tyra and I had Jon. Well, not exactly had...but the attempt was invigorating. It was actually nice having fewer people for a change. Sort of intimate. I cuddled some with Jon, Tyra cuddled some with Jon, and Cayley and Jessica really cuddled with Kurt. In fact, they gave him a hard-on. Poor dear. Cayley didn't notice, and no on epointed it out until he'd gone. It was sort of amazing, actually!

I don't think we succeeded in doing the same with Jon. We tried- well, Tyra tried. I just cuddled. After Cayley and Kurt left, Jon was all alone with the three of us. He didn't need to fear from me, of course; I'm fairly reserved. Don't get me wrong, if Jon started kissing me I'd kiss him back and make out with him with very little hesitation. I'm very attracted to him. However, I don't believe in pushing people's limits or putting them in situations where they be comfortable. Essentially, no unwanted touching.
Tyra and Jessica have no such restraints.They totally molested him. I couldn't tell whether he was secretly enjoying it or whether he was honestly uncomfortable. He said he found it awkward, and although subjectively that doesn't make sense to me - I mean, it's just us and he knows nothing's really goingg to happen - still, objectively, I can understand his viewpoint. I would feel awkward if, say, Eric, Jon, and Travis were all over me at once, too. But mostly, I'd be confused.

Mum asked me today if there was any inclination within our group towards pairing up. I said no, and that's true. However, it's only true because our guys aren't remotely interested in us, that way. If they were half as interested in us as we are in them, I guarantee we'd be paired off in an instant.
Still, they insist on desiring unattainable girls...
Sigh. Gnight Kitty. :)


Monday, Feb 25, 2002

I feel like crying. Or something. I thought maybe we'd managed to avoid this bridge. I thought maybe it was just spring run-off, and that, with a little time and patience, we'd be able to walk across the dry creekbed and blissfully forget that the dreaded metaphorical bridge was ever there to begin with. Apparently not.

I suppose its at least partly my fault (actually, if you look at it one way, it's entirely my fault). I mean, I did encourage him, in that perverse, suicidal way of mine. Why did I do that? I don't know...although really, I suppose I do. I mean, I like flirting. I like cuddling. I like attention. Don't most people? So I guess I have only myself to blame for the dilemma facing me now.

Do I need to spell it out for you, or can you (like most people) guess what's happened? Travis asked me out at lunchtime today.
Cayley thinks I should be flattered and, well, yeah, I am. But still, I really wish he hadn't forced the issue. I'd kind of hoped that he was over me by now, but I guess not. Why can't he be like me and just let crushes run their course without taking action?
So what do I say to that, exactly? I asked him to give me a while to think (which I've been doign madly ever since), and i suppose I'll have to write him a letter... I think better on paper - there's less uming and ahind and searching for the right words. But I can't put him off for ever - ignoring it won't make it go away.

It's not that it''s Travis, exactly I mean, I don't like him, you know, "that way", but I like him as a person when he's being himself instead of an asshole. I like having him as a friend, and he's sometimes a nice person to talk to. And he's not bad-looking...as a matter of fact, he can look quite sexy - like a model. Sort of broody and sensual. It's not really the kind of looks I tend to go for; pretty to look at, but in terms of cuddleability (a word is born!), he's too skinny. People should have meat on their bones. Plus he's way too tall for me; it's almost comical. All the same, he's generally a fairly caring and sensitive person, and so I don't think it's him that's making me hesitate - I think I'd react the same way to practically anyone.
It's the concept that I have a hard time dealing with. Like, what does "going out" entail, exactly? How would that change the relationship we have now? I asked Travis that, and he didn't seem to understand it any better than I do. He wasn't really sure what he was asking. I need the ground rules figured out before I agree to play the game.

I wish he'd asked something specific. If he asked me to go somewhere with him or do something with him, I'd say yes. And then we could take it from there. I'm definitely in favour of small steps - 0 to 160 in 0.6 seconds is not my idea of a good time.
It's something I've never really thought about honestly before - I guess I always figured that whoever Iwound up going out with would have previous experience on which to base a relationship, and anyway, it was never a thing that it wsa necessary to worry about, so to speak. It was never imminent.

Bother. I never considered the repercussions. We bitch a lot about never having been in a relationship, but now that its been brought to a head, it turns out that there are things I really like about being single. I love flirting with the guy sin our group - all of them, not just Travis. Fuck it, I like Eric sucking on my toes, even if it grosses everyone else out. I like slow dancing with Jon, and playing with his fingers. If I am someone's girlfriend, does that mean that my body essentially "belongs" to him? I guess that's the idea behind fidelity, isn't it? Of course I think people should be faithful...I'd just never really thought about it in terms of real life before. I suppose if you like - I mean, "like" - the person that it's a moot point anyway, cause they're the only one you want to touch. But...

I'm so confused. I really really wish he hadn't asked me - cowardly though it may be, I hate confronting problems. I guess I could sum up my bafflement in one word: Why? Why did he have to pick then and there to ask me out? A crowded cafeteria is a stupid place to carry on an important conversation. Why should we go out? What earthly purpose would it serve? How will it change anything? And the big one, which I really can't comprehend, is Why does he like me? Guys don't like me! They just don't. What's the attraction? I'm not pretty, and I've got virtually nothing in common with him. I don't get it.

I don't get a lot of things.

Funny how everyone seems to know. Stupid grapevines. All the group people saw us talking together and sort of figured it out - they'd been expecting it, I guess. Actually, everyone kind of figured it out. Seems the fact that Travis likes me is pretty much common knowledge. I'm thankful that I knew he liked me beforehand. That would have been too much of a shock, coming all at once! At least I got it in a couple of rounds, with some months in between to get used to the first before the second was dumped on me.

God. I don't want to deal with this issue. I really don't. Why can't he just take it back? Why can't it just be how it was?
Pretty fucking confused smudges.


Tuesday, Feb 26, 2002

"So, are you going out with Travis, yet?" asked Hali this afternoon in choir. Three things came into my head. The first was "No," which I told her. The second was "Yet?", which I didn't say. The third thing was yet more amazement at the gossip ability of teenagers. How is it that everyone and their dog seems to know about this? People who I didn't even think knew Travs know about it. And all this publicity just makes it worse.

So what the fuck should I do? I wrote him a letter last night and gave it to him today: it says essentially that we need to talk, but not at school or on the phone (I hate phones). That means, of course, that this whole thing needs to be put off until he's done being grounded (whenever that is.) However, with everyone knowing he asked me out and wanting to know what's happening next, I doubt that that will happen. ...I hate being an object of gossip - I never have been before, and the idea that people talk about me when I'm not around makes me nervous.

School's been awkward and surreal. Classes are fine, although I'm having difficulty concentrating on homework. But Break and Lunch are pretty strained. I sort of lived in a little box, studioiusly ignoring the table where Travis (and lots of people) were sitting. I know its silly to avoid each other, but I can't help it. Everything's changed, and it's just so awkward. 
That's the main reason that I wish he'd never asked me. I mean, I like the relationship we have now. I like being friends, and being able to talk, and being able to cuddle without it meaning anything. But now everything's weird, and I'm afraid that our friendship is going to change no matter what. If I don't go out with him, can we still be the way we used to be? I'm not sure if we can go back...

...You'd think I'd have told my mother about all of this. Most people seem to tell their mothers stuff. I don't know why I find that so difficult. I know advice, either peer or parental, would do me good. But I just can't talk about stuff...I've never been good at that. That's what this book is for - expressing and getting rid of all the stuff that I can't voice out loud to anyone. Even here, I'm a bit inhibited about some things, but I'm way more candid and honest in this journal than anywhere else.

And I still don't know what to do. I think my system's in shock. I've had difficulty concentrating and had a great urge to sleep for the last couple days. Yesterday I cam home, lay down, and went to sleep, unintentionally. I only meant to think for a while. I almost did the same thing today, accidentally. I never sleep in the afternoon. I'm never this tired. I should be studying for a Biology test I have tomorrow, but instead here I am, talking in circles to an inanimate object. I couldn't concentrate.
I'm so confused that's what it boils down to. What should I do? I don't even know what I want! Stometimes I'm not worried about it at all, and figure it'll all work itself out. Other tmes, I'm really stressed and feel like crying. Sometimes I want to say yes, and sometimes I want to run away screaming. Mostly, I just want it to never have happened. Unfortunately, that's the one option I don't have.

Friday, Feb 1, 2002


...and we did that questionnaire thing, and I don't know whether I should be flattered or not, but should doesn't matter, cause I am. It turned out a lot better than I thought it would; I mean, it worked. Although, since there were only three guys, it wasn't hard to figure out which one belonged to whom. It was supposed to be anonymous, but, well, everything's more fun if you know.

The first question was teh One Night Stand thing - essentially, if you could have a one night stand with anyone with no weird consequences or hard feelings, who would it be? No on epicked me. If Travis had been here, he...probably...would, but he wasn't. Eric and Jon both picked Manda, and Lance picked Cayley. The Manda thing kind of surprises me, but I guess that's mostly because she wouldn't be my pick if I were a guy. I'd pick Cayley. But I guess I can see where it comes from - she's very fit, and muscular, and she's got big breasts.

The second question was a continuation of the first, and said simply, "Barring that, who's your next choice?" And Eric and Jon both picked me.
Which really surprised me when I thought about it. Especially for Eric - I would have put him down for Cayley, no question, as a secondary option. But they picked me. And they both picked me for being the best person to be stuck on a desert island with forever, which means they think I'm more interesting than Manda, at least.

Maybe it's pathetic to be pleased at being the second pick - especially since I know neither of them are really interested in any of us at all, but I still feel flattered. Actually, Eric and Jon picked a lot of the same answers. It's kind of funny. And lots of people thought I'm the nicest girl in the group. And apparently Jon and I would have "adorable offspring". And the adjective most commonly used to describe me is "cute". So all in all it was a fairly positive experience. Did you know Jon masturbates daily and Eric once or twice a week? Hmm...

But I wish Kurt and Travis had done - we'll have to get them to do it at school Monday. I want Travis's just for the morale boost (although he might surprise me, and then I'd be unhappy), but I'm really interested in Kurt's. He's so enigmatic, I have no idea what he's thinking. I would bet he picks Cayley first and Manda second and puts Cayley on the island, but I was wrong before. That's just judging from what I've witnessed of his interactions with people. I really have no clue.
Interesting times...

Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Mon, Feb 4, 2002
Happy birthday Mum! She's 43. Wow.

Started 2nd semester today. It's so odd having new classes - I feel like I should be writing "Sept" instead of "Feb"! My classes are all alright, I think. I've got Math with Mr Cook, whom I don't know anything about, and Beth, Hannah Huston, and Jay are in that class with me. It should be fun, anyway. I like Math. Then I've got Physics. Ick. I'm afraid I've got rather a hang-up about Physics. I'm convinced I can't do it. Guess all you can do is try. The teacher, Mr Wootton, seems really cool. He cracks the stupidest jokes, though. God! Bad puns like you wouldn't believe. He and Piers Anthony should get together, they'd have a blast! C Block is Biology with Mr Jones again, so that's safe. It's nice to have one teacher in common, at least. Katy's in both my sciences, which is good cause it means I have someone smart and serious but fun to do labs with. D-block is Socials with Ms Warren, which I suspect will be a drag. However, I do have a tendancy (as do we all) to make snap opinions of people - and listen too much to the opnions of others - often unfairly. So we'll see. Jay's the only person I really know in that class, although I like Matt Kelly all right, too.

So anyway. There's that. It's not really what I wanted to talk about..what I want to talk about is this silly questionnaire thing. I sort of want to brag, and just, well, discuss it, but I haven't anyone to talk to about it (unless I confide in Mum *haha*), so I'm going to have to rely on you. 
So, we made Kurt and Travis do the survey today at lunch. I don't think they should have done it together, cause it was obvious whose was whose, and I doubt they were entirely honest, but no matter. So here're the facts for the questions that count: of "our boys" - that's Eric, Kurt, Travis, and Jon, 2 (Jon and Eric) want Manda, one (Kurt) wants Cayley, and one (Travis) wants me. So you'd think that Manda won. (Not that it's a contest...or at least, I wouldn't admit that out loud to anyone). But. If you look at the 2nd question, all three guys who weren't Travis chose me for their second choice. All three! Travis's second choice was Cayley. Also, 3 out of 4 put me on their desert island (strangely enough, the only one who didn't was Travis - he put Cayley. Hmmm...) So, although Manda and Cayley tie in the Desirability department (Cayley got a first from Lance as well), I think I won overall (that's what I'm telling myself anyway.) There's no one else out of the five of us girls who was picked by every single one of those guys for at least one of those three questions. Not that it matters, of course, since I know that none of them (with the possible exception of Travis, who's frankly off his rocker) really want to sleep with or be with any of us really  anyway. Nevertheless, it's a nice little boost to the self-confidence, in my opinion. :)
Goodnight, Kitty. :) Autumnal (as in, feels like September!) smudges!!


Friday, Feb 08, 2002

We were at Jessica's house this evening. A slightly different group...all the usual girls (minus Lindsay) but the guys were Kurt, Eric, Eric Cook, and Aaron, another guy whom I think is in grade 12 and who hangs out in the same area of the cafeteria as us. Jessica broke up with Ken yesterday, so he wasn't there. She's been feeling guilty about it (Jessica feels guilty about everything), but everyone agrees it was a good move on her part. It was an odd situation, it made everyone uncomfortable, and he wasn't making her happy, so what was the point.

Travis wasn't there because he's been grounded for a month (as I may or may not have said before), but Jessica called him up (or he called her...?), and we all took turns talking to him over the phone. He's actually a really good conversationalist, which Cayley had said before but which I never really believed. He's great at filling in awkward pauses - there just aren't any! He can always think of something to talk about, and it's never boring. That's a great skill, and one I admire - and lack. Anyone who can carry on a comfortable conversation with me is really good! I have interesting ideas about things, and once you get me started, I can talk a lot... I guess I'm like a wind-up toy. I go great once I'm wound, but if no-one's there to start me I don't go much of anywhere. And Travis can do that. It's really neat! Still, I wished that he was with us, instead of just on the phone. I love having Travis there, to cuddle with and feel good around.

However, Eric actually managed to fill that position admirably today. He was being quite touch-y, especially after we dressed him up like a vampire and told him he was sexy. We all dressed up, actually. Jessica's got lots of good clothes. I wore this adorable (but kind of skanky) halter-top thing that Jessica had worn as part of a dance routine. It was red-orange and sparkly and exposed my midriff (like, it stopped at the bottom of my ribs), which was okay cause I was wearing my jeans. (Those are the only pants that I look good in topless.) It also had cute little black fringe-y things. It was really neat! I felt sexy (and slutty) in it...although I don't know where the slutty came from...I've been more topless than that in front of those boys. Anyway, Eric said that I looked good in it, which was really sweet - Eric never compliments anyone, particularly me. It made me feel good. And it seemed like he actually meant it...he kept looking at me - it was kinda cool! 

Jon wasn't there. Not sure why not, except I think it might have to do with the fact that Cayley really doesn't like him at the moment. She thinks he's arrogant and bossy and acts too superior - all of which is true. I still like him, though. I can't help it. I like practically everyone. However, I think that Jon doesn't like me. He said I was a bitch today - that's nothing, people always say that (particularly Eric), but I know they're joking and I don't mind. But I'm not sure at all that Jon was joking. I think he really thinks I'm mean. I mean, we do fight a lot [[Katy, that's not fighting; that's flirting!]] and that's mainly my fault (I suspect that, subconsciously, I initiate that because I'm physically attracted to him and have no other viable way of expressing that), but he hurts me as much as I hurt him. We're actually a fairly even match. But I am kind of mean to him - I don't mean it, of course - I never mean it - but maybe he doesn't see that. Anyway, I've got to talk to him about it. I don't want him - or anyone - to think I'm mean. I'm not - at least I don't mean to be.

*Sigh*. At least Eric makes me feel good about myself! :) Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Saturday, Feb 9, 2002

How did I manage to survive so many years without a group? It's amazing! I was just reading my journal from the beginning of last year, and there's no one. I never went out anywhere on the weekends. Ever. And I didn't feel at all hard done by. Now, I'm annoyed if we only get together one evening instead of two on the weekend. I don't think I've even really written about much of anything but Excuses and "Inter-group emotions" in ...well, weeks, at any rate. I'm so much more social than I was even a year ago. And now that I have that, I think I would really miss it if it left. I also really like having guy friends. That's a fairly new thing, as well. It adds a whole new dimension to things. Maybe when I (eventually) wind up going out with someone (I'm such a coward) it'll be a similar sort of discovery. [[RTE: almost exactly a year away! crazy!]] People - some of them, sometimes, anyway - really aren't all that bad. You know?
Goodnight, Kitty. :)


Friday, Feb 15, 2002

It was an absolutely gorgieous (I never know how to spell that word), wonderful, amazing day, today. It was clear, the sun was shining, and it was warm enough we didn't need jackets. The air smelled like spring - I love that smell! It's amazing, you really appreciate the sun in a climate like this. It's probably been at least 3 weeks since we last had a sunny day. Funny thing is, most of the time you don't realize you miss it, and then suddenly there it is, and it feels so wonderful. *Sigh*. 'Course, when the sun went down it got cold again, adn the rapid temperature change resulted in a heavy mist - as far as I can tell looking out the kitchen window, Terrace has been obliterated. Only the Bench remains. 

Awesome concert tonight - the Peters Drury Trio (plus one). They're these young (19-21) Jazz musicians from Whitehorse - very talented, very hip, and very classy. (Although the drummer's a bit - well, a lot - goofy!) And they seemed to be really enjoying themselves. This one rivals the Bill Hilly Band for Best Concert This Season, IMO (of course, they're completely different kinds of music.) There's still one more concert left to go, too. Lenny Gallant. However, I suspect he's going to wind up being a soulful, introspective singer-songwriter... that's fine in its place, and sometimes I really like it, but it can be really lame, too. Let's hope for the former.

Our figure skaters got their gold medal after all! Yay Canada!!
Gnight Kitty. :)


Thursday, Feb 21st, 2002

My ears are ringing. I shouldn't be writing. I should be sleeping. I'm going to regret this tomorrow morning (which is actually this morning, but who's counting?) But I have to write, ever so briefly, because my hormones are once again raging.

We had a dance tonight (hence the ringing ears); it was the first and last dance of the year, minus the prom, cause no one ever goes to dances at Cal. At first, this one looked like it was going to suck - you can't have a dance with less than 150 people. Eventually, however, the gym filled up - we wound up with probably 175 people. Not great, but hey. Not bad.
I actually started dancing almost right away, and it is fun, once you're doing it. I was wearing this sparkly fringed halter top of Jessica's, which was a poor judgement call on my part because I spent a lot of time feeling self-conscious. But it wound up okay.

That's not what I want to talk about. I want to talk about slowdancing. With Jon Rife.
We danced once at Lindsay's house about a month ago - very briefly, but it was good because we fit properly. So I was hoping he would ask me to slow dance this evening - he's the sort of person who would. However, I always wound up being on the other side of the gym when slow dances were called. I danced once with Travis, but he's too tall. It doesn't work.
So, the last fast dance (right before the last slow dance), I was dancing near him, and I concentrated al my thoughts on him: "Ask me, ask me!" And he did! So we danced...
And it was wonderful. We're the perfect size and shape for each other, we fit right into all the nooks and crannies. He's short enough that I can put my arms around him and lean my head on his shoulder. He's a really good guy to dance with cause he can lead - slow dancing doesn't require much effort cause basically all you do is rock back and forth, but he's very good at gently guiding with his body. He held me close, so there was no air visible between us, and we were touching pretty much along our entire lengths. We weren't grinding or anything, just...touching. Gently. That's a very compelling feeling, very comfortable and sexy. And Jon's such a good person to hold. I didn't want the song to end. But it did. They always do. I don't know if he reacted as strongly to that as I did, but I'll have to make him dance with me again, regardless.

NID tomorrow, but I have to teach at nine, and I have my French test (EEP!) at 11. Wish me a ton of luck - I'm gonna need it.
Sexy, hormonal smudges. :)

Thursday, January 24, 2002

She died in a car crash today. The news still hasn't really registered. The words just bounce off...
They told us this afternoon in B-Block - Stagecraft. Well, no, actually, they didn't tell us. But as soon as one person says something, everyone knows. We heard it from Chris, who went to the washroom and heard it from someone (everyone) in the hallway. When he said it, my first thought was "It's not true." It couldn't be true; it was just gossip, conjecture, it wasn't confirmed. Then gradually people burst into tears and left. At 2:00 the principal, Mr Straker, called an end to B-Block and asked the teachers to meet in the staffroom. He said that the next class would start at the regular time, 2:12. To my knowledge, it never did. I had CAPP, and Mr Walker was there, but he said we weren't doing anything - he expected hardly anyone to show up. And really, how can you expect people to come to class when something like that has happened? I've never seen the halls of Caledonia so quiet - the only sound was crying, and whispers. No one laughed, no one shouted, no one swore. People were clustered in little groups holding each other, and the teachers were moving between them. The guidance counsellors from Skeena were there, and Mrs MacLoed was hugging everyone.

I couldn't cry. I still can't. I can't believe any of it - and I can't stop thinking about it. My mind will wander, I'll be distracted by something, but then those words will repeat themselves like a hammer in my brain. Hannah Kantola is dead.
Hannah. It's unthinkable. She was the lead actress in our musical this year. She's pretty, funny, bright, a good singer and actress, she's 17 - and she's dead. End of story. She was one of the most alive people I knew. I didn't know her well - I may have talked to her all of five times in my life - but that doesn't seem to matter. She was a person - a vibrant, friendly person - and now she just doesn't exist. She doesn't exist. It doesn't matter how well I knew her, all that matters is I did know her.

How can I talk about a person my age in the past tense? It seems so odd. I know things like this happen to people all over the world all the time, and I know this is a cliche, but...it's not the sort of thing that happens to you, you know? It happens to someone else...
Seems to me that this town has had its share of tragedy. Two or three years ago now, the same thing happened, and 2 Caledonia students - Lauralee and a Belgian exchange student - were both killed. Why is that allowed to happen? Who the hell's running this fucking universe, anyway?

Hannah Kantola's dead. The thing that that really brings home is, if it was her, it could have been anyone. It could have been Cayley, or Tyra, or Manda, or Jon or Eric or, or, or. Anyone. I can't cry but I can grieve, and if I feel her death this strongly, I can only imagine what her family and her close friends are going through. Fuck! It's too close to home. I saw her in the hallway yesterday, and envied her, just for a moment. She was so pretty...was. Today at lunch we were looking through Jon's photos from the production. She was so very alive...

Gawd.


Friday, January 25, 2002

(School today was really depressing) - people were breaking down all over the place. In every class, the teachers told us that if we needed to leave to cry, or talk to a counsellor, or whatever, we were welcome to. I didn't, but lots of people did. My CAPP class, our double-block today, was full of production students, and they were all gone. Most people just clustered in the hallways, crying. They've erected what amounts to a shrine by her locker - I haven't had the strength to go and see it yet. Her memorial service will be held next Wednesday afternoon. It's at the REMLee - they were going to use the E-Free, but Ms MacLoed was afraid it wouldn't be big enough. I teach Wednesday, but I'm going to move my students so that I can go.

I wish I believed in God. It would be so comforting to know, beyond a doubt, that she is in a better place. I've never really understood religion before, but now I think I do. That must be one of the main reasons why religion developed - it's just too awful to think about otherwise. I can't believe that she's gone completely, though, all the same. I mean, there can't just be nothing - it doesn't make sense. It's unthinkable. Maybe when we die we become part of everything. I dunno.

Her body will be cremated, and her ashes sent to New York - she always wanted to go there. Her parents are setting up a Fine Arts Scholarship in her name, which I think is a wonderful idea. I feel terrible for her family and close friends. This has hit me hard, and I barely knew her - they must be devastated. I think the person I feel most sorry for, though, is Kim Rooker, the driver of the car. She's in the hospital in Vancouver, in stable condition (whatever that means). I don't know if she's regained consciousness yet, but just think about when she does. Imagine being the driver of a car in which your best friend died. How could you deal with that. I'd almost rather die myself. Even if it wasn't your fault (and it wasn't) and nothing you could do would have prevented it, the guild would still be massive. The police are blaming it on road conditions and "driver inexperience", but that's shit. I saw the film of the road, adn that accident could have happened to anyone, regardless of how long they'd been driving. I just hope no one says anything like that to Kim.

We got together this evening and tried to be happy; sometimes that worked and sometimes it didn't. Whenever a sad song played, Eric started crying, and then Katy and Lindsay would start. Even I, who have such difficulty crying, had tears in my eyes. It was a good thing to do, though. No one should be alone in their grief, and brooding is unhealthy. 
We've had such a disrupted week. It seems like small news now, but there was a fire in the Gym on the weekend, and school was closed Monday so they could clean it up. Wednesday was the Bc Student Walkout - in which I did not take part - and then Thursday was the tagedy. Next Monday the teachers are staging a walkout, so we won't have school again. I feel really sorry for the people writing Provincial exams. Provincials can't be delayed, because everyone in the province has to write them simultaneously - that means people had to write exams today, despite the terrible events. I just can't imagine having to write an exam in this climate - I could barely concentrate on my own trivial assignments. The Grade 12's have to come in on Monday too to write Provincials, despite the Teacher Walkout - I only have 2 exams, C and D block (Chem and English), and they're  both on Tuseday. I get the rest of next week off. Hopefully by the time classes resume two Mondays from now, things will have returned to some semblance of order.

Sad, crazy times, Kitty. Gnite.

Saturday, Jan 26, 2002
Parents are evil. I mean, not really, but they do like to gossip about their children. Mum and Dad had a wine-tasting party (silly concept) this evening, and Kim and Gord (Eric's parents) were among the guests. I was evesdropping - and they were talking about us! I figure if a conversation is about me, I have a right to hear it. So I did. Apparently when Gord drove Eric and Travis home from Lindsay's last night, they were talkign about my squealing. Yes, okay, I admit it, I squeal and moan and generally make fairly sexual noises when I'm getting a massage. I like massages to hurt, and when someone's pressing that hard on your back, noises get squeezed out. So anyway, everyone was terribly amused with this tendancy of mine last night (they laughed at me), and Eric and Travis collaborated to see what noises they could make me make (different areas and different motions illicit different responses.) So Gord told my mum about this. Well, thanks. Yes, and it's clear that we were all at least semi-topless. Well, so what? I'm not ashamed of my upper body! I had a bra on. Rrgh. Anyway. Stupid parents. They shouldn't share information. So it seems like they're expecting us all to pair up and start sleeping with each other any day now. It was at that point that I wanted to inject myself into the conversation and tell them not bloody likely! We talk about it enough, but none of those guys are really interested in any of us, except Travis, who doesn't count. So it couldn't actually go anywhere. They shouldn't worry - we're all perfectly innocent, really.

...Happier and sadder, better and worse. It comes and goes - sometimes it's so strong it almost overwhelms me - I nearly cried again today - and sometimes I almost forget, which of course makes me feel even guiltier when suddenly it comes back. And then everything feels trivial and petty. *Sigh* Goonight, Kitty.

Sundae (!!) Jan 27, 2002
Wow, Travis was so HOT today. I mean, really. Jon wasn't there, but if I'd had to revise my "Sexiest" list on the spot, I would have put Travis at the top, no question. I'm not sure what it was...partly the attitude, I guess. He was being Nice Travis, which is always good. And his hair was really sexy today. Also, he was wearing his Gay sweater, which always makes him look hot. (Don't ask why, it just does.) Makes him look sort of sensual and brooding. And he does have nice features...sometimes. He's got beautiful, long-lashed eyes, and a very sensual mouth (sort of pouty), although his nose is a bit silly. But Gawd! He's definately too thin, but I could have overlooked that tonight - and I'm not even ovulating. If only he looked like that all the time. Mmm... :)

I've been losing weight. Slowly, but I definately notice. I lose about a pound a week, and that's been constant for a few weeks. Right now I'm at 133 lbs - that's the lightest I've been in at least 3 years! And it feels so good - I almost like my body now!
Lots to do tomorrow. I didn't really do anything today, but Tuesday I've got my finals in English and Chem, so tomorrow I actually have to study. Also, I've got CAPP and Stagecraft assignments to finish for Tuesday. And I rescheduled Darren and Jenny in for tomorrow - Hannah's funeral is on Wednesday afternoon, and I want to go (everyone needs closure), so I had to rearrange my students.

And so it goes...
Gnight, Kitty. :)

Monday, January 28/02
Wish me luck on my exams!!

Wednesday, Jan 30, 2002
The funeral service was today. The REM Lee was packed - Hannah always like a full house, as Mrs MacLoed pointed out. It was very teary. I cried, really cried - like honest-to-goodness truly tears - for the first time today. It was quiet crying of course, but I almost wished I was home, because if I'd let myself go at that point I would have bawled - and that probably would have been good for me. But I couldn't break down there, not in fron tof so many people.I think the parts where I cried the hardest were when Adam Kerby sang a song that he had written for her, and then, of course, when Ms MacLoed gave her speech. That was the worst. There was a lot of God-y stuff which I stoicly endured, about her being an angel with the Lord now, and all that. I'm sorry, but I just can't buy it. I truly wish I could, but there's something fundamental there in that blind faith that just doesn't sit right with me.
They read an excerpt from her journal, and that made me cry too. She was so positive, so bright and happy. It made me think...
