If I died tomorrow and people looked through my journals, what would they find? Not much. I complain an awful lot both in writing and in reality, and for the most part it's about petty, trivial things. I'm never particularly positive...although I'm not usually excessively negative, either. My glass contains equal parts gas and liquid. Hannah's glass "was half-full, thank you very much, and refills are free!" It makes me feel almost guilty. Guilty to be alive, I guess, when such a wonderful person as Hannah is dead. It doesn't seem right. It isn't right. And there's not a fucking thing anyone can do about it.

Funerals are supposed to help you reach a catharsis, bring closure. I'm not sure it did. I cried, and that was good, but it'll be a long time before things stop reminding me of her constantly. And maybe that's a good thing.
Gnite, Kitty.

Thursday, Jan 31, 2002
We had an excuse at Manda's house tonight. Seems like it's always at Manda's. It was kind of dumb though - the only guys there were Kurt and Eric. You know, I'm really not very comfortable around Kurt, and I'm not sure why. The rest of the guys are fine...Jon's harmless, Travis is straightforward and easy to understand, and Eric's just a comfortable person all the way round. But Kurt - I dunno. He confuses me. I can't read him, I don't understand him, I can't see what he's thinking. He doesn't communicate, doesn't express himself verbally, and he's so closed off physically that I can't figure him out that way either. He's intellectually a very interesting person...but what does he feel? This lack of communication really weirds me out, especially be everyone else in that group is so easy to read. Everyone communicates their feelings somehow, whether they mean to or not. Except Kurt. And it's driving the Analyst in me crazy!
'S funny, but evenings never seem as interesting if Travis isn't there. This sounds kind of odd, but...I find myself doing things for him somehow. As Tyra put it, 'Hey, Travis is already my bitch, let's see how far we can reel him in!" That sounds cruel, cause really I'm not particularly interested in him, but it's interesting to experiment. I mean, I know he's attracted to me, for whatever unfathomable reason, adn it's fun to see where I can take that. What will he notice? How can I capture his attention? The other guys aren't interested in my anyway, so there's no point, but with Travis it's fun. Jon's fun too, cause he reciprocated. But when it's just Eric and Kurt there, it's...well, dull, in a way.

Tomorrow evening people are coming over here, which means I have to get my act together and clean up this room. It's been undergoing renovations (mainly of the "wall collage" variety) and at the moment there're papers and junk all over the floor nd the bed (and the walls, for that matter.) I've also made up an anonymous questionnaire (to see what we really think of each other) and that should be fun, if confusing. I'm not sure yet how we're going to orchestrate it, but I'm sure we'll manage. We always do.
G'night, Kitty!! :)

January 1, 2002 (Tues) New Years!
Happy new year! I guess this is what you would call the official start of this journal, since the date on the front says 2002. 
Another year. Man. (And a palyndrome - how 'bout that?! Won't happen until 2112!!) Seems odd to me. I guess I should make New Years Resolutions or something. I had a good one, but I forget what it was - oh yeah. Actually, there's two of them:

1. I will do at least one French lesson a week (on average...hey, let's be reasonable here!) until I finish the Gr11 course.
2. I will go to the pool and actually SWIM LAPS every Tuesday possible.

That'll do for a start, don't you think? ...I suppose I should be at least a little tipsy, but I don't really think I am. I had part of a Margarita,some EggNog, and a couple of half-glasses of Champagne. Since I don't drink, that should be enough for there to be some consequence. Unfortunately, there's no snow, so we can't go write "2002" on all the car windows. A shame.

Gosh, I'm tired. If I was at home, I'd either have been at Tyra's or Jon's. That would be fun. But this is fun, too. Martina and I did "girl-talk" - I told her about Travis (and the possibility of Jon) and she told me about this guy, Joe, a friend of Paul's who likes her. Paul's got a girlfriend, by the way. Can you imagine?! I mean, actually going out with Paul?! Apparently she's got him totally whipped - like that's a change; his sisters have had him whipped for eventeen years! Oh well, it's good for him.

Ugg, I'm tired. It's 2:30/3 in the morning. I'll write tomorrow (althoughit'll probably still be today...)
Gnite, Kitty! :)
Wednesday, Jan 2, 2002
I shouldn't really be writing at all - I should be sleeping, and I'll most likely regret this foolish behaviour on the morrow (I have a piano lesson at 9:30.) However, I'm perfectly capable of ignoring that, so long as the punishment for my crimes is several hours away as yet. (That, incidently, is the easiest way to procrastinate successfully, as far as I'm concerned.)

Funny how someone with a girlfriend becomes instantly less interesting. I never had a crush on Paul (well, not since Gr 8, and that didn't count), and I would never seriously consider him as a likely candidate for - well, anything - but he was still amusing to think about, and to practise "charms" on - and, well, now he isn't. It's frankly boring. *Sigh*.

Speaking of, umm, that sort of thing, I wrote Travis a song today. (Aww!) Well, Lyrics, anyway. Not that he'll ever see it, and it's a bit over the top (in order to be poetry material it has to be exciting!), but I needed to write it anyway. It's called "Thank You"and now I'm officially out of room in that lab notebook. I'll have to find another place for poetry.

Went to see Monsters, Inc today. It was cute - I think those computer graphics are so neat; it's amazing what they can do, really. My favourite part, though, was teh Pixar short at the beginning, about birds.

Manda's having a "party" - in quotes cause it's really just an excuse to hang out - on Friday evening. I don't know whether it's everyone or just girls (more fun with everyone), but if she's inviting the guys then she's chosen the wrong night. That's their D&D day. Kurt and Eric might come (they - well, Kurt; Eric was sick) came to Cayley's thing), but Travis won't come. He's in Asshole Mood at the moment. It'll pass... it always does...
Gnight, Kitty. :)

Friday, Jan 4, 2002
...Knowing someone has a crush on you is just about the best feeling in the world, in my opinion. This opinion was reconfirmed this evening at Manda's Excuse. (That's what I've decided to call our directionless, pointless get-togethers.) Travis was there, and God, he's so sweet. It made me feel so good just to know that he likes me - and he definately still does, I'm sure of it. I guess it kind of sucks for him, but it makes me happy! Yes, that's extremely selfish, I know, but I can't help it. And heck, I've liked 5 guys in a rowwho didn't like me back. It's not like it's the end of the world. Nor does he seem particularly perturbed, just kind of...broody.

Eric was there too. It was nice to see him again; he wasn't there the last couple days of school, so it really has been a while. He's so nice when he's nice (of course, he's also an asshole when he's an asshole, but thankfully that's not most of the time). He's a great person to have as a friend - he'll actually, like, talk to us and stuff, and he's very good about letting us dress him up! Kurt and Jon weren't there - Jon hurt himself snowboarding, and Kurt's still not back from wherever he is.

But I'm so glad Travis likes me! It makes me feel...noticed. And needed. It's a wonderful feeling. :)
Warm and fuzzy smudges, Kitty. :)

Friday, Jan 10, 2002
Another emotionally charged evening. (I'm sorry I don't write during the week, but it's just always so busy...) We had another Excuse at Manda's this evening, but this time with practically everybody there. Manda (of course), Tyra, Cayley, me, Eric, Kurt, Jon, and Travis. Jessica was at Lindsay's house, and Lindsay wasn't invited. It was good to have all the guys = it meant we had an even male/female ratio. So we hung out and played stupid, hormonal, sexually-frustrated teenager games. Honestly, I'm embarassed for us - and yet still it's fun.

Mainly we played Turth or Dare and Suck & Blow. Things came to a head (no innuendo intended) when Travis picked Truth, and some idiot - I forget who - asked him the One Night Stand question. Basically, if you could have a one-night stand with anyone in the room with no problems as a result (ie no pregnancy, no STDs, no emotional difficulties) who would it be? And someone asked travis. Grr! Like, talk about forcing the issue. Everyone in the room already knewthe answer anyway; there was no reason for him to have to say it aloud. Actually, if it was up to me, we'd never mention it at all while we were both peresent in the room, and everyone could just forget about it. Of course, that isn't likely to happen. So anyway - he didn't want to say it, but finally did. "I'm sorry, Caitlin, but it would have to be you." I was torn between extreme embarassment and happiness at this confirmation. Embarassment won, though, at least for the moment.

Then, of course, no one could just leave well enough alone. I wish they'd put themselves in one of our places for a moment. The whole things was acutely embarassing for me, and I'm sure it could only be worse for Travis. Then while Travis was in the washroom, Cayley asked me a really difficult truth. "If Travis were to ask you out right now, would you say Yes?" Well = I honestly don't know. I had to tell her that. Ultimately, I hope not to have to deal with that particular situation, at least not right now. But if he did, I really don't know how I'd respond. I'd probably mutter some excuse - or maybe I'd agree, just out of pity. It's impossible to say.

So it was kind of an embarassing evening - but fun, nonetheless. It's always fun. And I got to cuddle! That goes a long way to redeeming any situation. I cuddled with Jon, and Travis, and Eric. Basically, anyone who'd let me. I was in a very huggy mood.

But geez. I don't know how this Travis thing's gonna work out. I really hope he doesn't go and complicate things by asking me out or something silly like that. *Sigh*
Emotionally fraught smudges. :)

Saturday, Jan 11, 2002
I was thinking about this today, and here's the question: why on earth would I go out with Travis? I mean, consider it - we have, like, nothingin common, except that we have the same friends. None of our interests are the same, none of our preferences (ie books, movies, music) are the same, and Travis doesn't even have views on issues. What would we talk about, for crying out loud? It's stupid. The relationship would be purely physical. And as regards that, I don't even find Travis particularly attractive - he's not repulsive, certainly ; but if I ranked our 4 guys in order of sex appeal, Travis would be at the bottom. (In case you're wondering - as if it isn't obvious - that list would go Jon, Kurt, Eric, Travis). I mean, I'm very flattered that he likes me (and a fair bit puzzled - there are so many thin, popular, unattainable girls in our school - why would anyone have a crush on me?!), but I don't think a relationship between us could work.

Beth's birthday party was tonight. We watched The Fast and the Furiousand Summer Catch. The main character in The Fast and the Furiouswas SO fucking hot! The movie was pretty dopey, but I would have watched it for another 2.5 hours just to keep looking at him. Summer Catch starred Freddie Prinze, Jr, who's pretty cute, but he's got absolutely nothing on the first guy. Wow. We were all drooling.
Hormonal (as usual) smudges!! Gnight, Kitty. :)

Thursday, Jan 17/02
This is a wierd pen. I don't really understand it -since it's new and on soft paper, it should write fine, but that doesn't seem to be the case. Anyway. I swear I had something realy to talk about this evening, but now I've completely forgotten it. Oh well...I'll just keep writing as events/thoughts surface.

Lost my keys. I haven't seen them since I got back from Beth's on Saturday. Thing is, hey must be here - I only take my keys with me when I'm driving, and I couldn't possibly forgetthem anywhere, because I need them in order to drive back. But they are nowhere, I swear it! We've looked "in all the kinds of places hat a [keyring] might be near, and we made the sort of noises that a [keyring] likes to hear." But to no avail. It's most frustrating.

Started going swimming again. Gawd, there are muscles there that I'd forgotten I had - but I remember now! It feels so good to swim; like I'm actually accomplishing something. I feel thin when I'm swimming. My piano exam for Grade 9 is on Saturday. Eek! I guess I'm ready, but I'm not confidant. Oh well. I will survive.

We got a CD burner. It's very cool.

I'd write more (I do have more I could write) but a) I'm having trouble staying awake (didn't get enough sleep last night - as usual), and b) it's a NID tomorrow and I have to do a make-up lesson with Myranda at 10am (an ungodly hour.) So I'm gonna stop. Watched a weird but cool movie this evening, called The Usual Suspects.

I have so much to do this weekend it's almost funny. Not. *(Sigh)*.
Stressed smudges, Kitty. :)

Friday, Jan 18/02
Well. I'd never taken off my shirt (with a bra on, of course) in front of a guy before. Until today. Now both Jon and Eric have seen me (and Cayley and Tyra an dManda) in bras only. Not sure how that happened exactly - it was mainly incidental, at least at first. It worked both way, though, at least - we had Jon down to his boxers - only - for a while there. And we dressed Eric up and he was so fucking HOT! I've never found Eric particularly attractive before, but wow! He looked like Spike, the demon/vampire/whatever from Buffy the Vampire Slayer, except without the bleached hair. It was really cool. And Jon, of course, was entirely edible - he's got a really cute body; shame he's so sensitive about showing it off.

Manda got her "N" on Wednesday, BTW. We went "cruising" this evening in our two cars - a stupid pasttime (Kurt and Travis weren't there, in case you were wondering. Not sure why). I have my Gr0 piano exam tomorrow afternoon! Eeek! It's extremely scary. Please wish me good luck = exams are always nerve-wracking, and let me tell you, my nerves are wracked!
More (equally) stressed smudges, Kits. :)

Saturday, Jan 19/02
Ok, well, Cayley said I should analyze this, adn I think she's right - it's crush analysis time.
I'm talking about the Jon thing, of course. It's really a tough call. I think that - technically - I do have a crush on him, of sorts. I'md definately physically attracted to him - his face isn't always cute and his hair isn't great, but I love his body. It's partially the short thing, I guess, but not entirely. He's slim, but not skinny like the rest of our guys. That's part of it. Skinny is bad. Also, he reciprocates touching I've said this before, I know, but it's seriously amazing - like he initiates stuff! He likes touching. I think that if I do like him, then it stems from that - he respects all girls = he's very courteous and he always knows the right thing to say - and he's willing to hold anyone. I'm sure it's at least partially a front, of course, but he's really nice. He makes me feel more desirable than I am. {{REAL-TIME EDIT: Oh my god! My 16 year old self is insane! Yeah, right, cause boys in generally obviously *don't* want to touch girls. And Jon is the MOST COURTEOUS of them because he DOES flirt with everybody? I still find that flattering, but...good lord, how times change. And..."more desirable than I am"?? *hits former self*}}

He's got a brain, too. I mean, his marks aren't anything to brag about, but that's cause he's lazy, not stupid. He really thinks about things. (Yes, I know I'm being repetitive...just bear with me). He's got, like, political and religious opinions. Which he voices! He's actually a really interesting person to talk to.

So, I can see why I would like him. Thing is, though, it really doesn't feel like a crush...I mean, I've been through this 6 times before; I ought to know what it feels like. And this isn't it. Maybe it just needs time to develop. I have a suspicion that a lot of the "throw-myself-at-Jon" thing (which I have been doing, to a certain extent) stems from my uncomfortability with the Travis issue. Not sure how that works, but that's the feeling I get. >ike I'm trying to free myself from association with him, or something - that sounds really mean, but there it is. Gotta say, though, that I don't think the taking off my shirt thing had anything to do with Jon. That was a me thing only. It's liberating, or something. An expression of the comfort I feel with my body...at least, my upper body. Once I had done it once, I wanted to do it again - and just leave it off. I think I could be a nudist if I put my mind to it.

Anyway, there it is, so far. In other news...my piano exam went really well, I felt. She asked really easytechnique. Like, really easy. The formula pattern she asked was E+, which is the easiest formula ever, bar none (including C+). Of course, I still screwed it up. Oh well. My pieces were all really good, especially the Prelude and Fuge. I think that's the best I've ever played it. And the sight reading and playback were good too...not sure about the ear training, but then, I wasn't expecting much from it. At least it's over - I'm so relieved!
Happy smudges, Kitty. :)

Themes: mostly Travis (the plot thickens!) and Jon.

Dec 25, 2001
So Christmas has come and gone again...it's been doing that with remarkabe rapidity of late; it seems like it was just *last* Christmas, and now here it is again. It was as excessive as usual, of course. Actually, it almost sickens me at times to think of all the money and resources we waste on useless frivolities. (That doesn't, of course, stop me from accepting my gifts, more's the pity.) But it really is a beautiful time - it's nice to be with family and to see people's reactions to your gifts to them. It's always a nice feeligns when you've pleased somebody.

Christmas dinner was equally excessive. Someday we (or our descendants) will regret the amount of food we now squander needlessly; nevertheless it tasted really good! And the trifle was especially excellent.

I don't really have anything of import to say...I just had to start this new journal. I'm reading a really good book right now. It's called "A Game of Thrones" by George RR Martin. It was my gift in the Secret Santa thing we did (mine was Kurt, and his was me, oddly enough). It's an epic fantasy novel - similar in scope to the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy, but a totally different sort of storyline. Each chapter of the book is told from the point of view of one of the (many) main characters. It's also the first book in a trilogy, which is dangerous cause I don't have either of the sequels. It's a neat book, anyway. Different from anything I've read recently.

Tomorrow I think we're hiking the mountain behind the house, and Thursday (27th) we're going to the the "Fellowship fo the Ring" movie in a theatre that actually has a big screen and comfortable seats! I'm so excited! :)

Season's Greetings, Kitty - Merry Christmas.
G'nite.

Dec 26, 2001 - Boxing Day
Days go by so quickly, it's easy to see how a mere 365 of them can be gone in the blink of an eye...today was no different. I accomplished next to nothing- although I did do a thorough (and long overdue) piano practice. January 19th is only 23 fractions of an eye-blink away, and I have to know those pieces.! I get stressed just thinking about it. 

We had guests for dinner - Nana and Papa's next-door neighbours, who own what used to be Bruce and Anita's house. Lowell and I were banished cause there wasn't enough room at the table, which was fine. It's actually been a long time since they banished us. Just to make up for it, we acted particularly childish! (After the guests were gone, of course.) And I fell down the stairs; that was fun. No sprained ankles though, thankfully.

I wish I had things to write about, but I really don't. Nothing interesting. (Oh yes, and it's SO interesting to write about not having anythign interesting to say.) Mum just came in to tell me to go to sleep, and that we weren't reallybad children. (I guess she was having an attack of guilt or something.)

...I don't even have anything profound to say - how stupid is that?! (Very stupid, Caitlin.) Great, now she's talking to herself. I really need to get more sleep - and eat less chocolate! :p Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Thursday, Dec 27, 2001
I'm going to try not to write for very long tonight, cause we're really (honest-to-goodness) going on a hike tomorrow, fairly early. WE meant to yesterday, adn then we meant to today, but it never actually got organized. But tomorrow for sure! (That's their story and they're sticking to it.)

Tried to go see Lord of the Rings tonight in a big theatre in Kelowna, but by the time we got there, it was sold out. So we bought tickets to go tomorrow afternoon. It's kind of cruel, but I'm sort of looking forward to bragging cause I got to see it early and in a nice theatre. IT's supposed to be a really good movie - apparently it's the book (Fellowship of the Ring only) verbatim. Which is good, but makes for a long film. (3+ hours...like Titanic!) Anyway, I'm really looking forward to finally seeing it.

I think I must be ovulating. I've had those sorts of thoughts in my head today. I was thinking of Travis, oddly enough. It's just such a nice feeling, knowing somebody has a crush on you...it's a reassurance that at least somebody cares. ...Although, I think he may not like me anywmore - or at least, he's trying to get over it. See, Tyra told him that she told me that he like me (she was feeling guilty, understandably), and he hasn't really acted the same around me since. It's like he's embarassed that I know. And I can respect that; I mean, if I liked someone and that person knew it, I'd be embarassed around them to. But from this side, it's not at all embarassing. (Actually, come to think of it, Cayley's crush on Kurt completely faded - she forced it to - once she found out that he knew.) He's been avoiding me the last couple of weeks at school. It's kind of cute, in a sad sort of way. I think he's afraid I'll bring it up, or something - which is ridiculous of course; I'd never have the guts. Thing is, though, it would probably be good for us to bring it out in the open and talk it through. More comfortable for everyone. But I don't think either of us is going to make that move. Oh well. I almost wish we could go back to before I knew, and before I knew he knew. I mean, it's great just knowing he likes me, but he was way sweeter before it all came out.

Anyway. Enough hormonal babble. I've got more I couldsay, but it can hold and I need to get to sleep. Why is it that I have too much to say when I don't have time and not enough to say when I do? 
Goodnight, Kitty. :)

Friday, Dec 28, 2001
Well, ironically enough, we didn't wind up doing our hike up the mountain today, even though we'd been talking about it for a week and today was our last chance. We just put it off a day too long - this morning when we woke up it was snowing fit to burst and you couldn't see past the driveway. And after 5 days of lovely weather too...it's like Murphy's Law or something. So instead we hung around and read books and played the piano and talked like we usually do. And packed - we're leaving first thing tomorrow.

We did, however, see the Lord of the Rings movie this evening; and it was awesome. Three hours long, and I wasn't bored for an instant. The characters were really well done - I especially liked the way they did Sarumen. I had some difficulty with Frodo - all the hobbits in the movie, himself included, had quite cute, child-like features. My mental image of Frodo looks exactly like Marc Atkinson (the mandolin player from the Bill Hilly band); a sort of rugged, seen-troubles look...definately not child-like. But it didn't take long to adjust, and after a while I didn't mind at all.

The did stick to the plot pretty honestly - however, they stillleft out Tom Bombadil and the Barrow-whytes. I can understand why: if the movie's already three hours long and you have to cut something, that's the only major section you can take out that doesn't affect the plot. Tom Bombadil is a great character, but really it's a cameo part. Oh well. The special effects were superb! The Nhaz-ghul and the Uruk-hai were reallycreepy, and the Mines of Moria were very cool. There was lots of magnificent architecture; it was really quite a beautiful movie. 

One critic, according to Riley, thinks that the relationship between the hobbits - and between Gandalf and Frodo (!!) was "homo-erotic." !!! What?! I think somebody's reading way to deeply into things, if you ask me. I guess the hobbits touch each other a lot - inasfar as Merry holds Pippin to comfort him after Gandalf "dies" and Frodo hugs Sam at the end of the film - but I saw nothing homosexual in it at all; that's just silly.

I do hope that it hasn't come to Terrace yet, partly so I can have gloating rights, and partly cause I want to go see it again with all of my friends. It was a great movie, and I don't think they truly could have done a better job of it. Even the absence of Tom Bombadil is acceptable, because of how wonderful the movie was in every other respect. 

Oh hey, here's a political tidbit for you. Our esteemed leader, George W., announced today that "we don't know whether Osama's hiding in a cave with the door open or with the door closed, but we do know that he's no longer a parasite on the AFghan host." Aren't you enlightened and reassured? Aren't you relieved that we have men like that running the world?
Cynical smudges...goodnight, Kitty. :)

Saturday, Dec 29, 2001
Home, sweet, stressful home. God, we haven't been here 4 hours, and already I'm stressed again. Sometimes I wish I could just live in permanent limbo, with no concerns or responsiblities - or at least that I could successfully ignore the ones I do have, which lots of people seem to be able to do. But not I. I've got French and Piano and CAPP and...god, I dont' even want to think about it. So I won't - for the moment.

I've got an Arrogant Worms song from their new album, Idiot Road, stuck in my head. It's called "Boy Band", and it sounds for all the world like a Backstreet Boys song - like "I Want It That Way." It kinda fits my mood (not my stressed mood, my hormonal mood, although I suspect the two are related), actually. I've got my stupid period (again) so my hormones are all in overdrive. It sounds rude and distasteful to say I'm "horny" (I suspect that's a word of Anglo-Saxon origin, if it isn't just slang), but that's really a pretty accurate assessment of my physical mood. My body wants to have sex - which is perverse of it, since it's currently busy shedding all my baby cushioning, but I guess it figures once we start we might continue. At any rate, the mental outcome of this is that I'm thinking about boys, and about sex. I think I'm going through guy withdrawal. Our guy sare all pretty much lost causes anyway (and I wonder how they'd appreciate being called "our" guys? No matter...), but it's still good to be around them. I haven't been around other teenagers in a whole week! Imagine. Except for at the movie last night, of course, but that didn't really count. Sigh. And then on Monday, of course, we're going to Rupert for New Years, which means Paul. My feelings towards him vary every time I see him, mostly according to the time of the month = and his actions, of course. Anyway, if he's not being a total asshole (which he often is, nowadays - it's a teenage thing) he's interesting. ...Oh, whatever. Just ignore me - this'll pass soon enough. G'night, Kitty. :)


Sunday, Dec 30, 2001
...But it is nice to be home again, for all that. I moved my room all around today - it was long overdue for a change. (As is this pen. Hmmm...) Anyway. Yeah. Now my dresser's where my beanbag chair used to be, and my bookshelf (the little grey one) is where my shelf-table (the old baby changetable) was. I kicked out the change-table and the beanbag chair. I did like having the chair in here, but it smelled more and more like cat pee and just wasn't pleasant any longer. I figure we can leave it in the cat room and let Sasha sleep on it. And the change-table was just taking up space. There was certainly stuff on it, but nothing that a different home couldn't be found for. And now I've got tons more room. It's really amazing how much floor space can be taken up by two not-very-large objects. It'll be hard to adjust to for a little while, but I think it's a good change.

Listened to The Barenaked Ladies practically all day while I was cleaning my room, and I now know at least the chorus of every song on the album. I love their stuff! It's really catchy, but it's also got quite clever lyrics, and the rhythms and tunes are complex. Also, their songs are very varied...there aren't really two that are alike on the whole CD. At the moment my favourite song (but it's a tough choice, even this early) is "Falling for the First Time", which is about a perfectionist who discovers the joys of failing (nwo why does this resonate with me?) :P

Going to Rupert tomorrow. I don't really want to. I mean, it's nice seeing the Gemmells and all, but it's kind of nice just being home. Of course, if we did stay home, I probably would wind up being social anyway. I think Tyra's doing a New Years thing for whoever's here.

Seems hard to believe it's another year already. Wasn't it just last Christmas? Didn't we just do all this? *Sigh*. Time scares me. It's just moving so fast - before I know it, I'll be old and my life will be spent. Seems like everytime I blink, we've spun around the sun again. (Sounds like lyrics to a song. Hmmm...!!)
Anyway, gnite, Kitty. I'll bring this to Rupert and write there...but probably not til after midnight, so Happy New Year!! Goodnight. :)

Themes: Travis, Lord of the Rings, Christmas
